packages.preInstallNotes:
Note that the ArangoDB DCOS Service is beta and there may be bugs, incomplete features, incorrect documentation or other discrepancies.
The default configuration requires 4 nodes each with 1.0 CPU shares, 1GB of memory and 1GB of disk.

master.description: The URL of the Mesos master. The format is a comma-delimited list of hosts like zk://host1:port,host2:port/mesos. If using ZooKeeper, pay particular attention to the leading zk:// and trailing /mesos! If not using ZooKeeper, standard URLs like http://localhost are also acceptable.

zk.description: ZooKeeper URL for storing state. Format: zk://host1:port1,host2:port2,.../path. Please note that the id is appended to the path.

webui-host.description: For debugging: use this host for WEBUI request.

framework-port.description: Framework port, use '0' to let Mesos select a port for you.

framework-cpus.description: cpus resources needed for each framework instance.

framework-mem.description: mem resources needed for each framework instance.

framework-instances.description: number of instances of the framework to run.

framework-user.description: user under which to run the framework tasks

volume-path.description: Path for persistent data (until persistent volumes are available).

principal.description: Principal for persistent volumes

async-replication.description: Whether we do asynchronous replication, possible values: "true", "false"

role.description: Role for framework

minimal-resources-agent.description: Minimal mesos resources for an agent

minimal-resources-coordinator.description: Minimal mesos resources for a coordinator

minimal-resources-dbserver.description: Minimal mesos resources for a DBserver

minimal-resources-secondary.description: Minimal mesos resources for a secondary DBserver

failover-timeout.description: Timeout after which an automatic failover is done.

mesos-authenticate.description: If true use authentication with Mesos master.

secret.description: Secret for authentication with Mesos.

secondaries-with-dbservers.description: Flag, if each secondary must run on a node with a DBServer

packages.preInstallNotes:
Note that the ArangoDB DCOS Service is beta and there may be bugs, incomplete features, incorrect documentation or other discrepancies.
The default configuration requires 4 nodes each with 1.0 CPU shares, 1GB of memory and 1GB of disk. You need at least Version 1.3 of DCOS, because we need at least Apache Mesos Version 0.23 with the support for persistent volumes.

master.description: The URL of the Mesos master. The format is a comma-delimited list of hosts like zk://host1:port,host2:port/mesos. If using ZooKeeper, pay particular attention to the leading zk:// and trailing /mesos! If not using ZooKeeper, standard URLs like http://localhost are also acceptable.

zk.description: ZooKeeper URL for storing state. Format: zk://host1:port1,host2:port2,.../path. Please note that the id is appended to the path.

webui-host.description: For debugging: use this host for WEBUI request.

framework-port.description: Framework port, use '0' to let Mesos select a port for you.

framework-cpus.description: cpus resources needed for each framework instance.

framework-mem.description: mem resources needed for each framework instance.

framework-instances.description: number of instances of the framework to run.

framework-user.description: user under which to run the framework tasks

principal.description: Principal for persistent volumes

async-replication.description: Whether we do asynchronous replication, possible values: "true", "false"

role.description: Role for framework

minimal-resources-agent.description: Minimal mesos resources for an agent

minimal-resources-coordinator.description: Minimal mesos resources for a coordinator

minimal-resources-dbserver.description: Minimal mesos resources for a DBserver

minimal-resources-secondary.description: Minimal mesos resources for a secondary DBserver

agency.description: service locator for an ETCD cluster. If your ETCD cluster is called 'etcd', then the service locator will be '_etcd-server._client.etcd.mesos'

failover-timeout.description: Timeout after which an automatic failover is done.

mesos-authenticate.description: If true use authentication with Mesos master.

secret.description: Secret for authentication with Mesos.

secondaries-with-dbservers.description: Flag, if each secondary must run on a node with a DBServer

coordinators-with-dbservers.description: Flag, if each coordinator must run on a node with a DBServer

arangodb-privileged-image.description: Run arangodb image in privileged mode.

packages.postUninstallNotes: Artifactory has been uninstalled. Note that any data persisted to a NFS share still exists and will need to be manually removed.
packages.name: artifactory
packages.description: As the first, and only, universal Artifact Repository Manager on the market, JFrog Artifactory fully supports software packages created by any language or technology.
packages.postInstallNotes: Artifactory has been installed.
packages.preInstallNotes: If you wish to use Artifactory High Availability, you need to ensure the `cluster-home` directory is visible and writable to all the Artifactory cluster nodes in your system (e.g. using NFS storage).

name.description: The name of this DC/OS service.  If running in high-availability mode and this is a secondary node, -secondary will be appended to this name.

cpus.description: CPU shares to allocate to this instance.

mem.description: Memory to allocate to this instance.

pro.description: Configuration for Artifactory Pro. These do not apply if Artifactory HA is enabled.

local-volumes.description: Local persistent volumes configuration (only used if external persistent volumes are disabled). Local persistent volumes are created on one machine and Marathon will attempt to re-launch the task on the same machine. Note that if the machine is lost, your data may also be lost.

artifactory-home-size.description: Size of the artifactory-home volume in MiB.

user.description: Database username.

password.description: Database password.

external-volumes.description: External persistent volumes configuration. External persistent volumes are a DC/OS feature that allow your data to be migrated with your task.

enabled.description: Whether to use DC/OS external persistent volumes to persist Artifactory state. By default, this is false.

high-availability.description: Configuration for Artifactory High Availability (HA). If enabled, this will override any Artifactory Pro configuration.

enabled.description: Whether to deploy Artifactory HA. By default, Artifactory HA is not deployed.

cluster-home.description: The location of a volume on the host to be used for persisting cluster home directory used when running Artifactory in HA mode. Note that this path must be the same on all DC/OS agents that are running Artifactory.

licenses.description: Provide comma separated licenses to be used by all Artifactory instances.

network.description: The network on which the Artifactory instances will communicate, in CIDR notation. For example: 192.168.65.0/24

user.description: Database username.

password.description: Database password.

secondary.description: Configuration properties for the Artifactory HA secondary node.

enabled.description: Whether this DC/OS service represents the Artifactory HA secondary instance. To run Artifactory HA, you must deploy one primary DC/OS service and one secondary DC/OS service. By default, this is false (i.e. a primary instance).

unique-nodes.description: Run secondary instances on unique hosts. By default, this is true.

nodes.description: Number of Artifactory Secondary instances for High-Availability. By default, this is 1.

api-key.description: API key generated by the primary Artifactory. This is necessary for the secondary instances to authenticate against the primary instance.

packages.postUninstallNotes: Artifactory-lb has been uninstalled.
packages.name: artifactory-lb
packages.description: Load Balancer for JFrog Artifactory.
packages.postInstallNotes: Artifactory-lb has been installed.
packages.preInstallNotes: Make sure you have a running instance of Artifactory.

name.description: The name of this DC/OS service.

cpus.description: CPU shares to allocate to this instance.

mem.description: Memory to allocate to this instance.

bridge.description: Whether to use bridge networking mode for Docker container. By default, this is false and bridge mode networking is not used.

ssl.description: Whether or not to use custom SSL certificates. If selected, fetches SSL certificate and key from provided URIs.

enabled.description: If enabled, use provided URIs to fetch SSL certificate and key

ssl_key_path.description: URI to a key file. This can be hosted over HTTP(S) or a path to a local file.

ssl_cert_path.description: URI to a certificate file. This can be hosted over HTTP(S) or a path to a local file

name.description: The DC/OS service name of the Artifactory server to route requests to.

api-key.description: API key generated by the primary Artifactory. This is necessary for the artifactory-lb to authenticate against the primary Artifactory instance.

packages.postUninstallNotes:
Avi DCOS Service has been uninstalled and will no longer run.

packages.name: bookkeeper
packages.description: BookKeeper is a replicated log service which can be used to build replicated state machines. A log contains a sequence of events which can be applied to a state machine. BookKeeper guarantees that each replica state machine will see all the same entries, in the same order. One bookkeeper instance is called a bookie, By default this package deploy 1 bookie. Usually we should deploy at least 3 bookies to start a bookkeeper cluster. And there is an example included here:https://github.com/dcos/examples

packages.name: cadvisor
packages.description:
cAdvisor (Container Advisor) provides container users an understanding of the resource usage and performance characteristics of their running containers. It is a running daemon that collects, aggregates, processes, and exports information about running containers. Specifically, for each container it keeps resource isolation parameters, historical resource usage, histograms of complete historical resource usage and network statistics. This data is exported by container and machine-wide.

NOTE: This package will install by default a single instance of cAdvisor in each host of your cluster.

This package is intended to be used alongside the DC/OS 'influxdb' and 'grafana' packages for a cluster-wide monitoring solution.

Installation Documentation: https://github.com/dcos/examples/tree/master/1.8/cadvisor-influxdb-grafana
packages.postInstallNotes: Service installed.
packages.preInstallNotes:
This DC/OS Service is currently EXPERIMENTAL. There may be bugs, incomplete features, incorrect documentation, or other discrepancies.

Advanced Installation options notes

networking / external_access: create an entry in Marathon-LB for accessing the service from outside of the cluster. Please note that each access to this endpoint will connect you to a SINGLE instance of cAdvisor running in one of the nodes of your cluster.

networking / external_access_port: port to be used in Marathon-LB for accessing the service.

name.description: Name of this service instance

instances.description: Number of service instances to run in the cluster. A single instance will be run per node in the cluster. Normally, this number should be equal or higher than the number of nodes in the cluster.

cpus.description: CPU shares to allocate to each service instance.

mem.description: Memory to allocate to each service instance.

influxdb_host.description: Hostname or IP address of the host running InfluxDB for metrics storage.

influxdb_port.description: TCP port where the influxdb_host is listening.

external_access.description:
Enable access from outside the cluster through Marathon-LB.
NOTE: this connection is unencrypted.

enable.description: Enable or disable creating a VIP for external access through a public node running Marathon-LB.

external_access_port.description: For external access, port number to be used for clear communication in the external Marathon-LB load balancer

packages.name: calico
packages.description: Calico networking for DCOS.  Calico provides IP-per-task functionality with rich policy.  This framework optionally installs Docker multi-host networking (required for Calico with the Docker containerizer) and Agent network hooks with netmodules (required for Calico with Unified tasks).  Both installations will cause temporary restarts of an Agent causing transient task loss.  The number of agents restarted at the same time is configurable and defaults to a single concurrent restart.  At the moment, only a limited set of DCOS versions and OSes are supported - check the documentation for details.  The framework will still run on unsupported versions, in which case the Agent network hooks will not be installed and Calico networking will only be available with the Docker containerizer.
packages.postInstallNotes: Calico services are now running on your cluster. Follow the Calico DCOS guide available at https://github.com/projectcalico/calico-containers/blob/master/docs/mesos/DCOS.md
packages.preInstallNotes: Before installing Calico, ensure the DCOS etcd package is installed. Note: this scheduler makes permament changes to all Agents in the cluster. Calico Networking for DCOS is currently in alpha.

allow-agent-update.description: Whether the Calico framework is allowed to reconfigure and restart the Mesos Agent to install netmodules with a Calico plugin.  Note that during restart, the agent will not be available, and tasks running on the agent will be lost.

allow-docker-update.description: Whether the Calico framework is allowed to reconfigure and restart Docker on the Mesos Agent to install Docker with multi-host networking.  Note that during restart, the agent will not be available, and tasks running on the agent will be lost.

max-concurrent-restarts.description: The maximum number of Agent or Docker restarts that are allowed to be scheduled concurrently by the Calico framework.

zk.description: The URL of Zookeeper to be used to persist Calico framework data. The format is a comma-delimited list of hosts like zk://host1:port,host2:port/calico, including the trailing path.

cpu-limit-framework.description: The CPU shares for the Calico framework.

mem-limit-framework.description: Memory limit (MB) for the Calico framework.

cpu-limit-install.description: The CPU shares for each install task instance.

mem-limit-install.description: Memory limit (MB) for each install task instance.

cpu-limit-etcd-proxy.description: The CPU shares for each etcd proxy instance.

mem-limit-etcd-proxy.description: Memory limit (MB) for each etcd proxy instance.

cpu-limit-node.description: The CPU shares for each Calico node instance.

mem-limit-node.description: Memory limit (MB) for each Calico node instance.

cpu-limit-libnetwork.description: The CPU shares for each Calico Docker Network driver instance.

mem-limit-libnetwork.description: Memory limit (MB) for each Calico Docker Network driver instance.

status-dns.description: The DNS name used to resolve the Calico status web page.

etcd-discovery-url.description: The etcd service discovery URL used to determine the addresses of the full etcd cluster.

master.description: The URL of the Mesos master. The format is a comma-delimited list of hosts like zk://host1:port,host2:port/mesos. If using ZooKeeper, pay particular attention to the leading zk:// and trailing /mesos! If not using ZooKeeper, standard host:port patterns, like localhost:5050 or 10.0.0.5:5050,10.0.0.6:5050, are also acceptable.

packages.description: Calico networking for DCOS.  Calico provides IP-per-task functionality with rich policy.  This framework optionally installs Docker multi-host networking (required for Calico with the Docker containerizer) and Agent network hooks with netmodules (required for Calico with Unified tasks).  Both installations will cause temporary restarts of an Agent causing transient task loss.  The number of agents restarted at the same time is configurable and defaults to a single concurrent restart. The framework will still run on unsupported versions, in which case the Agent network hooks will not be installed and Calico networking will only be available with the Docker containerizer.

packages.preInstallNotes: Before installing Calico, ensure the DCOS etcd package is installed. Note: this scheduler makes permament changes to all Agents in the cluster. Because DC/OS sets rp_filter to 'loose' on all agents, a compromised container running with 'CAP_NET_RAW' privilege can spoof its own IP. See https://dcosjira.atlassian.net/browse/DCOS-265 for more information. Calico Networking for DCOS is currently in alpha.

max-concurrent-restarts.description: The maximum number of Agent or Docker restarts that are allowed to be scheduled concurrently by the Calico framework.

zk.description: The URL of Zookeeper to be used to persist Calico framework data. The format is a comma-delimited list of hosts like zk://host1:port,host2:port/calico, including the trailing path.

If using ZooKeeper, pay particular attention to the leading zk:// and trailing /mesos! If not using ZooKeeper, standard host:port patterns, like localhost:5050 or 10.0.0.5:5050,10.0.0.6:5050, are also acceptable.

cni-plugins-dir.description: Location of CNI plugins on the Agent.

resource-overrides.description: Override resources. Note: If your cluster does not have WAN and you are pre-fetching resources.json, Calico will be unable to download these files.

node-image.description: Override the node image specified in resources.json

installer-url.description: Override the URL for the installer binary.

packages.name: calico
packages.description: Calico networking for DC/OS.  Calico provides IP-per-task functionality with rich policy.  This Universe Package simplifies the installation of Calico and its dependencies on a stock DC/OS cluster. It is configurable such that it assumes Calico's dependencies are installed, and merely serves to ensure calico's core processes are running. By default, it configures Docker with multi-host networking (required to use Calico with the Docker Containerizer), and reboots each Agent to pick up Calico's CNI configuration (required for Calico with Unified tasks). Both of these steps will cause temporary restarts of an Agent causing transient task loss. A more stable approach to Calico in DC/OS will have users performing these steps manually, and disabling them in the Universe Package. At the moment, only a limited set of DC/OS versions and OSes are supported - check the documentation for details.  The framework will still run on unsupported versions, in which case the Agent network hooks will not be installed and Calico networking will only be available with the Docker containerizer.
packages.postInstallNotes: Calico services are now running on your cluster. Follow the Calico DC/OS guide available at https://github.com/projectcalico/calico-containers/blob/master/docs/mesos/dcos.md
packages.preInstallNotes: Before installing Calico, ensure the DC/OS etcd package is installed (if not using own etcd server). Note: this scheduler may makes permament changes to all Agents and Docker Daemons in the cluster. Calico's DC/OS installation framework is currently in beta.

Framework Settings.description: Configuration options for Calico's DC/OS Framework.

master.description: The URL of the Mesos master. The format is a comma-delimited list of hosts like zk://host1:port,host2:port/mesos. If using ZooKeeper, pay particular attention to the leading zk:// and trailing /mesos! If not using ZooKeeper, standard host:port patterns, like localhost:5050 or 10.0.0.5:5050,10.0.0.6:5050, are also acceptable.

max-concurrent-restarts.description: The maximum number of Agent or Docker restarts that are allowed to be scheduled concurrently by the Calico framework.

zk.description: The URL of Zookeeper to be used to persist Calico framework data. The format is a comma-delimited list of hosts like zk://host1:port,host2:port/calico, including the trailing path.

cpu-limit.description: The CPU shares for the Calico framework.

mem-limit.description: Memory limit (MB) for the Calico framework.

status-dns.description: The DNS name used to resolve the Calico status web page.

override-framework-image.description: Override the docker image for the calico-dcos framework.

override-installer-url.description: Override the URL for the installer binary.

Etcd Settings.description:
Configure etcd settings used by calico/node, calico/libnetwork-plugin, and calico-CNI. Below presents the option of whether to run etcd on each agent in proxy mode, forwarding requests made to localhost:2379 to the etcd clutser avaiable via the etcd-discovery-url presented by the Universe etcd package. Users who prefer to run etcd themselves on an agent can disable etcd proxy, and modify etcd-endpoints to point at their own etcd server directly.

WARNING: The docker cluster-store configuration by default will use etcd-proxy. Ensure if you have disabled etcd-proxy, that you configure docker to use a different datastore as well.

run-proxy.description: Enable running etcd-proxy on each agent. Keep enabled if using Universe etcd package.

etcd-discovery-url.description: The etcd service discovery URL which via an SRV lookup resolves to the Universe etcd package. Used by etcd-proxy to forward etcd requests made on localhost:2379 to the universe etcd package.

etcd-endpoints.description: The address used by Calico to connect to etcd. If etcd-proxy is enabled, keep as 'http://localhost:2379'. Otherwise, enter url of etcd server.

cpu-limit.description: The CPU shares for each etcd proxy instance.

mem-limit.description: Memory limit (MB) for each etcd proxy instance.

Configure Docker Cluster-Store.description: Reconfigure Docker with a cluster-store. Only required if using Calico's Docker plugin.

enable.description: Whether the Calico framework is allowed to reconfigure and restart Docker on the Mesos Agent to install Docker with multi-host networking.  Note that during restart, the agent will not be available, and tasks running on the agent will be lost.

override-docker-cluster-store.description: URL of the distributed storage backend for Docker. When ommitted, this will be constructed from etcd-endpoints.

cpu-limit.description: The CPU shares for each Calico node instance.

mem-limit.description: Memory limit (MB) for each Calico node instance.

Install CNI.description: Installs Calico's CNI plugin and a default CNI network configuration on all agents, then restarts each agent (to pickup the new configuration).

enable.description: Enable installation of CNI plugin and network.

cni-plugins-dir.description: Location of CNI plugins on the Agent.

cpu-limit.description: The CPU shares for each install task instance.

mem-limit.description: Memory limit (MB) for each install task instance.

Run Calico-Node.description: Run the calico/node docker container on all agents. Required if using either Calico's CNI or Docker plugin.

enable.description: Enable running calico/node on each agent.

cpu-limit.description: The CPU shares for each Calico node instance.

mem-limit.description: Memory limit (MB) for each Calico node instance.

override-node-image.description: Override the node image specified in resources.json

Run Calico-Libnetwork.description: Run calico/libnetwork on all agents. Required to use calico networking for Docker containers.

enable.description: Enable running calico/libnetwork on each agent.

cpu-limit.description: The CPU shares for each Calico Docker Network driver instance.

mem-limit.description: Memory limit (MB) for each Calico Docker Network driver instance.

packages.name: cassandra
packages.description: Apache Cassandra running on Apache Mesos
packages.postInstallNotes:
Thank you for installing the Apache Cassandra DCOS Service.

	Documentation: http://mesosphere.github.io/cassandra-mesos/
	Issues: https://github.com/mesosphere/cassandra-mesos/issues
packages.preInstallNotes:
The Apache Cassandra DCOS Service implementation is alpha and there may be bugs, incomplete features, incorrect documentation or other discrepancies.
The default configuration requires 3 nodes each with 0.3 CPU shares, 1184MB of memory and 272MB of disk.

master.description: The URL of the Mesos master. The format is a comma-delimited list of hosts like zk://host1:port,host2:port/mesos. If using ZooKeeper, pay particular attention to the leading zk:// and trailing /mesos! If not using ZooKeeper, standard host:port patterns, like localhost:5050 or 10.0.0.5:5050,10.0.0.6:5050, are also acceptable.

failover-timeout-seconds.description: The failover_timeout for Mesos in seconds. If the framework instance has not re-registered with Mesos this long after a failover, Mesos will shut down all running tasks started by the framework.

cpus.description: CPU shares to allocate to each Cassandra framework instance.

mem.description: Memory (MB) to allocate to each Cassandra framework instance.

instances.description: Number of Cassandra framework instances to run.

role.description: Mesos role for this framework.

enabled.description: Whether framework authentication should be used

principal.description: The Mesos principal used for authentication.

secret.description: The path to the Mesos secret file containing the authentication secret.

cluster-name.description: The name of the framework to register with mesos. Will also be used as the cluster name in Cassandra

zk.description: ZooKeeper URL for storing state. Format: zk://host1:port1,host2:port2,.../path (can have nested directories)

node-count.description: The number of nodes in the ring for the framework to run.

seed-count.description: The number of seed nodes in the ring for the framework to run.

health-check-interval-seconds.description: The interval in seconds that the framework should check the health of each Cassandra Server instance.

bootstrap-grace-time-seconds.description: The minimum number of seconds to wait between starting each node. Setting this too low could result in the ring not bootstrapping correctly.

data-directory.description: The location on disk where Cassandra will be configured to write it's data.

cpus.description: CPU shares to allocate to each Cassandra Server Instance.

mem.description: Memory (MB) to allocate to each Cassandra Server instance.

disk.description: Disk (MB) to allocate to each Cassandra Server instance.

heap-mb.description: The amount of memory in MB that are allocated to each Cassandra Server Instance. This value should be smaller than 'cassandra.resources.mem'. The remaining difference will be used for memory mapped files and other off-heap memory requirements.

default-dc.description: Default value to be set for dc name in the GossipingPropertyFileSnitch

default-rack.description: Default value to be set for rack name in the GossipingPropertyFileSnitch

external-dcs.description: Name and URL for another instance of Cassandra DCOS Service

name.description: The name of the Cassandra service instance.

user.description: The user that the service will run as.

principal.description: The principal for the Cassandra service instance.

secret_name.description: Name of the Secret Store credentials to use for DC/OS service authentication. This should be left empty unless service authentication is needed.

cpus.description: The cpu shares used by the Cassandra service scheduler.

mem.description: The memory used by the Cassandra service scheduler in Mb.

heap.description: The JVM heap used by the Cassandra service scheduler in Mb.

api_port.description: The port that the Cassandra service API will accept on.

placement_strategy.description: The placement strategy for Cassandra nodes. This should always be NODE.

count.description: The number of Cassandra nodes in the cluster.

cpus.description: The number of cpu shares allocated to the Cassandra process.

mem.description: The amount of memory, in MB, allocated to the Cassandra process.

disk.description: The amount of disk, in MB, allocated to the Cassandra process.

disk_type.description: Disk type to be used for storing Cassandra data. See documentation. [ROOT, MOUNT]

heap.description: The Cassandra process JVM heap configuration object.

size.description: The amount of JVM heap, in MB, allocated to the Cassandra process.

new.description: The amount of JVM new generation heap, in MB, allocated to the Cassandra process.

seeds.description: The number of Cassandra seed nodes in the cluster

jmx_port.description: The JMX port that will be used to interface with the Cassandra application.

num_tokens.description: The number of tokens assigned to each node.

hinted_handoff_enabled.description: If true, hinted handoff is enabled for the cluster.

max_hint_window_in_ms.description: The maximum amount of time, in ms, that hints are generates hints for an unresponsive node.

hinted_handoff_throttle_in_kb.description: The maximum throttle per delivery thread in kilobytes per second.

max_hints_delivery_threads.description: The maximum number of delivery threads for hinted handoff.

batchlog_replay_throttle_in_kb.description: The total throttle for log replay in Kpbs.

partitioner.description: The partitioner used to distribute rows across the cluster. Murmur3Partitioner is the recommended setting. RandomPartitioner and ByteOrderedPartitioner are supported for legacy applications.

key_cache_save_period.description: The duration in seconds that keys are saved in cache. Saved caches greatly improve cold-start speeds and has relatively little effect on I/O.

row_cache_size_in_mb.description: Maximum size of the row cache in memory. Row cache can save more time than key_cache_size_in_mb, but is space-intensive because it contains the entire row. Use the row cache only for hot rows or static rows. 0 disables the row cache.

row_cache_save_period.description: Duration in seconds that rows are saved in cache. 0 disables caching.

commitlog_sync_period_in_ms.description: The number of milliseconds between disk fsync calls.

commitlog_segment_size_in_mb.description: The size of each commit log segment in Mb.

concurrent_reads.description: For workloads with more data than can fit in memory, the bottleneck is reads fetching data from disk. Setting to (16 times the number of drives) allows operations to queue low enough in the stack so that the OS and drives can reorder them.

concurrent_writes.description: Writes in Cassandra are rarely I/O bound, so the ideal number of concurrent writes depends on the number of CPU cores in your system. The recommended value is 8 times the number of cpu cores.

concurrent_counter_writes.description: Counter writes read the current values before incrementing and writing them back. The recommended value is (16 times the number of drives) .

memtable_allocation_type.description: The type of allocations for the Cassandra memtable. heap_buffers keep all data on the JVM heap. offheap_buffers may reduce heap utilization for large string or binary values. offheap_objects may improve heap size for small integers or UUIDs as well. Both off heap options will increase read latency.

index_summary_resize_interval_in_minutes.description: How frequently index summaries should be re-sampled in minutes. This is done periodically to redistribute memory from the fixed-size pool to SSTables proportional their recent read rates.

start_rpc.description: If true Thrift RPC is enable. This is deprecated by may be necessary for legacy applications.

rpc_port.description: The port for Thrift RPC communication.

rpc_keepalive.description: Enables or TCP keepalive for RPC connections.

thrift_framed_transport_size_in_mb.description: Frame size (maximum field length) for Thrift.

tombstone_warn_threshold.description: The maximum number of tombstones a query can scan before warning.

tombstone_failure_threshold.description: The maximum number of tombstones a query can scan before aborting.

column_index_size_in_kb.description: The granularity of the index of rows within a partition. For huge rows, decrease this setting to improve seek time. If you use key cache, be careful not to make this setting too large because key cache will be overwhelmed.

batch_size_warn_threshold_in_kb.description: Warn the operator on a batch size exceeding this value in kilobytes. Caution should be taken on increasing the size of this threshold as it can lead to node instability.

batch_size_fail_threshold_in_kb.description: Fail batch sizes exceeding this value in kilobytes. Caution should be taken on increasing the size of this threshold as it can lead to node instability.

compaction_throughput_mb_per_sec.description: Throttles compaction to the specified total throughput across the node. Compaction frequency varies with direct proportion to write throughput and is necessary to limit the SSTable size. The recommended value is 16 to 32 times the rate of write throughput (in MB/second).

sstable_preemptive_open_interval_in_mb.description: When compacting, the replacement opens SSTables before they are completely written and uses in place of the prior SSTables for any range previously written. This setting helps to smoothly transfer reads between the SSTables by reducing page cache churn and keeps hot rows hot.

read_request_timeout_in_ms.description: The time that the coordinator waits for read operations to complete in ms.

range_request_timeout_in_ms.description: The time that the coordinator waits for range scans complete in ms.

write_request_timeout_in_ms.description: The time that the coordinator waits for write operations to complete in ms.

counter_write_request_timeout_in_ms.description: The time that the coordinator waits for counter write operations to complete in ms.

cas_contention_timeout_in_ms.description: The time for which the coordinator will retry CAS operations on the same row in ms.

truncate_request_timeout_in_ms.description: The time that the coordinator waits for truncate operations to complete in ms.

request_timeout_in_ms.description: The default timeout for all other requests in ms.

dynamic_snitch_update_interval_in_ms.description: The time, in ms, the snitch will wait before updating node scores.

dynamic_snitch_reset_interval_in_ms.description: The time, in ms, the snitch will wait before resetting node scores allowing bad nodes to recover.

dynamic_snitch_badness_threshold.description: Sets the performance threshold for dynamically routing client requests away from a poorly performing node.

internode_compression.description: Controls whether traffic between nodes is compressed. all compresses all traffic. none compresses no traffic. dc compresses between datacenters.

executor.description: The Cassandra service executor configuration object.

cpus.description: The cpu shares used by the Cassandra service executor.

mem.description: The memory used by the Cassandra service executor in Mb.

heap.description: The JVM heap used by the Cassandra service executor in Mb.

disk.description: The amount of disk used by the Cassandra service executor in Mb.

api_port.description: The port that the Cassandra executor API will accept on.

task.description: The Cassandra service cluster task configuration object.

cpus.description: The cpu shares used by the Cassandra service cluster tasks.

mem.description: The memory used by the Cassandra cluster tasks in Mb.

	Issues: https://docs.mesosphere.com/support/

name.description: The name of the Cassandra service instance.

user.description: The user that the service will run as.

principal.description: The principal for the Cassandra service instance.

secret_name.description: Name of the Secret Store credentials to use for DC/OS service authentication. This should be left empty unless service authentication is needed.

cpus.description: The cpu shares used by the Cassandra service scheduler.

mem.description: The memory used by the Cassandra service scheduler in Mb.

heap.description: The JVM heap used by the Cassandra service scheduler in Mb.

api_port.description: The port that the Cassandra service API will accept on.

placement_strategy.description: The placement strategy for Cassandra nodes. This should always be NODE.

data_center.description: The data center that the Cassandra cluster managed by the service is deployed in.

data_center_url.description: The URL of from which the the data center for the cluster managed by this service instance will server its data center information.

external_data_center_urls.description: A comma separated list of the URLs from which this service instance retrieve data center info to form a cluster spanning multiple data centers.

count.description: The number of Cassandra nodes in the cluster.

cpus.description: The number of cpu shares allocated to the Cassandra process.

mem.description: The amount of memory, in MB, allocated to the Cassandra process.

disk.description: The amount of disk, in MB, allocated to the Cassandra process.

disk_type.description: Disk type to be used for storing Cassandra data. See documentation. [ROOT, MOUNT]

heap.description: The Cassandra process JVM heap configuration object.

size.description: The amount of JVM heap, in MB, allocated to the Cassandra process.

new.description: The amount of JVM new generation heap, in MB, allocated to the Cassandra process.

gc.description: The Garbage collector for JVM (Either G1 or CMS).

seeds.description: The number of Cassandra seed nodes in the cluster

cluster_name.description: The name of the cluster managed by the Service

jmx_port.description: The JMX port that will be used to interface with the Cassandra application.

num_tokens.description: The number of tokens assigned to each node.

hinted_handoff_enabled.description: If true, hinted handoff is enabled for the cluster.

max_hint_window_in_ms.description: The maximum amount of time, in ms, that hints are generates hints for an unresponsive node.

hinted_handoff_throttle_in_kb.description: The maximum throttle per delivery thread in kilobytes per second.

max_hints_delivery_threads.description: The maximum number of delivery threads for hinted handoff.

batchlog_replay_throttle_in_kb.description: The total throttle for log replay in Kpbs.

partitioner.description: The partitioner used to distribute rows across the cluster. Murmur3Partitioner is the recommended setting. RandomPartitioner and ByteOrderedPartitioner are supported for legacy applications.

key_cache_save_period.description: The duration in seconds that keys are saved in cache. Saved caches greatly improve cold-start speeds and has relatively little effect on I/O.

row_cache_size_in_mb.description: Maximum size of the row cache in memory. Row cache can save more time than key_cache_size_in_mb, but is space-intensive because it contains the entire row. Use the row cache only for hot rows or static rows. 0 disables the row cache.

row_cache_save_period.description: Duration in seconds that rows are saved in cache. 0 disables caching.

commitlog_sync_period_in_ms.description: The number of milliseconds between disk fsync calls.

commitlog_segment_size_in_mb.description: The size of each commit log segment in Mb.

concurrent_reads.description: For workloads with more data than can fit in memory, the bottleneck is reads fetching data from disk. Setting to (16 times the number of drives) allows operations to queue low enough in the stack so that the OS and drives can reorder them.

concurrent_writes.description: Writes in Cassandra are rarely I/O bound, so the ideal number of concurrent writes depends on the number of CPU cores in your system. The recommended value is 8 times the number of cpu cores.

concurrent_counter_writes.description: Counter writes read the current values before incrementing and writing them back. The recommended value is (16 times the number of drives) .

memtable_allocation_type.description: The type of allocations for the Cassandra memtable. heap_buffers keep all data on the JVM heap. offheap_buffers may reduce heap utilization for large string or binary values. offheap_objects may improve heap size for small integers or UUIDs as well. Both off heap options will increase read latency.

index_summary_resize_interval_in_minutes.description: How frequently index summaries should be re-sampled in minutes. This is done periodically to redistribute memory from the fixed-size pool to SSTables proportional their recent read rates.

start_rpc.description: If true Thrift RPC is enable. This is deprecated by may be necessary for legacy applications.

rpc_port.description: The port for Thrift RPC communication.

rpc_keepalive.description: Enables or TCP keepalive for RPC connections.

thrift_framed_transport_size_in_mb.description: Frame size (maximum field length) for Thrift.

tombstone_warn_threshold.description: The maximum number of tombstones a query can scan before warning.

tombstone_failure_threshold.description: The maximum number of tombstones a query can scan before aborting.

column_index_size_in_kb.description: The granularity of the index of rows within a partition. For huge rows, decrease this setting to improve seek time. If you use key cache, be careful not to make this setting too large because key cache will be overwhelmed.

batch_size_warn_threshold_in_kb.description: Warn the operator on a batch size exceeding this value in kilobytes. Caution should be taken on increasing the size of this threshold as it can lead to node instability.

batch_size_fail_threshold_in_kb.description: Fail batch sizes exceeding this value in kilobytes. Caution should be taken on increasing the size of this threshold as it can lead to node instability.

compaction_throughput_mb_per_sec.description: Throttles compaction to the specified total throughput across the node. Compaction frequency varies with direct proportion to write throughput and is necessary to limit the SSTable size. The recommended value is 16 to 32 times the rate of write throughput (in MB/second).

sstable_preemptive_open_interval_in_mb.description: When compacting, the replacement opens SSTables before they are completely written and uses in place of the prior SSTables for any range previously written. This setting helps to smoothly transfer reads between the SSTables by reducing page cache churn and keeps hot rows hot.

read_request_timeout_in_ms.description: The time that the coordinator waits for read operations to complete in ms.

range_request_timeout_in_ms.description: The time that the coordinator waits for range scans complete in ms.

write_request_timeout_in_ms.description: The time that the coordinator waits for write operations to complete in ms.

counter_write_request_timeout_in_ms.description: The time that the coordinator waits for counter write operations to complete in ms.

cas_contention_timeout_in_ms.description: The time for which the coordinator will retry CAS operations on the same row in ms.

truncate_request_timeout_in_ms.description: The time that the coordinator waits for truncate operations to complete in ms.

request_timeout_in_ms.description: The default timeout for all other requests in ms.

dynamic_snitch_update_interval_in_ms.description: The time, in ms, the snitch will wait before updating node scores.

dynamic_snitch_reset_interval_in_ms.description: The time, in ms, the snitch will wait before resetting node scores allowing bad nodes to recover.

dynamic_snitch_badness_threshold.description: Sets the performance threshold for dynamically routing client requests away from a poorly performing node.

internode_compression.description: Controls whether traffic between nodes is compressed. all compresses all traffic. none compresses no traffic. dc compresses between datacenters.

max_hints_file_size_in_mb.description: The maximum size of the hints file in Mb.

hints_flush_period_in_ms.description: The time, in ms, for the period in which hints are flushed to disk.

concurrent_materialized_view_writes.description: The maximum number of concurrent writes to materialized views.

commitlog_total_space_in_mb.description: The total size of the commit log in Mb.

executor.description: The Cassandra service executor configuration object.

cpus.description: The cpu shares used by the Cassandra service executor.

mem.description: The memory used by the Cassandra service executor in Mb.

heap.description: The JVM heap used by the Cassandra service executor in Mb.

disk.description: The amount of disk used by the Cassandra service executor in Mb.

api_port.description: The port that the Cassandra executor API will accept on.

task.description: The Cassandra service cluster task configuration object.

cpus.description: The cpu shares used by the Cassandra service cluster tasks.

mem.description: The memory used by the Cassandra cluster tasks in Mb.

packages.postUninstallNotes:
DC/OS Cassandra service has been uninstalled.
Please follow the instructions at https://docs.mesosphere.com/usage/services/cassandra/uninstall to remove any persistent state if required.

authenticator.description: The authentication backend. It implements IAuthenticator, which is used to identify users.

authorizer.description: The authorization backend. It implements IAuthenticator, which limits access and provides permissions.

jmx_port.description: The JMX port that will be used to interface with the Cassandra application.

num_tokens.description: The number of tokens assigned to each node.

hinted_handoff_enabled.description: If true, hinted handoff is enabled for the cluster.

max_hint_window_in_ms.description: The maximum amount of time, in ms, that hints are generates hints for an unresponsive node.

hinted_handoff_throttle_in_kb.description: The maximum throttle per delivery thread in kilobytes per second.

max_hints_delivery_threads.description: The maximum number of delivery threads for hinted handoff.

batchlog_replay_throttle_in_kb.description: The total throttle for log replay in Kpbs.

partitioner.description: The partitioner used to distribute rows across the cluster. Murmur3Partitioner is the recommended setting. RandomPartitioner and ByteOrderedPartitioner are supported for legacy applications.

key_cache_save_period.description: The duration in seconds that keys are saved in cache. Saved caches greatly improve cold-start speeds and has relatively little effect on I/O.

row_cache_size_in_mb.description: Maximum size of the row cache in memory. Row cache can save more time than key_cache_size_in_mb, but is space-intensive because it contains the entire row. Use the row cache only for hot rows or static rows. 0 disables the row cache.

row_cache_save_period.description: Duration in seconds that rows are saved in cache. 0 disables caching.

commitlog_sync_period_in_ms.description: The number of milliseconds between disk fsync calls.

commitlog_segment_size_in_mb.description: The size of each commit log segment in Mb.

concurrent_reads.description: For workloads with more data than can fit in memory, the bottleneck is reads fetching data from disk. Setting to (16 times the number of drives) allows operations to queue low enough in the stack so that the OS and drives can reorder them.

concurrent_writes.description: Writes in Cassandra are rarely I/O bound, so the ideal number of concurrent writes depends on the number of CPU cores in your system. The recommended value is 8 times the number of cpu cores.

concurrent_counter_writes.description: Counter writes read the current values before incrementing and writing them back. The recommended value is (16 times the number of drives) .

memtable_allocation_type.description: The type of allocations for the Cassandra memtable. heap_buffers keep all data on the JVM heap. offheap_buffers may reduce heap utilization for large string or binary values. offheap_objects may improve heap size for small integers or UUIDs as well. Both off heap options will increase read latency.

index_summary_resize_interval_in_minutes.description: How frequently index summaries should be re-sampled in minutes. This is done periodically to redistribute memory from the fixed-size pool to SSTables proportional their recent read rates.

start_rpc.description: If true Thrift RPC is enable. This is deprecated by may be necessary for legacy applications.

rpc_port.description: The port for Thrift RPC communication.

rpc_keepalive.description: Enables or TCP keepalive for RPC connections.

thrift_framed_transport_size_in_mb.description: Frame size (maximum field length) for Thrift.

tombstone_warn_threshold.description: The maximum number of tombstones a query can scan before warning.

tombstone_failure_threshold.description: The maximum number of tombstones a query can scan before aborting.

column_index_size_in_kb.description: The granularity of the index of rows within a partition. For huge rows, decrease this setting to improve seek time. If you use key cache, be careful not to make this setting too large because key cache will be overwhelmed.

batch_size_warn_threshold_in_kb.description: Warn the operator on a batch size exceeding this value in kilobytes. Caution should be taken on increasing the size of this threshold as it can lead to node instability.

batch_size_fail_threshold_in_kb.description: Fail batch sizes exceeding this value in kilobytes. Caution should be taken on increasing the size of this threshold as it can lead to node instability.

compaction_throughput_mb_per_sec.description: Throttles compaction to the specified total throughput across the node. Compaction frequency varies with direct proportion to write throughput and is necessary to limit the SSTable size. The recommended value is 16 to 32 times the rate of write throughput (in MB/second).

sstable_preemptive_open_interval_in_mb.description: When compacting, the replacement opens SSTables before they are completely written and uses in place of the prior SSTables for any range previously written. This setting helps to smoothly transfer reads between the SSTables by reducing page cache churn and keeps hot rows hot.

read_request_timeout_in_ms.description: The time that the coordinator waits for read operations to complete in ms.

range_request_timeout_in_ms.description: The time that the coordinator waits for range scans complete in ms.

write_request_timeout_in_ms.description: The time that the coordinator waits for write operations to complete in ms.

counter_write_request_timeout_in_ms.description: The time that the coordinator waits for counter write operations to complete in ms.

cas_contention_timeout_in_ms.description: The time for which the coordinator will retry CAS operations on the same row in ms.

truncate_request_timeout_in_ms.description: The time that the coordinator waits for truncate operations to complete in ms.

request_timeout_in_ms.description: The default timeout for all other requests in ms.

dynamic_snitch_update_interval_in_ms.description: The time, in ms, the snitch will wait before updating node scores.

dynamic_snitch_reset_interval_in_ms.description: The time, in ms, the snitch will wait before resetting node scores allowing bad nodes to recover.

dynamic_snitch_badness_threshold.description: Sets the performance threshold for dynamically routing client requests away from a poorly performing node.

internode_compression.description: Controls whether traffic between nodes is compressed. all compresses all traffic. none compresses no traffic. dc compresses between datacenters.

max_hints_file_size_in_mb.description: The maximum size of the hints file in Mb.

hints_flush_period_in_ms.description: The time, in ms, for the period in which hints are flushed to disk.

concurrent_materialized_view_writes.description: The maximum number of concurrent writes to materialized views.

commitlog_total_space_in_mb.description: The total size of the commit log in Mb.

executor.description: The DC/OS Apache Cassandra service executor configuration object.

cpus.description: The cpu shares used by the Cassandra service executor.

mem.description: The memory used by the Cassandra service executor in Mb.

heap.description: The JVM heap used by the Cassandra service executor in Mb.

disk.description: The amount of disk used by the Cassandra service executor in Mb.

api_port.description: The port that the Cassandra executor API will accept on.

task.description: The DC/OS Apache Cassandra service cluster task configuration object.

cpus.description: The cpu shares used by the Cassandra service cluster tasks.

mem.description: The memory used by the Cassandra cluster tasks in Mb.

packages.postUninstallNotes:
DC/OS Apache Cassandra service has been uninstalled.
Please follow the instructions at https://docs.mesosphere.com/current/usage/service-guides/cassandra/uninstall to remove any persistent state if required.

row_cache_size_in_mb.description: Maximum size of the row cache in memory. Row cache can save more time than key_cache_size_in_mb, but is space-intensive because it contains the entire row. Use the row cache only for hot rows or static rows. 0 disables the row cache.

row_cache_save_period.description: Duration in seconds that rows are saved in cache. 0 disables caching.

commitlog_sync_period_in_ms.description: The number of milliseconds between disk fsync calls.

commitlog_segment_size_in_mb.description: The size of each commit log segment in Mb.

concurrent_reads.description: For workloads with more data than can fit in memory, the bottleneck is reads fetching data from disk. Setting to (16 times the number of drives) allows operations to queue low enough in the stack so that the OS and drives can reorder them.

concurrent_writes.description: Writes in Cassandra are rarely I/O bound, so the ideal number of concurrent writes depends on the number of CPU cores in your system. The recommended value is 8 times the number of cpu cores.

concurrent_counter_writes.description: Counter writes read the current values before incrementing and writing them back. The recommended value is (16 times the number of drives) .

memtable_allocation_type.description: The type of allocations for the Cassandra memtable. heap_buffers keep all data on the JVM heap. offheap_buffers may reduce heap utilization for large string or binary values. offheap_objects may improve heap size for small integers or UUIDs as well. Both off heap options will increase read latency.

index_summary_resize_interval_in_minutes.description: How frequently index summaries should be re-sampled in minutes. This is done periodically to redistribute memory from the fixed-size pool to SSTables proportional their recent read rates.

start_rpc.description: If true Thrift RPC is enable. This is deprecated by may be necessary for legacy applications.

rpc_port.description: The port for Thrift RPC communication.

rpc_keepalive.description: Enables or TCP keepalive for RPC connections.

thrift_framed_transport_size_in_mb.description: Frame size (maximum field length) for Thrift.

tombstone_warn_threshold.description: The maximum number of tombstones a query can scan before warning.

tombstone_failure_threshold.description: The maximum number of tombstones a query can scan before aborting.

column_index_size_in_kb.description: The granularity of the index of rows within a partition. For huge rows, decrease this setting to improve seek time. If you use key cache, be careful not to make this setting too large because key cache will be overwhelmed.

batch_size_warn_threshold_in_kb.description: Warn the operator on a batch size exceeding this value in kilobytes. Caution should be taken on increasing the size of this threshold as it can lead to node instability.

batch_size_fail_threshold_in_kb.description: Fail batch sizes exceeding this value in kilobytes. Caution should be taken on increasing the size of this threshold as it can lead to node instability.

compaction_throughput_mb_per_sec.description: Throttles compaction to the specified total throughput across the node. Compaction frequency varies with direct proportion to write throughput and is necessary to limit the SSTable size. The recommended value is 16 to 32 times the rate of write throughput (in MB/second).

sstable_preemptive_open_interval_in_mb.description: When compacting, the replacement opens SSTables before they are completely written and uses in place of the prior SSTables for any range previously written. This setting helps to smoothly transfer reads between the SSTables by reducing page cache churn and keeps hot rows hot.

read_request_timeout_in_ms.description: The time that the coordinator waits for read operations to complete in ms.

range_request_timeout_in_ms.description: The time that the coordinator waits for range scans complete in ms.

write_request_timeout_in_ms.description: The time that the coordinator waits for write operations to complete in ms.

counter_write_request_timeout_in_ms.description: The time that the coordinator waits for counter write operations to complete in ms.

cas_contention_timeout_in_ms.description: The time for which the coordinator will retry CAS operations on the same row in ms.

truncate_request_timeout_in_ms.description: The time that the coordinator waits for truncate operations to complete in ms.

request_timeout_in_ms.description: The default timeout for all other requests in ms.

dynamic_snitch_update_interval_in_ms.description: The time, in ms, the snitch will wait before updating node scores.

dynamic_snitch_reset_interval_in_ms.description: The time, in ms, the snitch will wait before resetting node scores allowing bad nodes to recover.

dynamic_snitch_badness_threshold.description: Sets the performance threshold for dynamically routing client requests away from a poorly performing node.

internode_compression.description: Controls whether traffic between nodes is compressed. all compresses all traffic. none compresses no traffic. dc compresses between datacenters.

max_hints_file_size_in_mb.description: The maximum size of the hints file in Mb.

hints_flush_period_in_ms.description: The time, in ms, for the period in which hints are flushed to disk.

concurrent_materialized_view_writes.description: The maximum number of concurrent writes to materialized views.

commitlog_total_space_in_mb.description: The total size of the commit log in Mb.

mem.description: The memory used by the Cassandra service executor in Mb.

disk.description: The amount of disk used by the Cassandra service executor in Mb.

task.description: The DC/OS Apache Cassandra service cluster task configuration object.

mem.description: The memory used by the Cassandra cluster tasks in Mb.

sslStoragePort.description: The SSL port for inter-node communication.

startRpc.description: If true Thrift RPC is enable. This is deprecated by may be necessary for legacy applications.

rpcPort.description: The port for Thrift RPC communication.

thriftFramedTransportSizeInMb.description: Frame size (maximum field length) for Thrift.

tombstoneWarnThreshold.description: The maximum number of tombstones a query can scan before warning.

tombstoneFailureThreshold.description: The maximum number of tombstones a query can scan before aborting.

columnIndexSizeInKb.description: The granularity of the index of rows within a partition. For huge rows, decrease this setting to improve seek time. If you use key cache, be careful not to make this setting too large because key cache will be overwhelmed.

batchSizeWarnThresholdInKb.description: Warn the operator on a batch size exceeding this value in kilobytes. Caution should be taken on increasing the size of this threshold as it can lead to node instability.

batchSizeFailThresholdInKb.description: Fail batch sizes exceeding this value in kilobytes. Caution should be taken on increasing the size of this threshold as it can lead to node instability.

compactionThroughputMbPerSec.description: Throttles compaction to the specified total throughput across the node. Compaction frequency varies with direct proportion to write throughput and is necessary to limit the SSTable size. seeds.description: The number of Cassandra seed nodes in the cluster

jmx_port.description: The JMX port that will be used to interface with the Cassandra application.

num_tokens.description: The number of tokens assigned to each node.

hinted_handoff_enabled.description: If true, hinted handoff is enabled for the cluster.

max_hint_window_in_ms.description: The maximum amount of time, in ms, that hints are generates hints for an unresponsive node.

hinted_handoff_throttle_in_kb.description: The maximum throttle per delivery thread in kilobytes per second.

max_hints_delivery_threads.description: The maximum number of delivery threads for hinted handoff.

batchlog_replay_throttle_in_kb.description: The total throttle for log replay in Kpbs.

partitioner.description: The partitioner used to distribute rows across the cluster. Murmur3Partitioner is the recommended setting. RandomPartitioner and ByteOrderedPartitioner are supported for legacy applications.

key_cache_save_period.description: The duration in seconds that keys are saved in cache. Saved caches greatly improve cold-start speeds and has relatively little effect on I/O.

row_cache_size_in_mb.description: Maximum size of the row cache in memory. Row cache can save more time than key_cache_size_in_mb, but is space-intensive because it contains the entire row. Use the row cache only for hot rows or static rows. 0 disables the row cache.

row_cache_save_period.description: Duration in seconds that rows are saved in cache. 0 disables caching.

commitlog_sync_period_in_ms.description: The number of milliseconds between disk fsync calls.

commitlog_segment_size_in_mb.description: The size of each commit log segment in Mb.

concurrent_reads.description: For workloads with more data than can fit in memory, the bottleneck is reads fetching data from disk. Setting to (16 times the number of drives) allows operations to queue low enough in the stack so that the OS and drives can reorder them.

concurrent_writes.description: Writes in Cassandra are rarely I/O bound, so the ideal number of concurrent writes depends on the number of CPU cores in your system. The recommended value is 8 times the number of cpu cores.

concurrent_counter_writes.description: Counter writes read the current values before incrementing and writing them back. The recommended value is (16 times the number of drives) .

memtable_allocation_type.description: The type of allocations for the Cassandra memtable. heap_buffers keep all data on the JVM heap. offheap_buffers may reduce heap utilization for large string or binary values. offheap_objects may improve heap size for small integers or UUIDs as well. Both off heap options will increase read latency.

index_summary_resize_interval_in_minutes.description: How frequently index summaries should be re-sampled in minutes. This is done periodically to redistribute memory from the fixed-size pool to SSTables proportional their recent read rates.

start_rpc.description: If true Thrift RPC is enable. This is deprecated by may be necessary for legacy applications.

rpc_port.description: The port for Thrift RPC communication.

rpc_keepalive.description: Enables or TCP keepalive for RPC connections.

thrift_framed_transport_size_in_mb.description: Frame size (maximum field length) for Thrift.

tombstone_warn_threshold.description: The maximum number of tombstones a query can scan before warning.

tombstone_failure_threshold.description: The maximum number of tombstones a query can scan before aborting.

column_index_size_in_kb.description: The granularity of the index of rows within a partition. For huge rows, decrease this setting to improve seek time. If you use key cache, be careful not to make this setting too large because key cache will be overwhelmed.

batch_size_warn_threshold_in_kb.description: Warn the operator on a batch size exceeding this value in kilobytes. Caution should be taken on increasing the size of this threshold as it can lead to node instability.

batch_size_fail_threshold_in_kb.description: Fail batch sizes exceeding this value in kilobytes. Caution should be taken on increasing the size of this threshold as it can lead to node instability.

compaction_throughput_mb_per_sec.description: Throttles compaction to the specified total throughput across the node. Compaction frequency varies with direct proportion to write throughput and is necessary to limit the SSTable size. The recommended value is 16 to 32 times the rate of write throughput (in MB/second).

sstable_preemptive_open_interval_in_mb.description: When compacting, the replacement opens SSTables before they are completely written and uses in place of the prior SSTables for any range previously written. This setting helps to smoothly transfer reads between the SSTables by reducing page cache churn and keeps hot rows hot.

read_request_timeout_in_ms.description: The time that the coordinator waits for read operations to complete in ms.

range_request_timeout_in_ms.description: The time that the coordinator waits for range scans complete in ms.

write_request_timeout_in_ms.description: The time that the coordinator waits for write operations to complete in ms.

counter_write_request_timeout_in_ms.description: The time that the coordinator waits for counter write operations to complete in ms.

cas_contention_timeout_in_ms.description: The time for which the coordinator will retry CAS operations on the same row in ms.

truncate_request_timeout_in_ms.description: The time that the coordinator waits for truncate operations to complete in ms.

request_timeout_in_ms.description: The default timeout for all other requests in ms.

dynamic_snitch_update_interval_in_ms.description: The time, in ms, the snitch will wait before updating node scores.

dynamic_snitch_reset_interval_in_ms.description: The time, in ms, the snitch will wait before resetting node scores allowing bad nodes to recover.

dynamic_snitch_badness_threshold.description: Sets the performance threshold for dynamically routing client requests away from a poorly performing node.

internode_compression.description: Controls whether traffic between nodes is compressed. all compresses all traffic. none compresses no traffic. dc compresses between datacenters.

executor.description: The Cassandra service executor configuration object.

cpus.description: The cpu shares used by the Cassandra service executor.

mem.description: The memory used by the Cassandra service executor in Mb.

heap.description: The JVM heap used by the Cassandra service executor in Mb.

disk.description: The amount of disk used by the Cassandra service executor in Mb.

api_port.description: The port that the Cassandra executor API will accept on.

task.description: The Cassandra service cluster task configuration object.

cpus.description: The cpu shares used by the Cassandra service cluster tasks.

mem.description: The memory used by the Cassandra cluster tasks in Mb.

packages.postUninstallNotes:
DC/OS Cassandra Service has been uninstalled.
Please follow the instructions at https://docs.mesosphere.com/usage/services/cassandra/#uninstall to remove any persistent state if required.

packages.name: ceph
packages.description:
Ceph, a free-software storage platform, implements object storage on a single distributed computer cluster, and provides interfaces for object-, block- and file-level storage. Ceph aims primarily for completely distributed operation without a single point of failure, scalable to the exabyte level, and freely available.

Ceph replicates data and makes it fault-tolerant, using commodity hardware and requiring no specific hardware support. As a result of its design, the system is both self-healing and self-managing, aiming to minimize administration time and other costs.
packages.postInstallNotes:
Service installed.

Please access the UI through the endpoint created in Marathon-LB.
packages.preInstallNotes:
This DC/OS Service is currently EXPERIMENTAL. There may be bugs, incomplete features, incorrect documentation, or other discrepancies.

 Make sure to set correctly the mandatory `cluster_network` and `public_network` fields in the Advanced Installation menu.

Make sure to check the service tutorial at https://github.com/dcos/examples/tree/master/1.8/ceph

name.description: Name of this service instance.

cpus.description: CPU shares to allocate to each service instance.

mem.description: Memory to allocate to each service instance.

cluster_network.description: Network where the Ceph nodes live. This is usually the host network where the DC/OS nodes live. This network is assumed to be trusted.

public_network.description: Network that the Ceph services are exposed on, where the Ceph clients/consumers live. This is often the same as cluster_network unless Ceph is to be exposed outside the cluster.

ceph_api_port.description: The port where the Ceph API is listening on.

external_access.description:
Enable access from outside the cluster through Marathon-LB.
NOTE: this connection is unencrypted.

enable.description: Enable or disable creating a VIP for external access through a public node running Marathon-LB.

external_access_port.description: For external access, port number to be used for clear communication in the external Marathon-LB load balancer

virtual_host.description: For external access, Virtual Host URL to be used in the external load balancer.

packages.name: chronos
packages.description: A fault tolerant job scheduler for Mesos which handles dependencies and ISO8601 based schedules.
packages.postInstallNotes:
Chronos DCOS Service has been successfully installed!

	Documentation: http://mesos.github.io/chronos
	Issues: https://github.com/mesos/chronos/issues
packages.preInstallNotes: We recommend a minimum of one node with at least 1 CPU and 2GB of RAM available for the Chronos Service.

master.description: The URL of the Mesos master. The format is a comma-delimited list of hosts like zk://host1:port,host2:port/mesos. If using ZooKeeper, pay particular attention to the leading zk:// and trailing /mesos! If not using ZooKeeper, standard host:port patterns, like localhost:5050 or 10.0.0.5:5050,10.0.0.6:5050, are also acceptable.

assets-path.description: Set a local file system path to load assets from, instead of loading them from the packaged jar.

cassandra-consistency.description: Consistency to use for Cassandra (default = ANY)

cassandra-contact-points.description: Comma separated list of contact points for Cassandra

cassandra-keyspace.description: Keyspace to use for Cassandra (default = metrics)

cassandra-table.description: Table to use for Cassandra (default = chronos)

cassandra-ttl.description: TTL for records written to Cassandra (default = 31536000)

cluster-name.description: The name of the cluster where Chronos is run

cpus.description: CPU shares to allocate to each Chronos instance.

instances.description: Number of Chronos instances to run.

decline-offer-duration.description: The duration (milliseconds) for which to decline offers by default. (Default: Use Mesos default of 5 seconds).

disable-after-failures.description: Disables a job after this many failures have occurred (default = 0)

failover-timeout.description: The failover timeout in seconds for Mesos (default = 604800)

graphite-host-port.description: Host and port (in the form `host:port`) for Graphite

hostname.description: The advertised hostname stored in ZooKeeper so another standby host can redirect to this elected leader (default = localhost)

http-credentials.description: Credentials for accessing the http service. If empty, anyone can access the HTTP endpoint. A username:password pair is expected where the username must not contain ':'.

http-realm.description: The security realm (aka 'area') associated with the credentials (default = Mesosphere)

id.description: Unique identifier for the app consisting of a series of names separated by slashes.

leader-max-idle-time.description: The look-ahead time for scheduling tasks in milliseconds (default = 5000)

mail-server.description: Address of the mailserver in server:port format

mem.description: Memory (MB) to allocate to each Chronos instance.

mesos-role.description: The Mesos role to run tasks under (default = *)

mesos-task-cpu.description: Number of CPUs to request from Mesos for each task (default = 0.1)

mesos-task-disk.description: Amount of disk capacity to request from Mesos for each task (MB) (default = 256.0)

mesos-task-mem.description: Amount of memory to request from Mesos for each task (MB) (default = 128.0)

min-revive-offers-interval.description: Do not ask for all offers (also already seen ones) more often than this interval (ms). (default = 5000)

raven-dsn.description: Raven DSN for connecting to a raven or sentry event service

revive-offers-for-new-jobs.description: Whether to call reviveOffers for new or changed jobs. (default: do not use reviveOffers)

schedule-horizon.description: The look-ahead time for scheduling tasks in seconds (default = 60)

slack-channel.description: The channel to post to in Slack

slack-token.description: Token needed for posting to Slack

slack-url.description: Webhook URL for posting to Slack

task-epsilon.description: The default epsilon value for tasks, in seconds (default = 60)

user.description: The  user to run the processes under (default = root)

webui-url.description: The http(s) url of the web ui, defaulting to the advertised hostname

zk-hosts.description: The list of ZooKeeper servers for storing state (default = mesos.master:2181)

zk-path.description: Path in ZooKeeper for storing state (default = /state)

zk-timeout.description: The timeout for ZooKeeper in milliseconds (default = 10000)
