packages.postUninstallNotes: DCOS Confluent Platform has been uninstalled. Please run the framework_cleaner to remove any persistent state if required.
packages.name: confluent-kafka
packages.description: Confluent Platform running on DCOS
packages.postInstallNotes: DCOS Confluent Platform is being installed.

name.description: The name of the Confluent Platform service instance

placement_strategy.description: Broker placement strategy. See documentation. [ANY, NODE]

phase_strategy.description: Broker rollout strategy. See documentation. [INSTALL, STAGE]

cpus.description: Broker cpu requirements

mem.description: Broker mem requirements

disk.description: Broker disk requirements (only respected with persistent volumes)

kafka_advertise_host_ip.description: Automatically configure advertised.host.name with the IP address detected by /opt/mesosphere/detect_ip

auto_create_topics_enable.title: auto.create.topics.enable
auto_create_topics_enable.description: Enables auto creation of topic on the server

auto_leader_rebalance_enable.title: auto.leader.rebalance.enable
auto_leader_rebalance_enable.description: Enables auto leader balancing. A background thread checks and triggers leader balance if required at regular intervals

background_threads.title: background.threads
background_threads.description: The number of threads to use for various background processing tasks

compression_type.title: compression.type
compression_type.description: Specify the final compression type for a given topic. This configuration accepts the standard compression codecs ('gzip', 'snappy', lz4). It additionally accepts 'uncompressed' which is equivalent to no compression; and 'producer' which means retain the original compression codec set by the producer.

delete_topic_enable.title: delete.topic.enable
delete_topic_enable.description: Enables delete topic. Delete topic through the admin tool will have no effect if this config is turned off

leader_imbalance_check_interval_seconds.title: leader.imbalance.check.interval.seconds
leader_imbalance_check_interval_seconds.description: The frequency with which the partition rebalance check is triggered by the controller

leader_imbalance_per_broker_percentage.title: leader.imbalance.per.broker.percentage
leader_imbalance_per_broker_percentage.description: The ratio of leader imbalance allowed per broker. The controller would trigger a leader balance if it goes above this value per broker. The value is specified in percentage.

log_flush_interval_messages.title: log.flush.interval.messages
log_flush_interval_messages.description: The number of messages accumulated on a log partition before messages are flushed to disk

log_flush_offset_checkpoint_interval_ms.title: log.flush.offset.checkpoint.interval.ms
log_flush_offset_checkpoint_interval_ms.description: The frequency with which we update the persistent record of the last flush which acts as the log recovery point

log_flush_scheduler_interval_ms.title: log.flush.scheduler.interval.ms
log_flush_scheduler_interval_ms.description: The frequency in ms that the log flusher checks whether any log needs to be flushed to disk

log_retention_bytes.title: log.retention.bytes
log_retention_bytes.description: The maximum size of the log before deleting it

log_retention_hours.title: log.retention.hours
log_retention_hours.description: The number of hours to keep a log file before deleting it (in hours), tertiary to log.retention.ms property

log_roll_hours.title: log.roll.hours
log_roll_hours.description: The maximum time before a new log segment is rolled out (in hours), secondary to log.roll.ms property

log_roll_jitter_hours.title: log.roll.jitter.hours
log_roll_jitter_hours.description: The maximum jitter to subtract from logRollTimeMillis (in hours), secondary to log.roll.jitter.ms property

log_segment_bytes.title: log.segment.bytes
log_segment_bytes.description: The maximum size of a single log file

log_segment_delete_delay_ms.title: log.segment.delete.delay.ms
log_segment_delete_delay_ms.description: The amount of time to wait before deleting a file from the filesystem

message_max_bytes.title: message.max.bytes
message_max_bytes.description: The maximum size of message that the server can receive

min_insync_replicas.title: min.insync.replicas
min_insync_replicas.description: define the minimum number of replicas in ISR needed to satisfy a produce request with required.acks=-1 (or all)

num_io_threads.title: num.io.thread
num_io_threads.description: The number of io threads that the server uses for carrying out network requests

num_network_threads.title: num.network.threads
num_network_threads.description: The number of network threads that the server uses for handling network requests

num_recovery_threads_per_data_dir.title: num.recovery.threads.per.data.dir
num_recovery_threads_per_data_dir.description: The number of threads per data directory to be used for log recovery at startup and flushing at shutdown

num_replica_fetchers.title: num.replica.fetchers
num_replica_fetchers.description: Number of fetcher threads used to replicate messages from a source broker. Increasing this value can increase the degree of I/O parallelism in the follower broker.

offset_metadata_max_bytes.title: offset.metadata.max.bytes
offset_metadata_max_bytes.description: The maximum size for a metadata entry associated with an offset commit

offsets_commit_required_acks.title: offsets.commit.required.acks
offsets_commit_required_acks.description: The required acks before the commit can be accepted. In general, the default (-1) should not be overridden

offsets_commit_timeout_ms.title: offsets.commit.timeout.ms
offsets_commit_timeout_ms.description: Offset commit will be delayed until all replicas for the offsets topic receive the commit or this timeout is reached. This is similar to the producer request timeout.

offsets_load_buffer_size.title: offsets.load.buffer.size
offsets_load_buffer_size.description: Batch size for reading from the offsets segments when loading offsets into the cache.

offsets_retention_check_interval_ms.title: offsets.retention.check.interval.ms
offsets_retention_check_interval_ms.description: Frequency at which to check for stale offsets

offsets_retention_minutes.title: offsets.retention.minutes
offsets_retention_minutes.description: Log retention window in minutes for offsets topic

offsets_topic_compression_codec.title: offsets.topic.compression.codec
offsets_topic_compression_codec.description: Compression codec for the offsets topic - compression may be used to achieve 'atomic' commits

offsets_topic_num_partitions.title: offsets.topic.num.partitions
offsets_topic_num_partitions.description: The number of partitions for the offset commit topic (should not change after deployment).

offsets_topic_replication_factor.title: offsets.topic.replication.factor
offsets_topic_replication_factor.description: The replication factor for the offsets topic (set higher to ensure availability). To ensure that the effective replication factor of the offsets topic is the configured value, the number of alive brokers has to be at least the replication factor at the time of the first request for the offsets topic. If not, either the offsets topic creation will fail or it will get a replication factor of min(alive brokers, configured replication factor)

offsets_topic_segment_bytes.title: offsets.topic.segment.bytes
offsets_topic_segment_bytes.description: The offsets topic segment bytes should be kept relatively small in order to facilitate faster log compaction and cache loads

queued_max_requests.title: queued.max.requests
queued_max_requests.description: The number of queued requests allowed before blocking the network threads

quota_consumer_default.title: quota.consumer.default
quota_consumer_default.description: Any consumer distinguished by clientId/consumer group will get throttled if it fetches more bytes than this value per-second

quota_producer_default.title: quota.producer.default
quota_producer_default.description: Any producer distinguished by clientId will get throttled if it produces more bytes than this value per-second

replica_fetch_max_bytes.title: replica.fetch.max.bytes
replica_fetch_max_bytes.description: The number of byes of messages to attempt to fetch

replica_fetch_min_bytes.title: replica.fetch.min.bytes
replica_fetch_min_bytes.description: Minimum bytes expected for each fetch response. If not enough bytes, wait up to replicaMaxWaitTimeMs

replica_fetch_wait_max_ms.title: replica.fetch.wait.max.ms
replica_fetch_wait_max_ms.description: Max wait time for each fetcher request issued by follower replicas. This value should always be less than the replica.lag.time.max.ms at all times to prevent frequent shrinking of ISR for low throughput topics

replica_high_watermark_checkpoint_interv.title: replica.high.watermark.checkpoint.interval.ms
replica_high_watermark_checkpoint_interv.description: The frequency with which the high watermark is saved out to disk

replica_lag_time_max_ms.title: replica.lag.time.max.ms
replica_lag_time_max_ms.description: If a follower hasn't sent any fetch requests or hasn't consumed up to the leaders log end offset for at least this time, the leader will remove the follower from isr

replica_socket_receive_buffer_bytes.title: replica.socket.receive.buffer.bytes
replica_socket_receive_buffer_bytes.description: The socket receive buffer for network requests

replica_socket_timeout_ms.title: replica.socket.timeout.ms
replica_socket_timeout_ms.description: The socket timeout for network requests. Its value should be at least replica.fetch.wait.max.ms

request_timeout_ms.title: request.timeout.ms
request_timeout_ms.description: The configuration controls the maximum amount of time the client will wait for the response of a request. If the response is not received before the timeout elapses the client will resend the request if necessary or fail the request if retries are exhausted.

socket_receive_buffer_bytes.title: socket.receive.buffer.bytes
socket_receive_buffer_bytes.description: The SO_RCVBUF buffer of the socket sever sockets

socket_request_max_bytes.title: socket.request.max.bytes
socket_request_max_bytes.description: The maximum number of bytes in a socket request

socket_send_buffer_bytes.title: socket.send.buffer.bytes
socket_send_buffer_bytes.description: The SO_SNDBUF buffer of the socket sever sockets

unclean_leader_election_enable.title: unclean.leader.election.enable
unclean_leader_election_enable.description: Indicates whether to enable replicas not in the ISR set to be elected as leader as a last resort, even though doing so may result in data loss

connections_max_idle_ms.title: connections.max.idle.ms
connections_max_idle_ms.description: Idle connections timeout: the server socket processor threads close the connections that idle more than this

controlled_shutdown_enable.title: controlled.shutdown.enable
controlled_shutdown_enable.description: Enable controlled shutdown of the server

controlled_shutdown_max_retries.title: controlled.shutdown.max.retries
controlled_shutdown_max_retries.description: Controlled shutdown can fail for multiple reasons. This determines the number of retries when such failure happens

controlled_shutdown_retry_backoff_ms.title: controlled.shutdown.retry.backoff.ms
controlled_shutdown_retry_backoff_ms.description: Before each retry, the system needs time to recover from the state that caused the previous failure (Controller fail over, replica lag etc). This config determines the amount of time to wait before retrying.

controller_socket_timeout_ms.title: controller.socket.timeout.ms
controller_socket_timeout_ms.description: The socket timeout for controller-to-broker channels

default_replication_factor.title: default.replication.factor
default_replication_factor.description: Default replication factors for automatically created topics

fetch_purgatory_purge_interval_requests.title: fetch.purgatory.purge.interval.requests
fetch_purgatory_purge_interval_requests.description: The purge interval (in number of requests) of the fetch request purgatory

group_max_session_timeout_ms.title: group.max.session.timeout.ms
group_max_session_timeout_ms.description: The maximum allowed session timeout for registered consumers

group_min_session_timeout_ms.title: group.min.session.timeout.ms
group_min_session_timeout_ms.description: The minimum allowed session timeout for registered consumers

inter_broker_protocol_version.title: inter.broker.protocol.version
inter_broker_protocol_version.description: Specify which version of the inter-broker protocol will be used. This is typically bumped after all brokers were upgraded to a new version. Example of some valid values are: 0.8.0, 0.8.1, 0.8.1.1, 0.8.2, 0.8.2.0, 0.8.2.1, 0.9.0.0, 0.9.0.1 Check ApiVersion for the full list.

log_cleaner_backoff_ms.title: log.cleaner.backoff.ms
log_cleaner_backoff_ms.description: The amount of time to sleep when there are no logs to clean

log_cleaner_dedupe_buffer_size.title: log.cleaner.dedupe.buffer.size
log_cleaner_dedupe_buffer_size.description: The total memory used for log deduplication across all cleaner threads

log_cleaner_delete_retention_ms.title: log.cleaner.delete.retention.ms
log_cleaner_delete_retention_ms.description: How long are delete records retained?

log_cleaner_enable.title: log.cleaner.enable
log_cleaner_enable.description: Enable the log cleaner process to run on the server? Should be enabled if using any topics with a cleanup.policy=compact including the internal offsets topic. If disabled those topics will not be compacted and continually grow in size.

log_cleaner_io_buffer_load_factor.title: log.cleaner.io.buffer.load.factor
log_cleaner_io_buffer_load_factor.description: Log cleaner dedupe buffer load factor. The percentage full the dedupe buffer can become. A higher value will allow more log to be cleaned at once but will lead to more hash collisions

log_cleaner_io_buffer_size.title: log.cleaner.io.buffer.size
log_cleaner_io_buffer_size.description: The total memory used for log cleaner I/O buffers across all cleaner threads

log_cleaner_io_max_bytes_per_second.title: log.cleaner.io.max.bytes.per.second
log_cleaner_io_max_bytes_per_second.description: The log cleaner will be throttled so that the sum of its read and write i/o will be less than this value on average

log_cleaner_min_cleanable_ratio.title: log.cleaner.min.cleanable.ratio
log_cleaner_min_cleanable_ratio.description: The minimum ratio of dirty log to total log for a log to eligible for cleaning

log_cleaner_threads.title: log.cleaner.threads
log_cleaner_threads.description: The number of background threads to use for log cleaning

log_cleanup_policy.title: log.cleanup.policy
log_cleanup_policy.description: The default cleanup policy for segments beyond the retention window, must be either 'delete' or 'compact'

log_index_interval_bytes.title: log.index.interval.bytes
log_index_interval_bytes.description: The interval with which we add an entry to the offset index

log_index_size_max_bytes.title: log.index.size.max.bytes
log_index_size_max_bytes.description: The maximum size in bytes of the offset index

log_preallocate.title: log.preallocate
log_preallocate.description: Should pre allocate file when create new segment? If you are using Kafka on Windows, you probably need to set it to true.

log_retention_check_interval_ms.title: log.retention.check.interval.ms
log_retention_check_interval_ms.description: The frequency in milliseconds that the log cleaner checks whether any log is eligible for deletion

max_connections_per_ip.title: max.connections.per.ip
max_connections_per_ip.description: mum number of connections we allow from each ip address

max_connections_per_ip_overrides.title: max.connections.per.ip.overrides
max_connections_per_ip_overrides.description: Per-ip or hostname overrides to the default maximum number of connections

num_partitions.title: num.partitions
num_partitions.description: The default number of log partitions per topic

producer_purgatory_purge_interval_reques.title: producer.purgatory.purge.interval.requests
producer_purgatory_purge_interval_reques.description: The purge interval (in number of requests) of the producer request purgatory

replica_fetch_backoff_ms.title: replica.fetch.backoff.ms
replica_fetch_backoff_ms.description: The amount of time to sleep when fetch partition error occurs.

reserved_broker_max_id.title: reserved.broker.max.id
reserved_broker_max_id.description: Max number that can be used for a broker.id

metrics_num_samples.title: metrics.num.samples
metrics_num_samples.description: The number of samples maintained to compute metrics.

metrics_sample_window_ms.title: metrics.sample.window.ms
metrics_sample_window_ms.description: The number of samples maintained to compute metrics.

quota_window_num.title: quota.window.num
quota_window_num.description: The number of samples to retain in memory

quota_window_size_seconds.title: quota.window.size.seconds
quota_window_size_seconds.description: The time span of each sample

zookeeper_sync_time_ms.title: zookeeper.sync.time.ms
zookeeper_sync_time_ms.description: How far a ZK follower can be behind a ZK leader

log_cleaner_backoff_ms.description: The amount of time to sleep when there are no logs to clean

log_cleaner_dedupe_buffer_size.title: log.cleaner.dedupe.buffer.size
log_cleaner_dedupe_buffer_size.description: The total memory used for log deduplication across all cleaner threads

log_cleaner_delete_retention_ms.title: log.cleaner.delete.retention.ms
log_cleaner_delete_retention_ms.description: How long are delete records retained?

log_cleaner_enable.title: log.cleaner.enable
log_cleaner_enable.description: Enable the log cleaner process to run on the server? Should be enabled if using any topics with a cleanup.policy=compact including the internal offsets topic. If disabled those topics will not be compacted and continually grow in size.

log_cleaner_io_buffer_load_factor.title: log.cleaner.io.buffer.load.factor
log_cleaner_io_buffer_load_factor.description: Log cleaner dedupe buffer load factor. The percentage full the dedupe buffer can become. A higher value will allow more log to be cleaned at once but will lead to more hash collisions

log_cleaner_io_buffer_size.title: log.cleaner.io.buffer.size
log_cleaner_io_buffer_size.description: The total memory used for log cleaner I/O buffers across all cleaner threads

log_cleaner_io_max_bytes_per_second.title: log.cleaner.io.max.bytes.per.second
log_cleaner_io_max_bytes_per_second.description: The log cleaner will be throttled so that the sum of its read and write i/o will be less than this value on average

log_cleaner_min_cleanable_ratio.title: log.cleaner.min.cleanable.ratio
log_cleaner_min_cleanable_ratio.description: The minimum ratio of dirty log to total log for a log to eligible for cleaning

log_cleaner_threads.title: log.cleaner.threads
log_cleaner_threads.description: The number of background threads to use for log cleaning

log_cleanup_policy.title: log.cleanup.policy
log_cleanup_policy.description: The default cleanup policy for segments beyond the retention window, must be either 'delete' or 'compact'

log_index_interval_bytes.title: log.index.interval.bytes
log_index_interval_bytes.description: The interval with which we add an entry to the offset index

log_index_size_max_bytes.title: log.index.size.max.bytes
log_index_size_max_bytes.description: The maximum size in bytes of the offset index

log_preallocate.title: log.preallocate
log_preallocate.description: Should pre allocate file when create new segment? If you are using Kafka on Windows, you probably need to set it to true.

log_retention_check_interval_ms.title: log.retention.check.interval.ms
log_retention_check_interval_ms.description: The frequency in milliseconds that the log cleaner checks whether any log is eligible for deletion

max_connections_per_ip.title: max.connections.per.ip
max_connections_per_ip.description: mum number of connections we allow from each ip address

max_connections_per_ip_overrides.title: max.connections.per.ip.overrides
max_connections_per_ip_overrides.description: Per-ip or hostname overrides to the default maximum number of connections

num_partitions.title: num.partitions
num_partitions.description: The default number of log partitions per topic

producer_purgatory_purge_interval_reques.title: producer.purgatory.purge.interval.requests
producer_purgatory_purge_interval_reques.description: The purge interval (in number of requests) of the producer request purgatory

replica_fetch_backoff_ms.title: replica.fetch.backoff.ms
replica_fetch_backoff_ms.description: The amount of time to sleep when fetch partition error occurs.

reserved_broker_max_id.title: reserved.broker.max.id
reserved_broker_max_id.description: Max number that can be used for a broker.id

metrics_num_samples.title: metrics.num.samples
metrics_num_samples.description: The number of samples maintained to compute metrics.

metrics_sample_window_ms.title: metrics.sample.window.ms
metrics_sample_window_ms.description: The number of samples maintained to compute metrics.

quota_window_num.title: quota.window.num
quota_window_num.description: The number of samples to retain in memory

quota_window_size_seconds.title: quota.window.size.seconds
quota_window_size_seconds.description: The time span of each sample

zookeeper_sync_time_ms.title: zookeeper.sync.time.ms
zookeeper_sync_time_ms.description: How far a ZK follower can be behind a ZK leader

Apache Kafka by Confluent has been uninstalled.
Please follow the instructions at https://docs.mesosphere.com/current/usage/service-guides/kafka/uninstall to remove any persistent state if required.
packages.name: confluent-kafka
packages.description: Apache Kafka by Confluent
packages.postInstallNotes:
Apache Kafka by Confluent is being installed.

	Documentation: https://www.confluent.io/whitepaper/deploying-confluent-platform-with-mesosphere
	Community Support: https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/confluent-platform

name.description: The name of the Apache Kafka by Confluent instance

user.description: The user that the service will run as.

principal.description: The principal for the Kafka service instance.

secret_name.description: Name of the Secret Store credentials to use for DC/OS service authentication. This should be left empty unless service authentication is needed.

placement_strategy.description: Broker placement strategy. See documentation. [ANY, NODE]

phase_strategy.description: Broker rollout strategy. See documentation. [INSTALL, STAGE]

enable_replacement.description: Enable automated replacement of Brokers. WARNING: May cause data loss. See documentation.

recover_in_place_grace_period_secs.description: The minimum amount of time (in minutes) which must pass before a Broker may be destructively replaced.

min_delay_between_recovers_secs.description: The minimum amount of time (in seconds) which must pass between destructive replacements of Brokers.

enable_health_check.description: Enable automated detection of Broker failures which did not result in a Broker process exit.

health_check_delay_sec.description: The period of time (in seconds) waited before the health-check begins execution.

health_check_interval_sec.description: The period of time (in seconds) between health-check executions.

health_check_timeout_sec.description: The duration (in seconds) allowed for a health-check to complete before it is considered a failure.

health_check_grace_period_sec.description: The period of time after the delay (in seconds) before health-check failures count towards the maximum consecutive failures.

health_check_max_consecutive_failures.description: The the number of consecutive failures which cause a Broker process to exit.

cpus.description: Broker cpu requirements

mem.description: Broker mem requirements

heap.description: The Kafka process JVM heap configuration object

size.description: The amound of JVM heap, in MB, allocated to the Kafka broker process.

disk.description: Broker disk requirements (only respected with persistent volumes)

disk_type.description: Disk type to be used for storing broker data. See documentation. [ROOT, MOUNT]

port.description: Port for broker to listen on

executor.description: Kafka executor configuration properties

cpus.description: Executor cpu requirements

mem.description: Executor mem requirements

disk.description: Executor disk requirements

kafka_zookeeper_uri.title: The address of the Zookeeper cluster used by Kafka.
kafka_zookeeper_uri.description: This should be the address of the Zookeeper cluster Kafka will use.

kafka_advertise_host_ip.description: Automatically configure advertised.host.name with the IP address detected by /opt/mesosphere/detect_ip

auto_create_topics_enable.title: auto.create.topics.enable
auto_create_topics_enable.description: Enables auto creation of topic on the server

auto_leader_rebalance_enable.title: auto.leader.rebalance.enable
auto_leader_rebalance_enable.description: Enables auto leader balancing. A background thread checks and triggers leader balance if required at regular intervals

background_threads.title: background.threads
background_threads.description: The number of threads to use for various background processing tasks

compression_type.title: compression.type
compression_type.description: Specify the final compression type for a given topic. This configuration accepts the standard compression codecs ('gzip', 'snappy', lz4). It additionally accepts 'uncompressed' which is equivalent to no compression; and 'producer' which means retain the original compression codec set by the producer.

delete_topic_enable.title: delete.topic.enable
delete_topic_enable.description: Enables delete topic. Delete topic through the admin tool will have no effect if this config is turned off

leader_imbalance_check_interval_seconds.title: leader.imbalance.check.interval.seconds
leader_imbalance_check_interval_seconds.description: The frequency with which the partition rebalance check is triggered by the controller

leader_imbalance_per_broker_percentage.title: leader.imbalance.per.broker.percentage
leader_imbalance_per_broker_percentage.description: The ratio of leader imbalance allowed per broker. The controller would trigger a leader balance if it goes above this value per broker. The value is specified in percentage.

confluent_support_metrics_enable.title: confluent.support.metrics.enable
confluent_support_metrics_enable.description: Enable the Metrics feature to collect and report support metrics

confluent_support_customer_id.title: confluent.support.customer.id
confluent_support_customer_id.description: The customer ID under which support metrics will be collected and reported.   When set to 'anonymous', only a reduced set of metrics is collected and reported.

log_flush_interval_messages.title: log.flush.interval.messages
log_flush_interval_messages.description: The number of messages accumulated on a log partition before messages are flushed to disk

log_flush_offset_checkpoint_interval_ms.title: log.flush.offset.checkpoint.interval.ms
log_flush_offset_checkpoint_interval_ms.description: The frequency with which we update the persistent record of the last flush which acts as the log recovery point

log_flush_scheduler_interval_ms.title: log.flush.scheduler.interval.ms
log_flush_scheduler_interval_ms.description: The frequency in ms that the log flusher checks whether any log needs to be flushed to disk

log_retention_bytes.title: log.retention.bytes
log_retention_bytes.description: The maximum size of the log before deleting it

log_retention_hours.title: log.retention.hours
log_retention_hours.description: The number of hours to keep a log file before deleting it (in hours), tertiary to log.retention.ms property

log_roll_hours.title: log.roll.hours
log_roll_hours.description: The maximum time before a new log segment is rolled out (in hours), secondary to log.roll.ms property

log_roll_jitter_hours.title: log.roll.jitter.hours
log_roll_jitter_hours.description: The maximum jitter to subtract from logRollTimeMillis (in hours), secondary to log.roll.jitter.ms property

log_segment_bytes.title: log.segment.bytes
log_segment_bytes.description: The maximum size of a single log file

log_segment_delete_delay_ms.title: log.segment.delete.delay.ms
log_segment_delete_delay_ms.description: The amount of time to wait before deleting a file from the filesystem

message_max_bytes.title: message.max.bytes
message_max_bytes.description: The maximum size of message that the server can receive

min_insync_replicas.title: min.insync.replicas
min_insync_replicas.description: define the minimum number of replicas in ISR needed to satisfy a produce request with required.acks=-1 (or all)

num_io_threads.title: num.io.thread
num_io_threads.description: The number of io threads that the server uses for carrying out network requests

num_network_threads.title: num.network.threads
num_network_threads.description: The number of network threads that the server uses for handling network requests

num_recovery_threads_per_data_dir.title: num.recovery.threads.per.data.dir
num_recovery_threads_per_data_dir.description: The number of threads per data directory to be used for log recovery at startup and flushing at shutdown

num_replica_fetchers.title: num.replica.fetchers
num_replica_fetchers.description: Number of fetcher threads used to replicate messages from a source broker. Increasing this value can increase the degree of I/O parallelism in the follower broker.

offset_metadata_max_bytes.title: offset.metadata.max.bytes
offset_metadata_max_bytes.description: The maximum size for a metadata entry associated with an offset commit

offsets_commit_required_acks.title: offsets.commit.required.acks
offsets_commit_required_acks.description: The required acks before the commit can be accepted. In general, the default (-1) should not be overridden

offsets_commit_timeout_ms.title: offsets.commit.timeout.ms
offsets_commit_timeout_ms.description: Offset commit will be delayed until all replicas for the offsets topic receive the commit or this timeout is reached. This is similar to the producer request timeout.

offsets_load_buffer_size.title: offsets.load.buffer.size
offsets_load_buffer_size.description: Batch size for reading from the offsets segments when loading offsets into the cache.

offsets_retention_check_interval_ms.title: offsets.retention.check.interval.ms
offsets_retention_check_interval_ms.description: Frequency at which to check for stale offsets

offsets_retention_minutes.title: offsets.retention.minutes
offsets_retention_minutes.description: Log retention window in minutes for offsets topic

offsets_topic_compression_codec.title: offsets.topic.compression.codec
offsets_topic_compression_codec.description: Compression codec for the offsets topic - compression may be used to achieve 'atomic' commits

offsets_topic_num_partitions.title: offsets.topic.num.partitions
offsets_topic_num_partitions.description: The number of partitions for the offset commit topic (should not change after deployment).

offsets_topic_replication_factor.title: offsets.topic.replication.factor
offsets_topic_replication_factor.description: The replication factor for the offsets topic (set higher to ensure availability). To ensure that the effective replication factor of the offsets topic is the configured value, the number of alive brokers has to be at least the replication factor at the time of the first request for the offsets topic. If not, either the offsets topic creation will fail or it will get a replication factor of min(alive brokers, configured replication factor)

offsets_topic_segment_bytes.title: offsets.topic.segment.bytes
offsets_topic_segment_bytes.description: The offsets topic segment bytes should be kept relatively small in order to facilitate faster log compaction and cache loads

queued_max_requests.title: queued.max.requests
queued_max_requests.description: The number of queued requests allowed before blocking the network threads

quota_consumer_default.title: quota.consumer.default
quota_consumer_default.description: Any consumer distinguished by clientId/consumer group will get throttled if it fetches more bytes than this value per-second

quota_producer_default.title: quota.producer.default
quota_producer_default.description: Any producer distinguished by clientId will get throttled if it produces more bytes than this value per-second

replica_fetch_max_bytes.title: replica.fetch.max.bytes
replica_fetch_max_bytes.description: The number of byes of messages to attempt to fetch

replica_fetch_min_bytes.title: replica.fetch.min.bytes
replica_fetch_min_bytes.description: Minimum bytes expected for each fetch response. If not enough bytes, wait up to replicaMaxWaitTimeMs

replica_fetch_wait_max_ms.title: replica.fetch.wait.max.ms
replica_fetch_wait_max_ms.description: Max wait time for each fetcher request issued by follower replicas. This value should always be less than the replica.lag.time.max.ms at all times to prevent frequent shrinking of ISR for low throughput topics

replica_high_watermark_checkpoint_interv.title: replica.high.watermark.checkpoint.interval.ms
replica_high_watermark_checkpoint_interv.description: The frequency with which the high watermark is saved out to disk

replica_lag_time_max_ms.title: replica.lag.time.max.ms
replica_lag_time_max_ms.description: If a follower hasn't sent any fetch requests or hasn't consumed up to the leaders log end offset for at least this time, the leader will remove the follower from isr

replica_socket_receive_buffer_bytes.title: replica.socket.receive.buffer.bytes
replica_socket_receive_buffer_bytes.description: The socket receive buffer for network requests

replica_socket_timeout_ms.title: replica.socket.timeout.ms
replica_socket_timeout_ms.description: The socket timeout for network requests. Its value should be at least replica.fetch.wait.max.ms

request_timeout_ms.title: request.timeout.ms
request_timeout_ms.description: The configuration controls the maximum amount of time the client will wait for the response of a request. If the response is not received before the timeout elapses the client will resend the request if necessary or fail the request if retries are exhausted.

socket_receive_buffer_bytes.title: socket.receive.buffer.bytes
socket_receive_buffer_bytes.description: The SO_RCVBUF buffer of the socket sever sockets

socket_request_max_bytes.title: socket.request.max.bytes
socket_request_max_bytes.description: The maximum number of bytes in a socket request

socket_send_buffer_bytes.title: socket.send.buffer.bytes
socket_send_buffer_bytes.description: The SO_SNDBUF buffer of the socket sever sockets

unclean_leader_election_enable.title: unclean.leader.election.enable
unclean_leader_election_enable.description: Indicates whether to enable replicas not in the ISR set to be elected as leader as a last resort, even though doing so may result in data loss

connections_max_idle_ms.title: connections.max.idle.ms
connections_max_idle_ms.description: Idle connections timeout: the server socket processor threads close the connections that idle more than this

controlled_shutdown_enable.title: controlled.shutdown.enable
controlled_shutdown_enable.description: Enable controlled shutdown of the server

controlled_shutdown_max_retries.title: controlled.shutdown.max.retries
controlled_shutdown_max_retries.description: Controlled shutdown can fail for multiple reasons. This determines the number of retries when such failure happens

controlled_shutdown_retry_backoff_ms.title: controlled.shutdown.retry.backoff.ms
controlled_shutdown_retry_backoff_ms.description: Before each retry, the system needs time to recover from the state that caused the previous failure (Controller fail over, replica lag etc). This config determines the amount of time to wait before retrying.

controller_socket_timeout_ms.title: controller.socket.timeout.ms
controller_socket_timeout_ms.description: The socket timeout for controller-to-broker channels

default_replication_factor.title: default.replication.factor
default_replication_factor.description: Default replication factors for automatically created topics

fetch_purgatory_purge_interval_requests.title: fetch.purgatory.purge.interval.requests
fetch_purgatory_purge_interval_requests.description: The purge interval (in number of requests) of the fetch request purgatory

group_max_session_timeout_ms.title: group.max.session.timeout.ms
group_max_session_timeout_ms.description: The maximum allowed session timeout for registered consumers

group_min_session_timeout_ms.title: group.min.session.timeout.ms
group_min_session_timeout_ms.description: The minimum allowed session timeout for registered consumers

inter_broker_protocol_version.title: inter.broker.protocol.version
inter_broker_protocol_version.description: Specify which version of the inter-broker protocol will be used, which must align with log.message.format.version. This is typically bumped after all brokers were upgraded to a new version. Example of some valid values are: 0.8.0, 0.8.1, 0.8.1.1, 0.8.2, 0.8.2.0, 0.8.2.1, 0.9.0.0, 0.9.0.1, 0.10.0.0. Check ApiVersion for the full list.

log_message_format_version.title: log.message.format.version
log_message_format_version.description: Specify which version of the log message format will be used, which must align with inter.broker.protocol.version. This is a new setting as of 0.10.0.0, and should be left at 0.9.0 until clients are updated to 0.10.0.x. Clients on earlier versions may see a performance penalty if this is increased before they've upgraded. See the latest Kafka documentation for details.

log_cleaner_backoff_ms.title: log.cleaner.backoff.ms
log_cleaner_backoff_ms.description: The amount of time to sleep when there are no logs to clean

log_cleaner_dedupe_buffer_size.title: log.cleaner.dedupe.buffer.size
log_cleaner_dedupe_buffer_size.description: The total memory used for log deduplication across all cleaner threads

log_cleaner_delete_retention_ms.title: log.cleaner.delete.retention.ms
log_cleaner_delete_retention_ms.description: How long are delete records retained?

log_cleaner_enable.title: log.cleaner.enable
log_cleaner_enable.description: Enable the log cleaner process to run on the server? Should be enabled if using any topics with a cleanup.policy=compact including the internal offsets topic. If disabled those topics will not be compacted and continually grow in size.

log_cleaner_io_buffer_load_factor.title: log.cleaner.io.buffer.load.factor
log_cleaner_io_buffer_load_factor.description: Log cleaner dedupe buffer load factor. The percentage full the dedupe buffer can become. A higher value will allow more log to be cleaned at once but will lead to more hash collisions

log_cleaner_io_buffer_size.title: log.cleaner.io.buffer.size
log_cleaner_io_buffer_size.description: The total memory used for log cleaner I/O buffers across all cleaner threads

log_cleaner_io_max_bytes_per_second.title: log.cleaner.io.max.bytes.per.second
log_cleaner_io_max_bytes_per_second.description: The log cleaner will be throttled so that the sum of its read and write i/o will be less than this value on average

log_cleaner_min_cleanable_ratio.title: log.cleaner.min.cleanable.ratio
log_cleaner_min_cleanable_ratio.description: The minimum ratio of dirty log to total log for a log to eligible for cleaning

log_cleaner_threads.title: log.cleaner.threads
log_cleaner_threads.description: The number of background threads to use for log cleaning

log_cleanup_policy.title: log.cleanup.policy
log_cleanup_policy.description: The default cleanup policy for segments beyond the retention window, must be either 'delete' or 'compact'

log_index_interval_bytes.title: log.index.interval.bytes
log_index_interval_bytes.description: The interval with which we add an entry to the offset index

log_index_size_max_bytes.title: log.index.size.max.bytes
log_index_size_max_bytes.description: The maximum size in bytes of the offset index

log_preallocate.title: log.preallocate
log_preallocate.description: Should pre allocate file when create new segment? If you are using Kafka on Windows, you probably need to set it to true.

log_retention_check_interval_ms.title: log.retention.check.interval.ms
log_retention_check_interval_ms.description: The frequency in milliseconds that the log cleaner checks whether any log is eligible for deletion

max_connections_per_ip.title: max.connections.per.ip
max_connections_per_ip.description: mum number of connections we allow from each ip address

max_connections_per_ip_overrides.title: max.connections.per.ip.overrides
max_connections_per_ip_overrides.description: Per-ip or hostname overrides to the default maximum number of connections

num_partitions.title: num.partitions
num_partitions.description: The default number of log partitions per topic

producer_purgatory_purge_interval_reques.title: producer.purgatory.purge.interval.requests
producer_purgatory_purge_interval_reques.description: The purge interval (in number of requests) of the producer request purgatory

replica_fetch_backoff_ms.title: replica.fetch.backoff.ms
replica_fetch_backoff_ms.description: The amount of time to sleep when fetch partition error occurs.

reserved_broker_max_id.title: reserved.broker.max.id
reserved_broker_max_id.description: Max number that can be used for a broker.id

metrics_num_samples.title: metrics.num.samples
metrics_num_samples.description: The number of samples maintained to compute metrics.

metrics_sample_window_ms.title: metrics.sample.window.ms
metrics_sample_window_ms.description: The number of samples maintained to compute metrics.

quota_window_num.title: quota.window.num
quota_window_num.description: The number of samples to retain in memory

quota_window_size_seconds.title: quota.window.size.seconds
quota_window_size_seconds.description: The time span of each sample

zookeeper_sync_time_ms.title: zookeeper.sync.time.ms
zookeeper_sync_time_ms.description: How far a ZK follower can be behind a ZK leader

num_network_threads.description: The number of network threads that the server uses for handling network requests

num_recovery_threads_per_data_dir.title: num.recovery.threads.per.data.dir
num_recovery_threads_per_data_dir.description: The number of threads per data directory to be used for log recovery at startup and flushing at shutdown

num_replica_fetchers.title: num.replica.fetchers
num_replica_fetchers.description: Number of fetcher threads used to replicate messages from a source broker. Increasing this value can increase the degree of I/O parallelism in the follower broker.

offset_metadata_max_bytes.title: offset.metadata.max.bytes
offset_metadata_max_bytes.description: The maximum size for a metadata entry associated with an offset commit

offsets_commit_required_acks.title: offsets.commit.required.acks
offsets_commit_required_acks.description: The required acks before the commit can be accepted. In general, the default (-1) should not be overridden

offsets_commit_timeout_ms.title: offsets.commit.timeout.ms
offsets_commit_timeout_ms.description: Offset commit will be delayed until all replicas for the offsets topic receive the commit or this timeout is reached. This is similar to the producer request timeout.

offsets_load_buffer_size.title: offsets.load.buffer.size
offsets_load_buffer_size.description: Batch size for reading from the offsets segments when loading offsets into the cache.

offsets_retention_check_interval_ms.title: offsets.retention.check.interval.ms
offsets_retention_check_interval_ms.description: Frequency at which to check for stale offsets

offsets_retention_minutes.title: offsets.retention.minutes
offsets_retention_minutes.description: Log retention window in minutes for offsets topic

offsets_topic_compression_codec.title: offsets.topic.compression.codec
offsets_topic_compression_codec.description: Compression codec for the offsets topic - compression may be used to achieve 'atomic' commits

offsets_topic_num_partitions.title: offsets.topic.num.partitions
offsets_topic_num_partitions.description: The number of partitions for the offset commit topic (should not change after deployment).

offsets_topic_replication_factor.title: offsets.topic.replication.factor
offsets_topic_replication_factor.description: The replication factor for the offsets topic (set higher to ensure availability). To ensure that the effective replication factor of the offsets topic is the configured value, the number of alive brokers has to be at least the replication factor at the time of the first request for the offsets topic. If not, either the offsets topic creation will fail or it will get a replication factor of min(alive brokers, configured replication factor)

offsets_topic_segment_bytes.title: offsets.topic.segment.bytes
offsets_topic_segment_bytes.description: The offsets topic segment bytes should be kept relatively small in order to facilitate faster log compaction and cache loads

queued_max_requests.title: queued.max.requests
queued_max_requests.description: The number of queued requests allowed before blocking the network threads

quota_consumer_default.title: quota.consumer.default
quota_consumer_default.description: Any consumer distinguished by clientId/consumer group will get throttled if it fetches more bytes than this value per-second

quota_producer_default.title: quota.producer.default
quota_producer_default.description: Any producer distinguished by clientId will get throttled if it produces more bytes than this value per-second

replica_fetch_max_bytes.title: replica.fetch.max.bytes
replica_fetch_max_bytes.description: The number of byes of messages to attempt to fetch

replica_fetch_min_bytes.title: replica.fetch.min.bytes
replica_fetch_min_bytes.description: Minimum bytes expected for each fetch response. If not enough bytes, wait up to replicaMaxWaitTimeMs

replica_fetch_wait_max_ms.title: replica.fetch.wait.max.ms
replica_fetch_wait_max_ms.description: Max wait time for each fetcher request issued by follower replicas. This value should always be less than the replica.lag.time.max.ms at all times to prevent frequent shrinking of ISR for low throughput topics

replica_high_watermark_checkpoint_interv.title: replica.high.watermark.checkpoint.interval.ms
replica_high_watermark_checkpoint_interv.description: The frequency with which the high watermark is saved out to disk

replica_lag_time_max_ms.title: replica.lag.time.max.ms
replica_lag_time_max_ms.description: If a follower hasn't sent any fetch requests or hasn't consumed up to the leaders log end offset for at least this time, the leader will remove the follower from isr

replica_socket_receive_buffer_bytes.title: replica.socket.receive.buffer.bytes
replica_socket_receive_buffer_bytes.description: The socket receive buffer for network requests

replica_socket_timeout_ms.title: replica.socket.timeout.ms
replica_socket_timeout_ms.description: The socket timeout for network requests. Its value should be at least replica.fetch.wait.max.ms

request_timeout_ms.title: request.timeout.ms
request_timeout_ms.description: The configuration controls the maximum amount of time the client will wait for the response of a request. If the response is not received before the timeout elapses the client will resend the request if necessary or fail the request if retries are exhausted.

socket_receive_buffer_bytes.title: socket.receive.buffer.bytes
socket_receive_buffer_bytes.description: The SO_RCVBUF buffer of the socket sever sockets

socket_request_max_bytes.title: socket.request.max.bytes
socket_request_max_bytes.description: The maximum number of bytes in a socket request

socket_send_buffer_bytes.title: socket.send.buffer.bytes
socket_send_buffer_bytes.description: The SO_SNDBUF buffer of the socket sever sockets

unclean_leader_election_enable.title: unclean.leader.election.enable
unclean_leader_election_enable.description: Indicates whether to enable replicas not in the ISR set to be elected as leader as a last resort, even though doing so may result in data loss

connections_max_idle_ms.title: connections.max.idle.ms
connections_max_idle_ms.description: Idle connections timeout: the server socket processor threads close the connections that idle more than this

controlled_shutdown_enable.title: controlled.shutdown.enable
controlled_shutdown_enable.description: Enable controlled shutdown of the server

controlled_shutdown_max_retries.title: controlled.shutdown.max.retries
controlled_shutdown_max_retries.description: Controlled shutdown can fail for multiple reasons. This determines the number of retries when such failure happens

controlled_shutdown_retry_backoff_ms.title: controlled.shutdown.retry.backoff.ms
controlled_shutdown_retry_backoff_ms.description: Before each retry, the system needs time to recover from the state that caused the previous failure (Controller fail over, replica lag etc). This config determines the amount of time to wait before retrying.

controller_socket_timeout_ms.title: controller.socket.timeout.ms
controller_socket_timeout_ms.description: The socket timeout for controller-to-broker channels

default_replication_factor.title: default.replication.factor
default_replication_factor.description: Default replication factors for automatically created topics

fetch_purgatory_purge_interval_requests.title: fetch.purgatory.purge.interval.requests
fetch_purgatory_purge_interval_requests.description: The purge interval (in number of requests) of the fetch request purgatory

group_max_session_timeout_ms.title: group.max.session.timeout.ms
group_max_session_timeout_ms.description: The maximum allowed session timeout for registered consumers

group_min_session_timeout_ms.title: group.min.session.timeout.ms
group_min_session_timeout_ms.description: The minimum allowed session timeout for registered consumers

inter_broker_protocol_version.title: inter.broker.protocol.version
inter_broker_protocol_version.description: Specify which version of the inter-broker protocol will be used. This is typically bumped after all brokers were upgraded to a new version. Example of some valid values are: 0.8.0, 0.8.1, 0.8.1.1, 0.8.2, 0.8.2.0, 0.8.2.1, 0.9.0.0, 0.9.0.1 Check ApiVersion for the full list.

log_cleaner_backoff_ms.title: log.cleaner.backoff.ms
log_cleaner_backoff_ms.description: The amount of time to sleep when there are no logs to clean

log_cleaner_dedupe_buffer_size.title: log.cleaner.dedupe.buffer.size
log_cleaner_dedupe_buffer_size.description: The total memory used for log deduplication across all cleaner threads

log_cleaner_delete_retention_ms.title: log.cleaner.delete.retention.ms
log_cleaner_delete_retention_ms.description: How long are delete records retained?

log_cleaner_enable.title: log.cleaner.enable
log_cleaner_enable.description: Enable the log cleaner process to run on the server? Should be enabled if using any topics with a cleanup.policy=compact including the internal offsets topic. If disabled those topics will not be compacted and continually grow in size.

log_cleaner_io_buffer_load_factor.title: log.cleaner.io.buffer.load.factor
log_cleaner_io_buffer_load_factor.description: Log cleaner dedupe buffer load factor. The percentage full the dedupe buffer can become. A higher value will allow more log to be cleaned at once but will lead to more hash collisions

log_cleaner_io_buffer_size.title: log.cleaner.io.buffer.size
log_cleaner_io_buffer_size.description: The total memory used for log cleaner I/O buffers across all cleaner threads

log_cleaner_io_max_bytes_per_second.title: log.cleaner.io.max.bytes.per.second
log_cleaner_io_max_bytes_per_second.description: The log cleaner will be throttled so that the sum of its read and write i/o will be less than this value on average

log_cleaner_min_cleanable_ratio.title: log.cleaner.min.cleanable.ratio
log_cleaner_min_cleanable_ratio.description: The minimum ratio of dirty log to total log for a log to eligible for cleaning

log_cleaner_threads.title: log.cleaner.threads
log_cleaner_threads.description: The number of background threads to use for log cleaning

log_cleanup_policy.title: log.cleanup.policy
log_cleanup_policy.description: The default cleanup policy for segments beyond the retention window, must be either 'delete' or 'compact'

log_index_interval_bytes.title: log.index.interval.bytes
log_index_interval_bytes.description: The interval with which we add an entry to the offset index

log_index_size_max_bytes.title: log.index.size.max.bytes
log_index_size_max_bytes.description: The maximum size in bytes of the offset index

log_preallocate.title: log.preallocate
log_preallocate.description: Should pre allocate file when create new segment? If you are using Kafka on Windows, you probably need to set it to true.

log_retention_check_interval_ms.title: log.retention.check.interval.ms
log_retention_check_interval_ms.description: The frequency in milliseconds that the log cleaner checks whether any log is eligible for deletion

max_connections_per_ip.title: max.connections.per.ip
max_connections_per_ip.description: mum number of connections we allow from each ip address

max_connections_per_ip_overrides.title: max.connections.per.ip.overrides
max_connections_per_ip_overrides.description: Per-ip or hostname overrides to the default maximum number of connections

num_partitions.title: num.partitions
num_partitions.description: The default number of log partitions per topic

producer_purgatory_purge_interval_reques.title: producer.purgatory.purge.interval.requests
producer_purgatory_purge_interval_reques.description: The purge interval (in number of requests) of the producer request purgatory

replica_fetch_backoff_ms.title: replica.fetch.backoff.ms
replica_fetch_backoff_ms.description: The amount of time to sleep when fetch partition error occurs.

reserved_broker_max_id.title: reserved.broker.max.id
reserved_broker_max_id.description: Max number that can be used for a broker.id

metrics_num_samples.title: metrics.num.samples
metrics_num_samples.description: The number of samples maintained to compute metrics.

metrics_sample_window_ms.title: metrics.sample.window.ms
metrics_sample_window_ms.description: The number of samples maintained to compute metrics.

quota_window_num.title: quota.window.num
quota_window_num.description: The number of samples to retain in memory

quota_window_size_seconds.title: quota.window.size.seconds
quota_window_size_seconds.description: The time span of each sample

zookeeper_sync_time_ms.title: zookeeper.sync.time.ms
zookeeper_sync_time_ms.description: How far a ZK follower can be behind a ZK leader

name.description: The name of the Confluent Platform service instance

placement_strategy.description: Broker placement strategy. See documentation. [ANY, NODE]

phase_strategy.description: Broker rollout strategy. See documentation. [INSTALL, STAGE]

cpus.description: Broker cpu requirements

mem.description: Broker mem requirements

disk.description: Broker disk requirements (only respected with persistent volumes)

disk_type.description: Disk type to be used for storing broker data. See documentation. [ROOT, MOUNT]

kafka_advertise_host_ip.description: Automatically configure advertised.host.name with the IP address detected by /opt/mesosphere/detect_ip

auto_create_topics_enable.title: auto.create.topics.enable
auto_create_topics_enable.description: Enables auto creation of topic on the server

auto_leader_rebalance_enable.title: auto.leader.rebalance.enable
auto_leader_rebalance_enable.description: Enables auto leader balancing. A background thread checks and triggers leader balance if required at regular intervals

background_threads.title: background.threads
background_threads.description: The number of threads to use for various background processing tasks

compression_type.title: compression.type
compression_type.description: Specify the final compression type for a given topic. This configuration accepts the standard compression codecs ('gzip', 'snappy', lz4). It additionally accepts 'uncompressed' which is equivalent to no compression; and 'producer' which means retain the original compression codec set by the producer.

delete_topic_enable.title: delete.topic.enable
delete_topic_enable.description: Enables delete topic. Delete topic through the admin tool will have no effect if this config is turned off

leader_imbalance_check_interval_seconds.title: leader.imbalance.check.interval.seconds
leader_imbalance_check_interval_seconds.description: The frequency with which the partition rebalance check is triggered by the controller

leader_imbalance_per_broker_percentage.title: leader.imbalance.per.broker.percentage
leader_imbalance_per_broker_percentage.description: The ratio of leader imbalance allowed per broker. The controller would trigger a leader balance if it goes above this value per broker. The value is specified in percentage.

log_flush_interval_messages.title: log.flush.interval.messages
log_flush_interval_messages.description: The number of messages accumulated on a log partition before messages are flushed to disk

log_flush_offset_checkpoint_interval_ms.title: log.flush.offset.checkpoint.interval.ms
log_flush_offset_checkpoint_interval_ms.description: The frequency with which we update the persistent record of the last flush which acts as the log recovery point

log_flush_scheduler_interval_ms.title: log.flush.scheduler.interval.ms
log_flush_scheduler_interval_ms.description: The frequency in ms that the log flusher checks whether any log needs to be flushed to disk

log_retention_bytes.title: log.retention.bytes
log_retention_bytes.description: The maximum size of the log before deleting it

log_retention_hours.title: log.retention.hours
log_retention_hours.description: The number of hours to keep a log file before deleting it (in hours), tertiary to log.retention.ms property

log_roll_hours.title: log.roll.hours
log_roll_hours.description: The maximum time before a new log segment is rolled out (in hours), secondary to log.roll.ms property

log_roll_jitter_hours.title: log.roll.jitter.hours
log_roll_jitter_hours.description: The maximum jitter to subtract from logRollTimeMillis (in hours), secondary to log.roll.jitter.ms property

log_segment_bytes.title: log.segment.bytes
log_segment_bytes.description: The maximum size of a single log file

log_segment_delete_delay_ms.title: log.segment.delete.delay.ms
log_segment_delete_delay_ms.description: The amount of time to wait before deleting a file from the filesystem

message_max_bytes.title: message.max.bytes
message_max_bytes.description: The maximum size of message that the server can receive

min_insync_replicas.title: min.insync.replicas

quota_window_size_seconds.title: quota.window.size.seconds
quota_window_size_seconds.description: The time span of each sample

zookeeper_sync_time_ms.title: zookeeper.sync.time.ms
zookeeper_sync_time_ms.description: How far a ZK follower can be behind a ZK leader

packages.postUninstallNotes: DCOS Confluent Platform has been uninstalled. Please run the framework_cleaner to remove any persistent state if required.
packages.name: confluent-kafka
packages.description: Confluent Platform running on DCOS
packages.postInstallNotes: DCOS Confluent Platform is being installed.

name.description: The name of the Confluent Platform service instance

principal.description: The principal for the Kafka service instance.

secret_name.description: Name of the Secret Store credentials to use for DC/OS service authentication. This should be left empty unless service authentication is needed.

placement_strategy.description: Broker placement strategy. See documentation. [ANY, NODE]

phase_strategy.description: Broker rollout strategy. See documentation. [INSTALL, STAGE]

cpus.description: Broker cpu requirements

mem.description: Broker mem requirements

heap.description: The Kafka process JVM heap configuration object

size.description: The amound of JVM heap, in MB, allocated to the Kafka broker process.

disk.description: Broker disk requirements (only respected with persistent volumes)

disk_type.description: Disk type to be used for storing broker data. See documentation. [ROOT, MOUNT]

port.description: Port for broker to listen on

executor.description: Kafka executor configuration properties

cpus.description: Executor cpu requirements

mem.description: Executor mem requirements

disk.description: Executor disk requirements

kafka_advertise_host_ip.description: Automatically configure advertised.host.name with the IP address detected by /opt/mesosphere/detect_ip

auto_create_topics_enable.title: auto.create.topics.enable
auto_create_topics_enable.description: Enables auto creation of topic on the server

auto_leader_rebalance_enable.title: auto.leader.rebalance.enable
auto_leader_rebalance_enable.description: Enables auto leader balancing. A background thread checks and triggers leader balance if required at regular intervals

background_threads.title: background.threads
background_threads.description: The number of threads to use for various background processing tasks

compression_type.title: compression.type
compression_type.description: Specify the final compression type for a given topic. This configuration accepts the standard compression codecs ('gzip', 'snappy', lz4). It additionally accepts 'uncompressed' which is equivalent to no compression; and 'producer' which means retain the original compression codec set by the producer.

delete_topic_enable.title: delete.topic.enable
delete_topic_enable.description: Enables delete topic. Delete topic through the admin tool will have no effect if this config is turned off

leader_imbalance_check_interval_seconds.title: leader.imbalance.check.interval.seconds
leader_imbalance_check_interval_seconds.description: The frequency with which the partition rebalance check is triggered by the controller

leader_imbalance_per_broker_percentage.title: leader.imbalance.per.broker.percentage
leader_imbalance_per_broker_percentage.description: The ratio of leader imbalance allowed per broker. The controller would trigger a leader balance if it goes above this value per broker. The value is specified in percentage.

log_flush_interval_messages.title: log.flush.interval.messages
log_flush_interval_messages.description: The number of messages accumulated on a log partition before messages are flushed to disk

log_flush_offset_checkpoint_interval_ms.title: log.flush.offset.checkpoint.interval.ms
log_flush_offset_checkpoint_interval_ms.description: The frequency with which we update the persistent record of the last flush which acts as the log recovery point

log_flush_scheduler_interval_ms.title: log.flush.scheduler.interval.ms
log_flush_scheduler_interval_ms.description: The frequency in ms that the log flusher checks whether any log needs to be flushed to disk

log_retention_bytes.title: log.retention.bytes
log_retention_bytes.description: The maximum size of the log before deleting it

log_retention_hours.title: log.retention.hours
log_retention_hours.description: The number of hours to keep a log file before deleting it (in hours), tertiary to log.retention.ms property

log_roll_hours.title: log.roll.hours
log_roll_hours.description: The maximum time before a new log segment is rolled out (in hours), secondary to log.roll.ms property

log_roll_jitter_hours.title: log.roll.jitter.hours
log_roll_jitter_hours.description: The maximum jitter to subtract from logRollTimeMillis (in hours), secondary to log.roll.jitter.ms property

log_segment_bytes.title: log.segment.bytes
log_segment_bytes.description: The maximum size of a single log file

log_segment_delete_delay_ms.title: log.segment.delete.delay.ms
log_segment_delete_delay_ms.description: The amount of time to wait before deleting a file from the filesystem

message_max_bytes.title: message.max.bytes
message_max_bytes.description: The maximum size of message that the server can receive

min_insync_replicas.title: min.insync.replicas
min_insync_replicas.description: define the minimum number of replicas in ISR needed to satisfy a produce request with required.acks=-1 (or all)

num_io_threads.title: num.io.thread
num_io_threads.description: The number of io threads that the server uses for carrying out network requests

num_network_threads.title: num.network.threads
num_network_threads.description: The number of network threads that the server uses for handling network requests

num_recovery_threads_per_data_dir.title: num.recovery.threads.per.data.dir
num_recovery_threads_per_data_dir.description: The number of threads per data directory to be used for log recovery at startup and flushing at shutdown

num_replica_fetchers.title: num.replica.fetchers
num_replica_fetchers.description: Number of fetcher threads used to replicate messages from a source broker. Increasing this value can increase the degree of I/O parallelism in the follower broker.

offset_metadata_max_bytes.title: offset.metadata.max.bytes
offset_metadata_max_bytes.description: The maximum size for a metadata entry associated with an offset commit

offsets_commit_required_acks.title: offsets.commit.required.acks
offsets_commit_required_acks.description: The required acks before the commit can be accepted. In general, the default (-1) should not be overridden

offsets_commit_timeout_ms.title: offsets.commit.timeout.ms
offsets_commit_timeout_ms.description: Offset commit will be delayed until all replicas for the offsets topic receive the commit or this timeout is reached. This is similar to the producer request timeout.

offsets_load_buffer_size.title: offsets.load.buffer.size
offsets_load_buffer_size.description: Batch size for reading from the offsets segments when loading offsets into the cache.

offsets_retention_check_interval_ms.title: offsets.retention.check.interval.ms
offsets_retention_check_interval_ms.description: Frequency at which to check for stale offsets

offsets_retention_minutes.title: offsets.retention.minutes
offsets_retention_minutes.description: Log retention window in minutes for offsets topic

offsets_topic_compression_codec.title: offsets.topic.compression.codec
offsets_topic_compression_codec.description: Compression codec for the offsets topic - compression may be used to achieve 'atomic' commits

offsets_topic_num_partitions.title: offsets.topic.num.partitions
offsets_topic_num_partitions.description: The number of partitions for the offset commit topic (should not change after deployment).

offsets_topic_replication_factor.title: offsets.topic.replication.factor
offsets_topic_replication_factor.description: The replication factor for the offsets topic (set higher to ensure availability). To ensure that the effective replication factor of the offsets topic is the configured value, the number of alive brokers has to be at least the replication factor at the time of the first request for the offsets topic. If not, either the offsets topic creation will fail or it will get a replication factor of min(alive brokers, configured replication factor)

offsets_topic_segment_bytes.title: offsets.topic.segment.bytes
offsets_topic_segment_bytes.description: The offsets topic segment bytes should be kept relatively small in order to facilitate faster log compaction and cache loads

queued_max_requests.title: queued.max.requests
queued_max_requests.description: The number of queued requests allowed before blocking the network threads

quota_consumer_default.title: quota.consumer.default
quota_consumer_default.description: Any consumer distinguished by clientId/consumer group will get throttled if it fetches more bytes than this value per-second

quota_producer_default.title: quota.producer.default
quota_producer_default.description: Any producer distinguished by clientId will get throttled if it produces more bytes than this value per-second

replica_fetch_max_bytes.title: replica.fetch.max.bytes
replica_fetch_max_bytes.description: The number of byes of messages to attempt to fetch

replica_fetch_min_bytes.title: replica.fetch.min.bytes
replica_fetch_min_bytes.description: Minimum bytes expected for each fetch response. If not enough bytes, wait up to replicaMaxWaitTimeMs

replica_fetch_wait_max_ms.title: replica.fetch.wait.max.ms
replica_fetch_wait_max_ms.description: Max wait time for each fetcher request issued by follower replicas. This value should always be less than the replica.lag.time.max.ms at all times to prevent frequent shrinking of ISR for low throughput topics

replica_high_watermark_checkpoint_interv.title: replica.high.watermark.checkpoint.interval.ms
replica_high_watermark_checkpoint_interv.description: The frequency with which the high watermark is saved out to disk

replica_lag_time_max_ms.title: replica.lag.time.max.ms
replica_lag_time_max_ms.description: If a follower hasn't sent any fetch requests or hasn't consumed up to the leaders log end offset for at least this time, the leader will remove the follower from isr

replica_socket_receive_buffer_bytes.title: replica.socket.receive.buffer.bytes
replica_socket_receive_buffer_bytes.description: The socket receive buffer for network requests

replica_socket_timeout_ms.title: replica.socket.timeout.ms
replica_socket_timeout_ms.description: The socket timeout for network requests. Its value should be at least replica.fetch.wait.max.ms

request_timeout_ms.title: request.timeout.ms
request_timeout_ms.description: The configuration controls the maximum amount of time the client will wait for the response of a request. If the response is not received before the timeout elapses the client will resend the request if necessary or fail the request if retries are exhausted.

socket_receive_buffer_bytes.title: socket.receive.buffer.bytes
socket_receive_buffer_bytes.description: The SO_RCVBUF buffer of the socket sever sockets

socket_request_max_bytes.title: socket.request.max.bytes
socket_request_max_bytes.description: The maximum number of bytes in a socket request

socket_send_buffer_bytes.title: socket.send.buffer.bytes
socket_send_buffer_bytes.description: The SO_SNDBUF buffer of the socket sever sockets

unclean_leader_election_enable.title: unclean.leader.election.enable
unclean_leader_election_enable.description: Indicates whether to enable replicas not in the ISR set to be elected as leader as a last resort, even though doing so may result in data loss

connections_max_idle_ms.title: connections.max.idle.ms
connections_max_idle_ms.description: Idle connections timeout: the server socket processor threads close the connections that idle more than this

controlled_shutdown_enable.title: controlled.shutdown.enable
controlled_shutdown_enable.description: Enable controlled shutdown of the server

controlled_shutdown_max_retries.title: controlled.shutdown.max.retries
controlled_shutdown_max_retries.description: Controlled shutdown can fail for multiple reasons. This determines the number of retries when such failure happens

controlled_shutdown_retry_backoff_ms.title: controlled.shutdown.retry.backoff.ms
controlled_shutdown_retry_backoff_ms.description: Before each retry, the system needs time to recover from the state that caused the previous failure (Controller fail over, replica lag etc). This config determines the amount of time to wait before retrying.

controller_socket_timeout_ms.title: controller.socket.timeout.ms
controller_socket_timeout_ms.description: The socket timeout for controller-to-broker channels

default_replication_factor.title: default.replication.factor
default_replication_factor.description: Default replication factors for automatically created topics

fetch_purgatory_purge_interval_requests.title: fetch.purgatory.purge.interval.requests
fetch_purgatory_purge_interval_requests.description: The purge interval (in number of requests) of the fetch request purgatory

group_max_session_timeout_ms.title: group.max.session.timeout.ms
group_max_session_timeout_ms.description: The maximum allowed session timeout for registered consumers

group_min_session_timeout_ms.title: group.min.session.timeout.ms
group_min_session_timeout_ms.description: The minimum allowed session timeout for registered consumers

inter_broker_protocol_version.title: inter.broker.protocol.version
inter_broker_protocol_version.description: Specify which version of the inter-broker protocol will be used, which must align with log.message.format.version. This is typically bumped after all brokers were upgraded to a new version. Example of some valid values are: 0.8.0, 0.8.1, 0.8.1.1, 0.8.2, 0.8.2.0, 0.8.2.1, 0.9.0.0, 0.9.0.1, 0.10.0.0. Check ApiVersion for the full list.

log_message_format_version.title: log.message.format.version
log_message_format_version.description: Specify which version of the log message format will be used, which must align with inter.broker.protocol.version. This is a new setting as of 0.10.0.0, and should be left at 0.9.0 until clients are updated to 0.10.0.x. Clients on earlier versions may see a performance penalty if this is increased before they've upgraded. See the latest Kafka documentation for details.

log_cleaner_backoff_ms.title: log.cleaner.backoff.ms
log_cleaner_backoff_ms.description: The amount of time to sleep when there are no logs to clean

log_cleaner_dedupe_buffer_size.title: log.cleaner.dedupe.buffer.size
log_cleaner_dedupe_buffer_size.description: The total memory used for log deduplication across all cleaner threads

log_cleaner_delete_retention_ms.title: log.cleaner.delete.retention.ms
log_cleaner_delete_retention_ms.description: How long are delete records retained?

log_cleaner_enable.title: log.cleaner.enable
log_cleaner_enable.description: Enable the log cleaner process to run on the server? Should be enabled if using any topics with a cleanup.policy=compact including the internal offsets topic. If disabled those topics will not be compacted and continually grow in size.

log_cleaner_io_buffer_load_factor.title: log.cleaner.io.buffer.load.factor
log_cleaner_io_buffer_load_factor.description: Log cleaner dedupe buffer load factor. The percentage full the dedupe buffer can become. A higher value will allow more log to be cleaned at once but will lead to more hash collisions

log_cleaner_io_buffer_size.title: log.cleaner.io.buffer.size
log_cleaner_io_buffer_size.description: The total memory used for log cleaner I/O buffers across all cleaner threads

log_cleaner_io_max_bytes_per_second.title: log.cleaner.io.max.bytes.per.second
log_cleaner_io_max_bytes_per_second.description: The log cleaner will be throttled so that the sum of its read and write i/o will be less than this value on average

log_cleaner_min_cleanable_ratio.title: log.cleaner.min.cleanable.ratio
log_cleaner_min_cleanable_ratio.description: The minimum ratio of dirty log to total log for a log to eligible for cleaning

log_cleaner_threads.title: log.cleaner.threads
log_cleaner_threads.description: The number of background threads to use for log cleaning

log_cleanup_policy.title: log.cleanup.policy
log_cleanup_policy.description: The default cleanup policy for segments beyond the retention window, must be either 'delete' or 'compact'

log_index_interval_bytes.title: log.index.interval.bytes
log_index_interval_bytes.description: The interval with which we add an entry to the offset index

log_index_size_max_bytes.title: log.index.size.max.bytes
log_index_size_max_bytes.description: The maximum size in bytes of the offset index

log_preallocate.title: log.preallocate
log_preallocate.description: Should pre allocate file when create new segment? If you are using Kafka on Windows, you probably need to set it to true.

log_retention_check_interval_ms.title: log.retention.check.interval.ms
log_retention_check_interval_ms.description: The frequency in milliseconds that the log cleaner checks whether any log is eligible for deletion

max_connections_per_ip.title: max.connections.per.ip
max_connections_per_ip.description: mum number of connections we allow from each ip address

max_connections_per_ip_overrides.title: max.connections.per.ip.overrides
max_connections_per_ip_overrides.description: Per-ip or hostname overrides to the default maximum number of connections

num_partitions.title: num.partitions
num_partitions.description: The default number of log partitions per topic

producer_purgatory_purge_interval_reques.title: producer.purgatory.purge.interval.requests
producer_purgatory_purge_interval_reques.description: The purge interval (in number of requests) of the producer request purgatory

replica_fetch_backoff_ms.title: replica.fetch.backoff.ms
replica_fetch_backoff_ms.description: The amount of time to sleep when fetch partition error occurs.

reserved_broker_max_id.title: reserved.broker.max.id
reserved_broker_max_id.description: Max number that can be used for a broker.id

metrics_num_samples.title: metrics.num.samples
metrics_num_samples.description: The number of samples maintained to compute metrics.

metrics_sample_window_ms.title: metrics.sample.window.ms
metrics_sample_window_ms.description: The number of samples maintained to compute metrics.

quota_window_num.title: quota.window.num
quota_window_num.description: The number of samples to retain in memory

quota_window_size_seconds.title: quota.window.size.seconds
quota_window_size_seconds.description: The time span of each sample

zookeeper_sync_time_ms.title: zookeeper.sync.time.ms
zookeeper_sync_time_ms.description: How far a ZK follower can be behind a ZK leader
