controlled_shutdown_max_retries.title: controlled.shutdown.max.retries
controlled_shutdown_max_retries.description: Controlled shutdown can fail for multiple reasons. This determines the number of retries when such failure happens

controlled_shutdown_retry_backoff_ms.title: controlled.shutdown.retry.backoff.ms
controlled_shutdown_retry_backoff_ms.description: Before each retry, the system needs time to recover from the state that caused the previous failure (Controller fail over, replica lag etc). This config determines the amount of time to wait before retrying.

controller_socket_timeout_ms.title: controller.socket.timeout.ms
controller_socket_timeout_ms.description: The socket timeout for controller-to-broker channels

default_replication_factor.title: default.replication.factor
default_replication_factor.description: Default replication factors for automatically created topics

fetch_purgatory_purge_interval_requests.title: fetch.purgatory.purge.interval.requests
fetch_purgatory_purge_interval_requests.description: The purge interval (in number of requests) of the fetch request purgatory

group_max_session_timeout_ms.title: group.max.session.timeout.ms
group_max_session_timeout_ms.description: The maximum allowed session timeout for registered consumers

group_min_session_timeout_ms.title: group.min.session.timeout.ms
group_min_session_timeout_ms.description: The minimum allowed session timeout for registered consumers

inter_broker_protocol_version.title: inter.broker.protocol.version
inter_broker_protocol_version.description: Specify which version of the inter-broker protocol will be used, which must align with log.message.format.version. This is typically bumped after all brokers were upgraded to a new version. Example of some valid values are: 0.8.0, 0.8.1, 0.8.1.1, 0.8.2, 0.8.2.0, 0.8.2.1, 0.9.0.0, 0.9.0.1, 0.10.0.0. Check ApiVersion for the full list.

log_message_format_version.title: log.message.format.version
log_message_format_version.description: Specify which version of the log message format will be used, which must align with inter.broker.protocol.version. This is a new setting as of 0.10.0.0, and should be left at 0.9.0 until clients are updated to 0.10.0.x. Clients on earlier versions may see a performance penalty if this is increased before they've upgraded. See the latest Kafka documentation for details.

log_cleaner_backoff_ms.title: log.cleaner.backoff.ms
log_cleaner_backoff_ms.description: The amount of time to sleep when there are no logs to clean

log_cleaner_dedupe_buffer_size.title: log.cleaner.dedupe.buffer.size
log_cleaner_dedupe_buffer_size.description: The total memory used for log deduplication across all cleaner threads

log_cleaner_delete_retention_ms.title: log.cleaner.delete.retention.ms
log_cleaner_delete_retention_ms.description: How long are delete records retained?

log_cleaner_enable.title: log.cleaner.enable
log_cleaner_enable.description: Enable the log cleaner process to run on the server? Should be enabled if using any topics with a cleanup.policy=compact including the internal offsets topic. If disabled those topics will not be compacted and continually grow in size.

log_cleaner_io_buffer_load_factor.title: log.cleaner.io.buffer.load.factor
log_cleaner_io_buffer_load_factor.description: Log cleaner dedupe buffer load factor. The percentage full the dedupe buffer can become. A higher value will allow more log to be cleaned at once but will lead to more hash collisions

log_cleaner_io_buffer_size.title: log.cleaner.io.buffer.size
log_cleaner_io_buffer_size.description: The total memory used for log cleaner I/O buffers across all cleaner threads

log_cleaner_io_max_bytes_per_second.title: log.cleaner.io.max.bytes.per.second
log_cleaner_io_max_bytes_per_second.description: The log cleaner will be throttled so that the sum of its read and write i/o will be less than this value on average

log_cleaner_min_cleanable_ratio.title: log.cleaner.min.cleanable.ratio
log_cleaner_min_cleanable_ratio.description: The minimum ratio of dirty log to total log for a log to eligible for cleaning

log_cleaner_threads.title: log.cleaner.threads
log_cleaner_threads.description: The number of background threads to use for log cleaning

log_cleanup_policy.title: log.cleanup.policy
log_cleanup_policy.description: The default cleanup policy for segments beyond the retention window, must be either 'delete' or 'compact'

log_index_interval_bytes.title: log.index.interval.bytes
log_index_interval_bytes.description: The interval with which we add an entry to the offset index

log_index_size_max_bytes.title: log.index.size.max.bytes
log_index_size_max_bytes.description: The maximum size in bytes of the offset index

log_preallocate.title: log.preallocate
log_preallocate.description: Should pre allocate file when create new segment? If you are using Kafka on Windows, you probably need to set it to true.

log_retention_check_interval_ms.title: log.retention.check.interval.ms
log_retention_check_interval_ms.description: The frequency in milliseconds that the log cleaner checks whether any log is eligible for deletion

max_connections_per_ip.title: max.connections.per.ip
max_connections_per_ip.description: mum number of connections we allow from each ip address

max_connections_per_ip_overrides.title: max.connections.per.ip.overrides
max_connections_per_ip_overrides.description: Per-ip or hostname overrides to the default maximum number of connections

num_partitions.title: num.partitions
num_partitions.description: The default number of log partitions per topic

producer_purgatory_purge_interval_reques.title: producer.purgatory.purge.interval.requests
producer_purgatory_purge_interval_reques.description: The purge interval (in number of requests) of the producer request purgatory

replica_fetch_backoff_ms.title: replica.fetch.backoff.ms
replica_fetch_backoff_ms.description: The amount of time to sleep when fetch partition error occurs.

reserved_broker_max_id.title: reserved.broker.max.id
reserved_broker_max_id.description: Max number that can be used for a broker.id

metrics_num_samples.title: metrics.num.samples
metrics_num_samples.description: The number of samples maintained to compute metrics.

metrics_sample_window_ms.title: metrics.sample.window.ms
metrics_sample_window_ms.description: The number of samples maintained to compute metrics.

quota_window_num.title: quota.window.num
quota_window_num.description: The number of samples to retain in memory

quota_window_size_seconds.title: quota.window.size.seconds
quota_window_size_seconds.description: The time span of each sample

zookeeper_sync_time_ms.title: zookeeper.sync.time.ms
zookeeper_sync_time_ms.description: How far a ZK follower can be behind a ZK leader

packages.postUninstallNotes: Apache Kafka by Confluent has been uninstalled. Please run the framework_cleaner to remove any persistent state if required.
packages.name: confluent-kafka
packages.description: Apache Kafka by Confluent
packages.postInstallNotes: Apache Kafka by Confluent is being installed.

name.description: The name of the Apache Kafka by Confluent instance

principal.description: The principal for the Kafka service instance.

secret_name.description: Name of the Secret Store credentials to use for DC/OS service authentication. This should be left empty unless service authentication is needed.

placement_strategy.description: Broker placement strategy. See documentation. [ANY, NODE]

phase_strategy.description: Broker rollout strategy. See documentation. [INSTALL, STAGE]

enable_replacement.description: Enable automated replacement of Brokers. WARNING: May cause data loss. See documentation.

recover_in_place_grace_period_secs.description: The minimum amount of time (in minutes) which must pass before a Broker may be destructively replaced.

min_delay_between_recovers_secs.description: The minimum amount of time (in seconds) which must pass between destructive replacements of Brokers.

enable_health_check.description: Enable automated detection of Broker failures which did not result in a Broker process exit.

health_check_delay_sec.description: The period of time (in seconds) waited before the health-check begins execution.

health_check_interval_sec.description: The period of time (in seconds) between health-check executions.

health_check_timeout_sec.description: The duration (in seconds) allowed for a health-check to complete before it is considered a failure.

health_check_grace_period_sec.description: The period of time after the delay (in seconds) before health-check failures count towards the maximum consecutive failures.

health_check_max_consecutive_failures.description: The the number of consecutive failures which cause a Broker process to exit.

cpus.description: Broker cpu requirements

mem.description: Broker mem requirements

heap.description: The Kafka process JVM heap configuration object

size.description: The amound of JVM heap, in MB, allocated to the Kafka broker process.

disk.description: Broker disk requirements (only respected with persistent volumes)

disk_type.description: Disk type to be used for storing broker data. See documentation. [ROOT, MOUNT]

port.description: Port for broker to listen on

executor.description: Kafka executor configuration properties

cpus.description: Executor cpu requirements

mem.description: Executor mem requirements

disk.description: Executor disk requirements

kafka_zookeeper_uri.title: The address of the Zookeeper cluster used by Kafka.
kafka_zookeeper_uri.description: This should be the address of the Zookeeper cluster Kafka will use.

kafka_advertise_host_ip.description: Automatically configure advertised.host.name with the IP address detected by /opt/mesosphere/detect_ip

auto_create_topics_enable.title: auto.create.topics.enable
auto_create_topics_enable.description: Enables auto creation of topic on the server

auto_leader_rebalance_enable.title: auto.leader.rebalance.enable
auto_leader_rebalance_enable.description: Enables auto leader balancing. A background thread checks and triggers leader balance if required at regular intervals

background_threads.title: background.threads
background_threads.description: The number of threads to use for various background processing tasks

compression_type.title: compression.type
compression_type.description: Specify the final compression type for a given topic. This configuration accepts the standard compression codecs ('gzip', 'snappy', lz4). It additionally accepts 'uncompressed' which is equivalent to no compression; and 'producer' which means retain the original compression codec set by the producer.

delete_topic_enable.title: delete.topic.enable
delete_topic_enable.description: Enables delete topic. Delete topic through the admin tool will have no effect if this config is turned off

leader_imbalance_check_interval_seconds.title: leader.imbalance.check.interval.seconds
leader_imbalance_check_interval_seconds.description: The frequency with which the partition rebalance check is triggered by the controller

leader_imbalance_per_broker_percentage.title: leader.imbalance.per.broker.percentage
leader_imbalance_per_broker_percentage.description: The ratio of leader imbalance allowed per broker. The controller would trigger a leader balance if it goes above this value per broker. The value is specified in percentage.

confluent_support_metrics_enable.title: confluent.support.metrics.enable
confluent_support_metrics_enable.description: Enable the Metrics feature to collect and report support metrics

confluent_support_customer_id.title: confluent.support.customer.id
confluent_support_customer_id.description: The customer ID under which support metrics will be collected and reported.   When set to 'anonymous', only a reduced set of metrics is collected and reported.

log_flush_interval_messages.title: log.flush.interval.messages
log_flush_interval_messages.description: The number of messages accumulated on a log partition before messages are flushed to disk

log_flush_offset_checkpoint_interval_ms.title: log.flush.offset.checkpoint.interval.ms
log_flush_offset_checkpoint_interval_ms.description: The frequency with which we update the persistent record of the last flush which acts as the log recovery point

log_flush_scheduler_interval_ms.title: log.flush.scheduler.interval.ms
log_flush_scheduler_interval_ms.description: The frequency in ms that the log flusher checks whether any log needs to be flushed to disk

log_retention_bytes.title: log.retention.bytes
log_retention_bytes.description: The maximum size of the log before deleting it

log_retention_hours.title: log.retention.hours
log_retention_hours.description: The number of hours to keep a log file before deleting it (in hours), tertiary to log.retention.ms property

log_roll_hours.title: log.roll.hours
log_roll_hours.description: The maximum time before a new log segment is rolled out (in hours), secondary to log.roll.ms property

log_roll_jitter_hours.title: log.roll.jitter.hours
log_roll_jitter_hours.description: The maximum jitter to subtract from logRollTimeMillis (in hours), secondary to log.roll.jitter.ms property

log_segment_bytes.title: log.segment.bytes
log_segment_bytes.description: The maximum size of a single log file

log_segment_delete_delay_ms.title: log.segment.delete.delay.ms
log_segment_delete_delay_ms.description: The amount of time to wait before deleting a file from the filesystem

message_max_bytes.title: message.max.bytes
message_max_bytes.description: The maximum size of message that the server can receive

min_insync_replicas.title: min.insync.replicas
min_insync_replicas.description: define the minimum number of replicas in ISR needed to satisfy a produce request with required.acks=-1 (or all)

num_io_threads.title: num.io.thread
num_io_threads.description: The number of io threads that the server uses for carrying out network requests

num_network_threads.title: num.network.threads
num_network_threads.description: The number of network threads that the server uses for handling network requests

num_recovery_threads_per_data_dir.title: num.recovery.threads.per.data.dir
num_recovery_threads_per_data_dir.description: The number of threads per data directory to be used for log recovery at startup and flushing at shutdown

num_replica_fetchers.title: num.replica.fetchers
num_replica_fetchers.description: Number of fetcher threads used to replicate messages from a source broker. Increasing this value can increase the degree of I/O parallelism in the follower broker.

offset_metadata_max_bytes.title: offset.metadata.max.bytes
offset_metadata_max_bytes.description: The maximum size for a metadata entry associated with an offset commit

offsets_commit_required_acks.title: offsets.commit.required.acks
offsets_commit_required_acks.description: The required acks before the commit can be accepted. In general, the default (-1) should not be overridden

offsets_commit_timeout_ms.title: offsets.commit.timeout.ms
offsets_commit_timeout_ms.description: Offset commit will be delayed until all replicas for the offsets topic receive the commit or this timeout is reached. This is similar to the producer request timeout.

offsets_load_buffer_size.title: offsets.load.buffer.size
offsets_load_buffer_size.description: Batch size for reading from the offsets segments when loading offsets into the cache.

offsets_retention_check_interval_ms.title: offsets.retention.check.interval.ms
offsets_retention_check_interval_ms.description: Frequency at which to check for stale offsets

offsets_retention_minutes.title: offsets.retention.minutes
offsets_retention_minutes.description: Log retention window in minutes for offsets topic

offsets_topic_compression_codec.title: offsets.topic.compression.codec
offsets_topic_compression_codec.description: Compression codec for the offsets topic - compression may be used to achieve 'atomic' commits

offsets_topic_num_partitions.title: offsets.topic.num.partitions
offsets_topic_num_partitions.description: The number of partitions for the offset commit topic (should not change after deployment).

offsets_topic_replication_factor.title: offsets.topic.replication.factor
offsets_topic_replication_factor.description: The replication factor for the offsets topic (set higher to ensure availability). To ensure that the effective replication factor of the offsets topic is the configured value, the number of alive brokers has to be at least the replication factor at the time of the first request for the offsets topic. If not, either the offsets topic creation will fail or it will get a replication factor of min(alive brokers, configured replication factor)

offsets_topic_segment_bytes.title: offsets.topic.segment.bytes
offsets_topic_segment_bytes.description: The offsets topic segment bytes should be kept relatively small in order to facilitate faster log compaction and cache loads

queued_max_requests.title: queued.max.requests
queued_max_requests.description: The number of queued requests allowed before blocking the network threads

quota_consumer_default.title: quota.consumer.default
quota_consumer_default.description: Any consumer distinguished by clientId/consumer group will get throttled if it fetches more bytes than this value per-second

quota_producer_default.title: quota.producer.default
quota_producer_default.description: Any producer distinguished by clientId will get throttled if it produces more bytes than this value per-second

replica_fetch_max_bytes.title: replica.fetch.max.bytes
replica_fetch_max_bytes.description: The number of byes of messages to attempt to fetch

replica_fetch_min_bytes.title: replica.fetch.min.bytes
replica_fetch_min_bytes.description: Minimum bytes expected for each fetch response. If not enough bytes, wait up to replicaMaxWaitTimeMs

replica_fetch_wait_max_ms.title: replica.fetch.wait.max.ms
replica_fetch_wait_max_ms.description: Max wait time for each fetcher request issued by follower replicas. This value should always be less than the replica.lag.time.max.ms at all times to prevent frequent shrinking of ISR for low throughput topics

replica_high_watermark_checkpoint_interv.title: replica.high.watermark.checkpoint.interval.ms
replica_high_watermark_checkpoint_interv.description: The frequency with which the high watermark is saved out to disk

replica_lag_time_max_ms.title: replica.lag.time.max.ms
replica_lag_time_max_ms.description: If a follower hasn't sent any fetch requests or hasn't consumed up to the leaders log end offset for at least this time, the leader will remove the follower from isr

replica_socket_receive_buffer_bytes.title: replica.socket.receive.buffer.bytes
replica_socket_receive_buffer_bytes.description: The socket receive buffer for network requests

replica_socket_timeout_ms.title: replica.socket.timeout.ms
replica_socket_timeout_ms.description: The socket timeout for network requests. Its value should be at least replica.fetch.wait.max.ms

request_timeout_ms.title: request.timeout.ms
request_timeout_ms.description: The configuration controls the maximum amount of time the client will wait for the response of a request. If the response is not received before the timeout elapses the client will resend the request if necessary or fail the request if retries are exhausted.

socket_receive_buffer_bytes.title: socket.receive.buffer.bytes
socket_receive_buffer_bytes.description: The SO_RCVBUF buffer of the socket sever sockets

socket_request_max_bytes.title: socket.request.max.bytes
socket_request_max_bytes.description: The maximum number of bytes in a socket request

socket_send_buffer_bytes.title: socket.send.buffer.bytes
socket_send_buffer_bytes.description: The SO_SNDBUF buffer of the socket sever sockets

unclean_leader_election_enable.title: unclean.leader.election.enable
unclean_leader_election_enable.description: Indicates whether to enable replicas not in the ISR set to be elected as leader as a last resort, even though doing so may result in data loss

connections_max_idle_ms.title: connections.max.idle.ms
connections_max_idle_ms.description: Idle connections timeout: the server socket processor threads close the connections that idle more than this

controlled_shutdown_enable.title: controlled.shutdown.enable
controlled_shutdown_enable.description: Enable controlled shutdown of the server

controlled_shutdown_max_retries.title: controlled.shutdown.max.retries
controlled_shutdown_max_retries.description: Controlled shutdown can fail for multiple reasons. This determines the number of retries when such failure happens

controlled_shutdown_retry_backoff_ms.title: controlled.shutdown.retry.backoff.ms
controlled_shutdown_retry_backoff_ms.description: Before each retry, the system needs time to recover from the state that caused the previous failure (Controller fail over, replica lag etc). This config determines the amount of time to wait before retrying.

controller_socket_timeout_ms.title: controller.socket.timeout.ms
controller_socket_timeout_ms.description: The socket timeout for controller-to-broker channels

default_replication_factor.title: default.replication.factor
default_replication_factor.description: Default replication factors for automatically created topics

fetch_purgatory_purge_interval_requests.title: fetch.purgatory.purge.interval.requests
fetch_purgatory_purge_interval_requests.description: The purge interval (in number of requests) of the fetch request purgatory

group_max_session_timeout_ms.title: group.max.session.timeout.ms
group_max_session_timeout_ms.description: The maximum allowed session timeout for registered consumers

group_min_session_timeout_ms.title: group.min.session.timeout.ms
group_min_session_timeout_ms.description: The minimum allowed session timeout for registered consumers

inter_broker_protocol_version.title: inter.broker.protocol.version
inter_broker_protocol_version.description: Specify which version of the inter-broker protocol will be used, which must align with log.message.format.version. This is typically bumped after all brokers were upgraded to a new version. Example of some valid values are: 0.8.0, 0.8.1, 0.8.1.1, 0.8.2, 0.8.2.0, 0.8.2.1, 0.9.0.0, 0.9.0.1, 0.10.0.0. Check ApiVersion for the full list.

log_message_format_version.title: log.message.format.version
log_message_format_version.description: Specify which version of the log message format will be used, which must align with inter.broker.protocol.version. This is a new setting as of 0.10.0.0, and should be left at 0.9.0 until clients are updated to 0.10.0.x. Clients on earlier versions may see a performance penalty if this is increased before they've upgraded. See the latest Kafka documentation for details.

log_cleaner_backoff_ms.title: log.cleaner.backoff.ms
log_cleaner_backoff_ms.description: The amount of time to sleep when there are no logs to clean

log_cleaner_dedupe_buffer_size.title: log.cleaner.dedupe.buffer.size
log_cleaner_dedupe_buffer_size.description: The total memory used for log deduplication across all cleaner threads

log_cleaner_delete_retention_ms.title: log.cleaner.delete.retention.ms
log_cleaner_delete_retention_ms.description: How long are delete records retained?

log_cleaner_enable.title: log.cleaner.enable
log_cleaner_enable.description: Enable the log cleaner process to run on the server? Should be enabled if using any topics with a cleanup.policy=compact including the internal offsets topic. If disabled those topics will not be compacted and continually grow in size.

log_cleaner_io_buffer_load_factor.title: log.cleaner.io.buffer.load.factor
log_cleaner_io_buffer_load_factor.description: Log cleaner dedupe buffer load factor. The percentage full the dedupe buffer can become. A higher value will allow more log to be cleaned at once but will lead to more hash collisions

log_cleaner_io_buffer_size.title: log.cleaner.io.buffer.size
log_cleaner_io_buffer_size.description: The total memory used for log cleaner I/O buffers across all cleaner threads

log_cleaner_io_max_bytes_per_second.title: log.cleaner.io.max.bytes.per.second
log_cleaner_io_max_bytes_per_second.description: The log cleaner will be throttled so that the sum of its read and write i/o will be less than this value on average

log_cleaner_min_cleanable_ratio.title: log.cleaner.min.cleanable.ratio
log_cleaner_min_cleanable_ratio.description: The minimum ratio of dirty log to total log for a log to eligible for cleaning

log_cleaner_threads.title: log.cleaner.threads
log_cleaner_threads.description: The number of background threads to use for log cleaning

log_cleanup_policy.title: log.cleanup.policy
log_cleanup_policy.description: The default cleanup policy for segments beyond the retention window, must be either 'delete' or 'compact'

log_index_interval_bytes.title: log.index.interval.bytes
log_index_interval_bytes.description: The interval with which we add an entry to the offset index

log_index_size_max_bytes.title: log.index.size.max.bytes
log_index_size_max_bytes.description: The maximum size in bytes of the offset index

log_preallocate.title: log.preallocate
log_preallocate.description: Should pre allocate file when create new segment? If you are using Kafka on Windows, you probably need to set it to true.

log_retention_check_interval_ms.title: log.retention.check.interval.ms
log_retention_check_interval_ms.description: The frequency in milliseconds that the log cleaner checks whether any log is eligible for deletion

max_connections_per_ip.description: mum number of connections we allow from each ip address

max_connections_per_ip_overrides.title: max.connections.per.ip.overrides
max_connections_per_ip_overrides.description: Per-ip or hostname overrides to the default maximum number of connections

num_partitions.description: The default number of log partitions per topic

producer_purgatory_purge_interval_reques.description: The purge interval (in number of requests) of the producer request purgatory

replica_fetch_backoff_ms.description: The amount of time to sleep when fetch partition error occurs.

reserved_broker_max_id.title: reserved.broker.max.id
reserved_broker_max_id.description: Max number that can be used for a broker.id

metrics_num_samples.title: metrics.num.samples
metrics_num_samples.description: The number of samples maintained to compute metrics.

metrics_sample_window_ms.description: The number of samples maintained to compute metrics.

quota_window_num.description: The number of samples to retain in memory

packages.name: confluent-replicator

Confluent Enterprise Replicator for multi-data center synchronization of topic data

	Documentation: http://docs.confluent.io/3.1.1/connect/connect-replicator/docs/index.html
packages.postInstallNotes: Replicator service has been installed.
packages.preInstallNotes: Preparing to install Replicator service

name.description: Service name for the Confluent Enterprise Replicator

cpus.description: CPU shares to allocate to each connect worker instance.

mem.description: Memory (MB) to allocate to each connect worker instance.

heap.description: JVM heap allocation (in MB) for connect worker task; should be ~256MB less than total memory for the instance.

role.description: Deploy connect worker only on nodes with this role.

kafka-service.description: Target Apache Kafka by Confluent service to which these tasks will connect.

zookeeper-connect.description: Zookeeper Connect string for service cluster. Format is comma-separated list of <zk-host>:<zkport>/<kservice>

schema-registry-service.description: Schema Registry service to be used by connect workers. The named VIP associated with this service will be used to specify the converter-schema-registry-url's

cpus.description: CPU shares to allocate to each rest-proxy instance.

mem.description: Memory (MB) to allocate to each rest-proxy task.

name.description: Name for this rest-proxy application

role.description: Deploy rest-proxy only on nodes with this role.

vip-label.description: Label for external access to rest-proxy service. Format is <IP>:<port>

zookeeper-connect.description: Zookeeper Connect string for service cluster. Format is comma-separated list of <zk-host>:<zkport>/<kservice>

schema-registry-url.description: Connection URL for schema registry.  Recommended setting is the logical VIP address configured with the Schema Registry service

packages.postUninstallNotes: The Crate DCOS Service has been uninstalled and will no longer run.
packages.name: crate
packages.description: A Mesos Framework that allows running and resizing one or multiple Crate database clusters.
packages.postInstallNotes: Thanks for using Crate! Please read the documentation at https://crate.io/docs/stable/ for usage instructions.
packages.preInstallNotes:
The Crate DCOS Service implementation is experimental and therefore there may be bugs or incomplete features. Never use alpha version software in production!
	Please refer to the documentation at https://github.com/crate/crate-mesos-framework for information how to start a Crate cluster.

version.description: The version number of Crate that should be used for the framework.

cluster-name.description: The name of the Crate cluster.

http-port.description: HTTP port of the Crate instances.

transport-port.description: Internal transport port of the Crate instances.

data-path.description: The absolute path where Crate should store table data. Note that the user `crate` needs write access!

blob-path.description: The absolute path where Crate should store blobs. Note that the user `crate` needs write access!

zookeeper.description: URL to the Zookeeper Crate will communicate to (without protocol prefix, e.g. mesos-master:2181)

cpus.description: Required number of cpus.

api-port.description: Port for the REST API of the Crate Mesos Framework.

user.description: User to run the framework as.

role.description: Mesos role for the framework.

enabled.description: Whether framework authentication should be enabled. Requires principal and secret to be set.

principal.description: The Mesos principal used for framework authentication.

secret.description: The Mesos secret used for framework authentication.

cpus.description: Required number of CPUs.

heap.description: Required heap size.

disk.description: Required free disk space.

Datadog on DCOS successfully uninstalled.

packages.name: datadog
packages.description: Cloud-scale monitoring
packages.postInstallNotes:
Datadog on DCOS successfully installed.
Head over to https://app.datadoghq.com to monitor your DCOS cluster.
packages.preInstallNotes:
Pass your API key as a package option (datadog.api_key).
Also pass the number of Mesos slaves as an option (datadog.instances).
Marathon will make sure that the Datadog Agent runs only once per slave.

instances.description: Number of Marathon instances to run.

DataStax Enterprise is being installed.

	Documentation: https://docs.mesosphere.com/usage/services/cassandra/
	Issues: https://docs.mesosphere.com/support/

name.description: The name of the DSE service instance.

user.description: The user that the service will run as.

principal.description: The principal for the service instance.

cpus.description: The cpu shares used by the DSE Cassandra service scheduler.

mem.description: The memory used by the DSE Cassandra service scheduler in Mb.

heap.description: The JVM heap used by the DSE Cassandra service scheduler in Mb.

api_port.description: The port that the DSE Cassandra service API will accept on.

placement_strategy.description: The placement strategy for Cassandra nodes. This should always be NODE.

count.description: The number of Cassandra nodes in the cluster.

cpus.description: The number of cpu shares allocated to the Cassandra process.

mem.description: The amount of memory, in MB, allocated to the Cassandra process.

disk.description: The amount of disk, in MB, allocated to the Cassandra process.

disk_type.description: Disk type to be used for storing Cassandra data. See documentation. [ROOT, MOUNT]

heap.description: The Cassandra process JVM heap configuration object.

size.description: The amount of JVM heap, in MB, allocated to the Cassandra process.

new.description: The amount of JVM new generation heap, in MB, allocated to the Cassandra process.

gc.description: The Garbage collector for JVM (Either G1 or CMS).

seeds.description: The number of Cassandra seed nodes in the cluster

jmx_port.description: The JMX port that will be used to interface with the Cassandra application.

num_tokens.description: The number of tokens assigned to each node.

hinted_handoff_enabled.description: If true, hinted handoff is enabled for the cluster.

max_hint_window_in_ms.description: The maximum amount of time, in ms, that hints are generates hints for an unresponsive node.

hinted_handoff_throttle_in_kb.description: The maximum throttle per delivery thread in kilobytes per second.

max_hints_delivery_threads.description: The maximum number of delivery threads for hinted handoff.

batchlog_replay_throttle_in_kb.description: The total throttle for log replay in Kpbs.

partitioner.description: The partitioner used to distribute rows across the cluster. Murmur3Partitioner is the recommended setting. RandomPartitioner and ByteOrderedPartitioner are supported for legacy applications.

key_cache_save_period.description: The duration in seconds that keys are saved in cache. Saved caches greatly improve cold-start speeds and has relatively little effect on I/O.

row_cache_size_in_mb.description: Maximum size of the row cache in memory. Row cache can save more time than key_cache_size_in_mb, but is space-intensive because it contains the entire row. Use the row cache only for hot rows or static rows. 0 disables the row cache.

row_cache_save_period.description: Duration in seconds that rows are saved in cache. 0 disables caching.

commitlog_sync_period_in_ms.description: The number of milliseconds between disk fsync calls.

commitlog_segment_size_in_mb.description: The size of each commit log segment in Mb.

concurrent_reads.description: For workloads with more data than can fit in memory, the bottleneck is reads fetching data from disk. Setting to (16 times the number of drives) allows operations to queue low enough in the stack so that the OS and drives can reorder them.

concurrent_writes.description: Writes in Cassandra are rarely I/O bound, so the ideal number of concurrent writes depends on the number of CPU cores in your system. The recommended value is 8 times the number of cpu cores.

concurrent_counter_writes.description: Counter writes read the current values before incrementing and writing them back. The recommended value is (16 times the number of drives) .

memtable_allocation_type.description: The type of allocations for the Cassandra memtable. heap_buffers keep all data on the JVM heap. offheap_buffers may reduce heap utilization for large string or binary values. offheap_objects may improve heap size for small integers or UUIDs as well. Both off heap options will increase read latency.

index_summary_resize_interval_in_minutes.description: How frequently index summaries should be re-sampled in minutes. This is done periodically to redistribute memory from the fixed-size pool to SSTables proportional their recent read rates.

start_rpc.description: If true Thrift RPC is enable. This is deprecated by may be necessary for legacy applications.

rpc_port.description: The port for Thrift RPC communication.

rpc_keepalive.description: Enables or TCP keepalive for RPC connections.

thrift_framed_transport_size_in_mb.description: Frame size (maximum field length) for Thrift.

tombstone_warn_threshold.description: The maximum number of tombstones a query can scan before warning.

tombstone_failure_threshold.description: The maximum number of tombstones a query can scan before aborting.

column_index_size_in_kb.description: The granularity of the index of rows within a partition. For huge rows, decrease this setting to improve seek time. If you use key cache, be careful not to make this setting too large because key cache will be overwhelmed.

batch_size_warn_threshold_in_kb.description: Warn the operator on a batch size exceeding this value in kilobytes. Caution should be taken on increasing the size of this threshold as it can lead to node instability.

batch_size_fail_threshold_in_kb.description: Fail batch sizes exceeding this value in kilobytes. Caution should be taken on increasing the size of this threshold as it can lead to node instability.

compaction_throughput_mb_per_sec.description: Throttles compaction to the specified total throughput across the node. Compaction frequency varies with direct proportion to write throughput and is necessary to limit the SSTable size. The recommended value is 16 to 32 times the rate of write throughput (in MB/second).

sstable_preemptive_open_interval_in_mb.description: When compacting, the replacement opens SSTables before they are completely written and uses in place of the prior SSTables for any range previously written. This setting helps to smoothly transfer reads between the SSTables by reducing page cache churn and keeps hot rows hot.

read_request_timeout_in_ms.description: The time that the coordinator waits for read operations to complete in ms.

range_request_timeout_in_ms.description: The time that the coordinator waits for range scans complete in ms.

write_request_timeout_in_ms.description: The time that the coordinator waits for write operations to complete in ms.

counter_write_request_timeout_in_ms.description: The time that the coordinator waits for counter write operations to complete in ms.

cas_contention_timeout_in_ms.description: The time for which the coordinator will retry CAS operations on the same row in ms.

truncate_request_timeout_in_ms.description: The time that the coordinator waits for truncate operations to complete in ms.

request_timeout_in_ms.description: The default timeout for all other requests in ms.

dynamic_snitch_update_interval_in_ms.description: The time, in ms, the snitch will wait before updating node scores.

dynamic_snitch_reset_interval_in_ms.description: The time, in ms, the snitch will wait before resetting node scores allowing bad nodes to recover.

dynamic_snitch_badness_threshold.description: Sets the performance threshold for dynamically routing client requests away from a poorly performing node.

internode_compression.description: Controls whether traffic between nodes is compressed. all compresses all traffic. none compresses no traffic. dc compresses between datacenters.

max_hints_file_size_in_mb.description: The maximum size of the hints file in Mb.

hints_flush_period_in_ms.description: The time, in ms, for the period in which hints are flushed to disk.

concurrent_materialized_view_writes.description: The maximum number of concurrent writes to materialized views.

commitlog_total_space_in_mb.description: The total size of the commit log in Mb.

use_dse_role_manager.description: If true the DSE Role manager is used.

transitional_mode.description: The transitional_mode option allows DSE authentication and authorization to operate in a transitional mode during setup of authorization in a cluster.

enabled.description: If true the DSE Authentication manager is used.

default_scheme.description: The default scheme for authentication. Note that internal will be enabled as an alternate.

scheme_permissions.description: If true than scheme permissions must be granted on a per role basis.

allow_digest_with_kerberos.description: If true than message digest authentication is also allowed for Kerberos auth.

plain_text_without_ssl.description: The action taken when plain text auth request are sent over an unencrypted channel.

enabled.description: If true DataStax authorization will be used.

kerberos_options.description: Kerberos configuration options. These will be ignored unless Kerberos is selected for authentication and DSE authentication is enabled.

keytab.description: The name of the keytab file pointed to by the ketab_location property in the executor configuration object.

service_principal.description: The Kerberos service principal for DSE natice connections.

http_principal.description: The Kerberos service principal for HTTP connections.

qop.description: The quality of protection for authentication. Note that auth-conf is currently not supported due to a lack of SSL support.

refresh_rate_ms.description: The refresh rate for node health estimation.

uptime_ramp_up_period_seconds.description: The amount of continuous uptime required for the node to reach the maximum uptime score.

dropped_mutation_window_minutes.description: The window in the past over which the rate of dropped mutations affects the node health score.

enabled.description: If true lease metrics are enabled.

ttl_seconds.description: The length of time the lease holder log persists.

enabled.description: If ture, audit logging is enabled

retention_time.description: The retention time for audit logs. Note, 0 indicates forever.

mode.description: The mode of the logger. sync will block request for auditing.

batch_size.description: The batch size for audit log writes. Only used in async.

flush_time.description: The flush time for audit log writes. Only used in async.

queue_size.description: The size of the queue feeding the asynchronous audit log writer threads.Only used in async.

write_consistency.description: The consistency level used to write audit events

port.description: The port for internode communication.

executor.description: The Cassandra service executor configuration object.

cpus.description: The cpu shares used by the Cassandra service executor.

mem.description: The memory used by the Cassandra service executor in Mb.

heap.description: The JVM heap used by the Cassandra service executor in Mb.

disk.description: The amount of disk used by the Cassandra service executor in Mb.

api_port.description: The port that the Cassandra executor API will accept on.

keytab_location.description: URL pointing to the location of the keytab to use if the Kerberos is enabled.

task.description: The Cassandra service cluster task configuration object.

cpus.description: The cpu shares used by the Cassandra service cluster tasks.

mem.description: The memory used by the Cassandra cluster tasks in Mb.

transitional_mode.description: The transitional_mode option allows DSE authentication and authorization to operate in a transitional mode during setup of authorization in a cluster.

enabled.description: If true the DSE Authentication manager is used.

default_scheme.description: The default scheme for authentication. Note that internal will be enabled as an alternate.

scheme_permissions.description: If true than scheme permissions must be granted on a per role basis.

allow_digest_with_kerberos.description: If true than message digest authentication is also allowed for Kerberos auth.

plain_text_without_ssl.description: The action taken when plain text auth request are sent over an unencrypted channel.

enabled.description: If true DataStax authorization will be used.

kerberos_options.description: Kerberos configuration options. These will be ignored unless Kerberos is selected for authentication and DSE authentication is enabled.

keytab.description: The name of the keytab file pointed to by the ketab_location property in the executor configuration object.

service_principal.description: The Kerberos service principal for DSE natice connections.

http_principal.description: The Kerberos service principal for HTTP connections.

qop.description: The quality of protection for authentication. Note that auth-conf is currently not supported due to a lack of SSL support.

refresh_rate_ms.description: The refresh rate for node health estimation.

uptime_ramp_up_period_seconds.description: The amount of continuous uptime required for the node to reach the maximum uptime score.

dropped_mutation_window_minutes.description: The window in the past over which the rate of dropped mutations affects the node health score.

enabled.description: If true lease metrics are enabled.

ttl_seconds.description: The length of time the lease holder log persists.

enabled.description: If ture, audit logging is enabled

retention_time.description: The retention time for audit logs. Note, 0 indicates forever.

mode.description: The mode of the logger. sync will block request for auditing.

batch_size.description: The batch size for audit log writes. Only used in async.

flush_time.description: The flush time for audit log writes. Only used in async.

queue_size.description: The size of the queue feeding the asynchronous audit log writer threads.Only used in async.

write_consistency.description: The consistency level used to write audit events

port.description: The port for internode communication.

executor.description: The Cassandra service executor configuration object.

cpus.description: The cpu shares used by the Cassandra service executor.

mem.description: The memory used by the Cassandra service executor in Mb.

heap.description: The JVM heap used by the Cassandra service executor in Mb.

disk.description: The amount of disk used by the Cassandra service executor in Mb.

api_port.description: The port that the Cassandra executor API will accept on.

keytab_location.description: URL pointing to the location of the keytab to use if the Kerberos is enabled.

task.description: The Cassandra service cluster task configuration object.

cpus.description: The cpu shares used by the Cassandra service cluster tasks.

mem.description: The memory used by the Cassandra cluster tasks in Mb.

packages.name: dse
packages.description: DSE running on DCOS
packages.postInstallNotes:
DCOS DSE has been successfully installed!

	Documentation: https://docs.mesosphere.com/usage/services/cassandra/
	Issues: https://docs.mesosphere.com/support/

name.description: The name of the DSE Cassandra service instance.

user.description: The user that the service will run as.

principal.description: The principal for the service instance.

secret_name.description: Name of the Secret Store credentials to use for DC/OS service authentication. This should be left empty unless service authentication is needed.

cpus.description: The cpu shares used by the DSE Cassandra service scheduler.

mem.description: The memory used by the DSE Cassandra service scheduler in Mb.

heap.description: The JVM heap used by the DSE Cassandra service scheduler in Mb.

api_port.description: The port that the DSE Cassandra service API will accept on.

placement_strategy.description: The placement strategy for Cassandra nodes. This should always be NODE.

data_center.description: The data center that the Cassandra cluster managed by the service is deployed in.

data_center_url.description: The URL of from which the the data center for the cluster managed by this service instance will server its data center information.

external_data_center_urls.description: A comma separated list of the URLs from which this service instance retrieve data center info to form a cluster spanning multiple data centers.

count.description: The number of Cassandra nodes in the cluster.

cpus.description: The number of cpu shares allocated to the Cassandra process.

mem.description: The amount of memory, in MB, allocated to the Cassandra process.

disk.description: The amount of disk, in MB, allocated to the Cassandra process.

disk_type.description: Disk type to be used for storing Cassandra data. See documentation. [ROOT, MOUNT]

heap.description: The Cassandra process JVM heap configuration object.

size.description: The amount of JVM heap, in MB, allocated to the Cassandra process.

new.description: The amount of JVM new generation heap, in MB, allocated to the Cassandra process.

gc.description: The Garbage collector for JVM (Either G1 or CMS).

seeds.description: The number of Cassandra seed nodes in the cluster

cluster_name.description: The name of the cluster managed by the Service

jmx_port.description: The JMX port that will be used to interface with the Cassandra application.

num_tokens.description: The number of tokens assigned to each node.

hinted_handoff_enabled.description: If true, hinted handoff is enabled for the cluster.

max_hint_window_in_ms.description: The maximum amount of time, in ms, that hints are generates hints for an unresponsive node.

hinted_handoff_throttle_in_kb.description: The maximum throttle per delivery thread in kilobytes per second.

max_hints_delivery_threads.description: The maximum number of delivery threads for hinted handoff.

batchlog_replay_throttle_in_kb.description: The total throttle for log replay in Kpbs.

partitioner.description: The partitioner used to distribute rows across the cluster. Murmur3Partitioner is the recommended setting. RandomPartitioner and ByteOrderedPartitioner are supported for legacy applications.

key_cache_save_period.description: The duration in seconds that keys are saved in cache. Saved caches greatly improve cold-start speeds and has relatively little effect on I/O.

row_cache_size_in_mb.description: Maximum size of the row cache in memory. Row cache can save more time than key_cache_size_in_mb, but is space-intensive because it contains the entire row. Use the row cache only for hot rows or static rows. 0 disables the row cache.

row_cache_save_period.description: Duration in seconds that rows are saved in cache. 0 disables caching.

commitlog_sync_period_in_ms.description: The number of milliseconds between disk fsync calls.

commitlog_segment_size_in_mb.description: The size of each commit log segment in Mb.

concurrent_reads.description: For workloads with more data than can fit in memory, the bottleneck is reads fetching data from disk. Setting to (16 times the number of drives) allows operations to queue low enough in the stack so that the OS and drives can reorder them.

concurrent_writes.description: Writes in Cassandra are rarely I/O bound, so the ideal number of concurrent writes depends on the number of CPU cores in your system. The recommended value is 8 times the number of cpu cores.

concurrent_counter_writes.description: Counter writes read the current values before incrementing and writing them back. The recommended value is (16 times the number of drives) .

memtable_allocation_type.description: The type of allocations for the Cassandra memtable. heap_buffers keep all data on the JVM heap. offheap_buffers may reduce heap utilization for large string or binary values. offheap_objects may improve heap size for small integers or UUIDs as well. Both off heap options will increase read latency.

index_summary_resize_interval_in_minutes.description: How frequently index summaries should be re-sampled in minutes. This is done periodically to redistribute memory from the fixed-size pool to SSTables proportional their recent read rates.

start_rpc.description: If true Thrift RPC is enable. This is deprecated by may be necessary for legacy applications.

rpc_port.description: The port for Thrift RPC communication.

rpc_keepalive.description: Enables or TCP keepalive for RPC connections.

thrift_framed_transport_size_in_mb.description: Frame size (maximum field length) for Thrift.

tombstone_warn_threshold.description: The maximum number of tombstones a query can scan before warning.

tombstone_failure_threshold.description: The maximum number of tombstones a query can scan before aborting.

column_index_size_in_kb.description: The granularity of the index of rows within a partition. For huge rows, decrease this setting to improve seek time. If you use key cache, be careful not to make this setting too large because key cache will be overwhelmed.

batch_size_warn_threshold_in_kb.description: Warn the operator on a batch size exceeding this value in kilobytes. Caution should be taken on increasing the size of this threshold as it can lead to node instability.

batch_size_fail_threshold_in_kb.description: Fail batch sizes exceeding this value in kilobytes. Caution should be taken on increasing the size of this threshold as it can lead to node instability.

compaction_throughput_mb_per_sec.description: Throttles compaction to the specified total throughput across the node. Compaction frequency varies with direct proportion to write throughput and is necessary to limit the SSTable size. The recommended value is 16 to 32 times the rate of write throughput (in MB/second).

sstable_preemptive_open_interval_in_mb.description: When compacting, the replacement opens SSTables before they are completely written and uses in place of the prior SSTables for any range previously written. This setting helps to smoothly transfer reads between the SSTables by reducing page cache churn and keeps hot rows hot.

read_request_timeout_in_ms.description: The time that the coordinator waits for read operations to complete in ms.

range_request_timeout_in_ms.description: The time that the coordinator waits for range scans complete in ms.

write_request_timeout_in_ms.description: The time that the coordinator waits for write operations to complete in ms.

counter_write_request_timeout_in_ms.description: The time that the coordinator waits for counter write operations to complete in ms.

cas_contention_timeout_in_ms.description: The time for which the coordinator will retry CAS operations on the same row in ms.

truncate_request_timeout_in_ms.description: The time that the coordinator waits for truncate operations to complete in ms.

request_timeout_in_ms.description: The default timeout for all other requests in ms.

dynamic_snitch_update_interval_in_ms.description: The time, in ms, the snitch will wait before updating node scores.

dynamic_snitch_reset_interval_in_ms.description: The time, in ms, the snitch will wait before resetting node scores allowing bad nodes to recover.

dynamic_snitch_badness_threshold.description: Sets the performance threshold for dynamically routing client requests away from a poorly performing node.

internode_compression.description: Controls whether traffic between nodes is compressed. all compresses all traffic. none compresses no traffic. dc compresses between datacenters.

max_hints_file_size_in_mb.description: The maximum size of the hints file in Mb.

hints_flush_period_in_ms.description: The time, in ms, for the period in which hints are flushed to disk.

concurrent_materialized_view_writes.description: The maximum number of concurrent writes to materialized views.

commitlog_total_space_in_mb.description: The total size of the commit log in Mb.

use_dse_role_manager.description: If true the DSE Role manager is used.

transitional_mode.description: The transitional_mode option allows DSE authentication and authorization to operate in a transitional mode during setup of authorization in a cluster.

enabled.description: If true the DSE Authentication manager is used.

default_scheme.description: The default scheme for authentication. Note that internal will be enabled as an alternate.

scheme_permissions.description: If true than scheme permissions must be granted on a per role basis.

allow_digest_with_kerberos.description: If true than message digest authentication is also allowed for Kerberos auth.

plain_text_without_ssl.description: The action taken when plain text auth request are sent over an unencrypted channel.

enabled.description: If true DataStax authorization will be used.

kerberos_options.description: Kerberos configuration options. These will be ignored unless Kerberos is selected for authentication and DSE authentication is enabled.

keytab.description: The name of the keytab file pointed to by the ketab_location property in the executor configuration object.

service_principal.description: The Kerberos service principal for DSE natice connections.

http_principal.description: The Kerberos service principal for HTTP connections.

qop.description: The quality of protection for authentication. Note that auth-conf is currently not supported due to a lack of SSL support.

refresh_rate_ms.description: The refresh rate for node health estimation.

uptime_ramp_up_period_seconds.description: The amount of continuous uptime required for the node to reach the maximum uptime score.

dropped_mutation_window_minutes.description: The window in the past over which the rate of dropped mutations affects the node health score.

enabled.description: If true lease metrics are enabled.

ttl_seconds.description: The length of time the lease holder log persists.

enabled.description: If ture, audit logging is enabled

retention_time.description: The retention time for audit logs. Note, 0 indicates forever.

mode.description: The mode of the logger. sync will block request for auditing.

batch_size.description: The batch size for audit log writes. Only used in async.

flush_time.description: The flush time for audit log writes. Only used in async.

queue_size.description: The size of the queue feeding the asynchronous audit log writer threads.Only used in async.

write_consistency.description: The consistency level used to write audit events

port.description: The port for internode communication.

executor.description: The Cassandra service executor configuration object.

cpus.description: The cpu shares used by the Cassandra service executor.

mem.description: The memory used by the Cassandra service executor in Mb.

heap.description: The JVM heap used by the Cassandra service executor in Mb.

disk.description: The amount of disk used by the Cassandra service executor in Mb.

api_port.description: The port that the Cassandra executor API will accept on.

keytab_location.description: URL pointing to the location of the keytab to use if the Kerberos is enabled.

mem.description: The memory used by the Cassandra cluster tasks in Mb.

packages.postUninstallNotes: Dynatrace has been uninstalled from your Mesos agents and will no longer run.
packages.name: dynatrace
packages.description: Dynatrace is cloud-native monitoring for highly dynamic container and cluster environments. Dynatrace allows you to better optimize your container deployments and memory allocations by using real-time usage data. Dynatrace is the only solution capable of automatically pinpointing application and infrastructure issues in seconds using artificial intelligence
packages.postInstallNotes:
Dynatrace has been installed on DC/OS Mesos agents.
Log in to your Dynatrace account at https://login.dynatrace.com and monitor your DC/OS cluster. You will shorty see your cluster and container insights in Dynatrace.
packages.preInstallNotes:
Pass your environment ID (dynatrace.environment), token (dynatrace.token), and connection endpoint (dynatrace.server) as package options.
Please note the connection endpoint (dynatrace.server) of Dynatrace SaaS is https://{replace_with_your_environmentID}.live.dynatrace.com.
In case you are running Dynatrace Managed you can find the Managed endpoint in your UI.
Also pass the number of Mesos agents as an option (dynatrace.instances) and Marathon will make sure that the Dynatrace OneAgent runs on every Mesos agent.
By default Marathon will allcoate 0.1 CPU and 400m memory per Dynatrace OneAgent task.

cpus.description: CPU shares to allocate to each Dynatrace OneAgent task

instances.description: Number of nodes in your cluster

mem.description: Memory (MB) to allocate to each Dynatrace OneAgent task.

packages.postUninstallNotes:
ECR login on DCOS successfully uninstalled.
Docker auths may still persist in your .dockercfg file.
packages.name: ecr-login
packages.description: AWS ECR login utility
packages.postInstallNotes:
ECR login on DCOS successfully installed.
You can now begin pulling from this registry.
packages.preInstallNotes:
Pass the AWS account number and region as package options.
Make sure the Mesos agent's IAM role (or the provided credentials) allows logging into the ECR specified.
Marathon will make sure that the ECR login agent runs only once per slave.

registry_accounts.description: The AWS account numbers where the ECR registries are located. Space-delimited, max of 10 accounts.

registry_region.description: The AWS account region where the ECR registry is located.

refresh_interval.description: The number of seconds to pause between Docker logins. AWS requires a refresh every 12 hours, so set below. Default: 6 hours (21600 seconds)

host_directory.description: The host disk location where the Docker config will be saved. This will be mounted in the container.

dockercfg_filename.description: The Docker config path and file name within the host directory. Default: .docker/config.json

aws_access_key.description: AWS access key with permissions to log into ECR. Optional on EC2 if an IAM role is defined.

aws_secret_access_key.description: AWS secret access key with permissions to log into ECR. Optional on EC2 if an IAM role is defined.

aws_session_token.description: AWS session token with permissions to log into ECR. Optional on EC2 if an IAM role is defined or if permanent keys are used.

cpus.description: CPU shares to allocate to each Marathon instance.

instances.description: Number of Marathon instances to run.

mem.description: Memory (MB) to allocate to each Marathon task.

packages.postUninstallNotes:
ECR login on DCOS successfully uninstalled.
Docker auths may still persist in your directory.
packages.name: ecr-login
packages.description: AWS ECR login utility
packages.postInstallNotes:
ECR login on DCOS successfully installed.
You can now begin pulling from this registry by passing the docker.tar.gz file to Marathon URIs.
packages.preInstallNotes:
Pass the AWS account number and region as package options.
Make sure the Mesos agent's IAM role (or the provided AWS key and secret credentials) allows logging into the ECR specified.
Marathon will make sure that the ECR login agent runs only once per slave. The directory passed will be mounted and a .docker folder with a config.json file will be created within it. Additionally, a docker.tar.gz will be created to be passed to Marathon when needed.

registry_accounts.description: The AWS account numbers where the ECR registries are located. Space-delimited, max of 10 accounts.

registry_region.description: The AWS account region where the ECR registry is located.

refresh_interval.description: The number of seconds to pause between Docker logins. AWS requires a refresh every 12 hours, so set below. Default: 6 hours (21600 seconds)

host_directory.description: The host disk location where the Docker configs will be saved. This will be mounted in the container.

aws_access_key.description: AWS access key with permissions to log into ECR. Optional on EC2 if an IAM role is defined.

aws_secret_access_key.description: AWS secret access key with permissions to log into ECR. Optional on EC2 if an IAM role is defined.

aws_session_token.description: AWS session token with permissions to log into ECR. Optional on EC2 if an IAM role is defined or if permanent keys are used.

cpus.description: CPU shares to allocate to each Marathon instance.

instances.description: Number of Marathon instances to run.

mem.description: Memory (MB) to allocate to each Marathon task.

packages.name: elasticsearch
packages.description: DCOS implementation of the Mesos-Elasticsearch framework
packages.postInstallNotes: Elasticsearch is staging. Check Marathon and the ES management front-end for status.
packages.preInstallNotes: The ElasticSearch DCOS Service implementation is alpha and there may be bugs, incomplete features, incorrect documentation or other discrepancies.

master.description: The URL of the Mesos master. This should point to the Mesos ZNode on the Zookeeper machine.

failover-timeout.description: The time before Mesos kills a scheduler and tasks if it has not recovered (ms).

zookeeper-mesos-timeout.description: The timeout for connecting to zookeeper for Mesos (ms).

port.description: The port number of the ES-Mesos management front-end. Defaults to 8080.

force-pull-image.description: Forces docker to re-pull the image.

ram.description: The amount of ram that Mesos shall give give to the executors.

cpu.description: The amount of CPU resource to allocate to the elasticsearch instance.

disk.description: The amount of Disk resource to allocate to the elasticsearch instance (MB).

instances.description: The number of elasticsearch nodes to be instantiated. It is recommended that you provide an odd number, to prevent split brain issues.

settings-location.description: URI to ES yml settings file. If file is copied to all slaves, the file must be in /tmp/config. E.g. 'file:/tmp/config/elasticsearch.yml', 'http://webserver.com/elasticsearch.yml'

health-delay.description: The delay between executor healthcheck requests (ms).

name.description: The name given to the executor task.

timeout.description: The maximum executor healthcheck timeout (ms). Must be greater than elasticsearch.executor.healthdelay. Will start new executor after this length of time.

cpu.description: The amount of CPU that Mesos shall allocate to the scheduler.

ram.description: The amount of RAM that Mesos shall allocate to the scheduler.

java-heap.description: The java heap space environmental variables to pass to the scheduler

packages.name: etcd
packages.description: A distributed consistent key-value store for shared configuration and service discovery.
packages.postInstallNotes: Once the cluster initializes (<1 minute if offers are available), etcd proxies may connect by passing the argument -discovery-srv=etcd.mesos (or -discovery-srv=<framework-name>.mesos if you're not using the default), and you may discover live members by querying SRV records for _etcd-server._tcp.<framework-name>.mesos
packages.preInstallNotes:
In order for etcd to start successfully all resources must be available in the cluster including ports, CPU shares and RAM.
We recommend a minimum of 3 nodes with 1 CPU share and 128 MB of RAM available for use by the etcd service.
Note that the service is alpha and there may be bugs, including possible data loss, incomplete features, incorrect documentation or other discrepancies.

dns-suffix.description: This value is appended to the framework-name value to form the canonical DNS name for the etcd components.

framework-name.description: The framework name to register with Mesos.

admin-port.description: Admin port that the etcd framework listens on.

cpus.description: CPU shares to allocate to the etcd framework.

mem.description: Memory (MB) to allocate to the etcd framework.

auto-reseed.description: Enable auto reseeding of the etcd cluster.

cpu-limit.description: The CPU shares for each etcd instance.

mem-limit.description: Memory limit (MB) for each etcd instance.

disk-limit.description: Disk limit (MB) for each etcd instance.

cluster-size.description: The number of nodes in the etcd cluster.

logging-verbosity.description: Increase this value to obtain more detailed log messages.

zk.description: The URL of Zookeeper to be used to persist etcd framework data. The format is a comma-delimited list of hosts like zk://host1:port,host2:port/zk, including the trailing path.

master.description: The URL of the Mesos master. The format is a comma-delimited list of hosts like zk://host1:port,host2:port/mesos. If using ZooKeeper, pay particular attention to the leading zk:// and trailing /mesos! If not using ZooKeeper, standard host:port patterns, like localhost:5050 or 10.0.0.5:5050,10.0.0.6:5050, are also acceptable.

mem.description: Memory (MiB) to allocate to each Exhibitor instance.

volume-size.description: Size of data volume (MiB) to allocate to each Exhibitor instance.

zk_servers.description: Parent ZooKeeper URL for storing state. The framework name is joined to the path of this value. Format: zk://host1:port1,host2:port2,.../path

client-port.description: The port clients use to talk to the zookeeper cluster.

peer-port.description: The port zookeeper peers talk with eachother on.

leader-port.description: The port zookeeper peers talk to the leader on.

packages.postUninstallNotes:
The GeoServer Service has been uninstalled and will no longer run.
This does not remove the geoserver-app marathon app which should also be removed to eliminate any traces of GeoServer from your DCOS cluster.
packages.name: geoserver
packages.description: GeoServer is an open source server for sharing geospatial data. GeoServer 2.10.0 implements Open Geospatial Consortium (OGC) Web Map Service (WMS), Web Feature Service (WFS), Web Coverage Service (WCS) and Catalog Serivce for the Web (CSW). The GeoServer project can be found at http://geoserver.org/.
packages.preInstallNotes:
This DC/OS Service is currently EXPERIMENTAL. There may be bugs, incomplete features, incorrect documentation, or other discrepancies.

This package and its child packages depend on a shared file system.  It doesn't matter what form this takes (NFS, GlusterFS, etc.), but it must be consistent across all DCOS slave nodes. The default location on the nodes is */shared/geoserver* and may be overridden in the *geoserver.data-dir* configuration field.

Tutorial documentation for GeoServer configuration can be found here: https://github.com/dcos/examples/tree/master/1.8/geoserver

instances.description: Number of GeoServer instances to launch. These are the tasks that actually provide OGC service handlers.

cpus.description: Number of cores allocated per GeoServer instance

memory.description: Amount of memory in MiBs to allocate per GeoServer instance.

virtual-host.description: External address for access to the GeoServer cluster. This should be added to your DNS as an A record targeting your marathon-lb public slave.

data-dir.description: Absolute path present on all Mesos nodes for GeoServer configuration storage. This location must be shared across all Mesos nodes to ensure consistent GeoServer configuration.

data-dir-owner.description: User ID and group ID ownership of GeoServer configuration storage. Used within containers to match host ownership by way of gosu.

supplemental-data-dirs.description: Absolute path present on Mesos nodes of data for serving via GeoServer. Multiple values can be given delimited by commas.

auth-uri.description: URI to file for private Docker registry authentication

sync.description: Settings used to tune the synchronization of GeoServer slaves on configuration updates.

polling-interval.description: Interval between GeoServer configuration directory file system polls.

file-blacklist.description: Comma delimited string of file name snippets that should be ignored. Snippets are compared to file names using contains.

packages.name: gestalt-framework

packages.postInstallNotes: The Gestalt Framework is now running on your server.
packages.preInstallNotes: http://www.galacticfog.com/get-started

name.description: The name of the framework scheduler inside the base Marathon.

mesos-master.description: The address for the Mesos master.

tld.description: Top-level domain for creating marathon-lb virtual hosts for framework services.

vip.description: VIP to which gestalt-framework services are bound. Must not already be in use.

cpu-limit-framework.description: The CPU shares for the Gestalt framework.

mem-limit-framework.description: Memory limit (MB) for the Gestalt framework.

port.description: Bound port (random if blank).

role.description: Deploy gestalt-framework-scheduler only on nodes with this role.

provision.description: Provision a database server for use by the framework services. Otherwise, requires a pre-existing database server.

provisioned-size.description: When provisioning the database, size for the persistent volume in MB.

hostname.description: The hostname for the database (only if pre-existing).

port.description: The port for the database (only if pre-existing).

username.description: The username for the database (provisioned or pre-existing)

password.description: The password for the database (provisioned or pre-existing)

prefix.description: A prefix for database names for the database (only if pre-existing)

admin-username.description: The username for the bootstrapped admin account.

admin-password.description: The password for the bootstrapped admin account (leave blank for none/no-login).

api-key.description: Admin API key, required if security is already initialized.

api-secret.description: Admin API secret, required if security is already initialized.

heap-min.description: Memory (MB) start size for the JVM heap. This number should be be less or equals than the heap-max.

heap-max.description: Memory (MB) max size for the JVM heap. This number should be less than the memory allocated to the gestalt-framework instance (General rule: 50%).

The gestalt-framework launcher has been uninstalled.
If the framework services were not shutdown from the launcher, they will need to be manually removed from Marathon.

packages.name: gitlab
packages.description: Collaboration and source control management: code, test, and deploy together!
packages.postInstallNotes: GitLab has been installed.
packages.preInstallNotes: Having Marathon-lb installed and setting a virtual host in the config is required for being able to access GitLab.

name.description: The name of this DC/OS service.

cpus.description: CPU shares to allocate to GitLab.

mem.description: Memory to allocate to GitLab.

role.description: Deploy GitLab only on nodes with this role.

host-volume.description: The location of a volume on the host to be used for persisting GitLab configuration and data.

host-shared-volume.description: The location of a volume on the host to be used for persisting shared GitLab configuration and data. This directory MUST be mounted on all DC/OS agents if deploying GitLab in highly available configuration.

routing.description: GitLab routing properties for use with Marathon-lb.

https-redirect.description: Whether Marathon-lb should redirect HTTP traffic to HTTPS. This requires 'virtual-host' to be set. By default, this is false.

virtual-host.description: The virtual host address to configure for integration with Marathon-lb.

ssh-port.description: The port that ssh clients will connect to against the virtual-host.

registry-port.description: The port that docker clients will connect to against the virtual-host.

enabled.description: Whether to use external SMTP email server. By default, this is false.

port.description: Port to access the SMTP server on

username.description: If your mail server requires authentication, set the username in this setting.

password.description: If your mail server requires authentication, set the password in this setting.

authentication.description: If your mail server requires authentication, you need to specify the authentication type here. ('plain', 'login', 'cram_md5')

enable-starttls-auto.description: Detects if STARTTLS is enabled in your SMTP server and starts to use it. Defaults to true.

openssl-verify-mode.description: When using TLS, you can set how OpenSSL checks the certificate. ('none', 'peer', 'client_once', 'fail_if_no_peer_cert')

tls.description: Enables the SMTP connection to use SMTP/TLS. Default to false.

email-from-address.description: From Address used in email headers

high-availability.description: GitLab high availability properties. If enabled, single-node properties WILL NOT be used.

enabled.description: Whether to use external Postgres and Redis servers to enable a highly available deployment of GitLab. By default, this is false.

host.description: Postgres host

user.description: Postgres user

password.description: Postgres password

host.description: Redis host

single-node.description: Configuration related to running a single instance version of GitLab. If high availability is enabled, these settings will be ignored.

local-volumes.description: Local volumes configuration (only used if external persistent volumes are disabled). Local volumes are created on the machine with the hostname specified and Marathon will attempt to re-launch the task on the same machine. Note that if the machine is lost, your data may also be lost.

pinned-hostname.description: An optional DC/OS agent hostname to run this GitLab instance on (e.g. 10.0.0.1). If this is not specified then the task may relaunch on another node than the one it originally ran on.

external-volumes.description: External persistent volumes configuration. External persistent volumes are a DC/OS feature that allow your data to be migrated with your task.

enabled.description: Whether to use DC/OS external volumes to persist GitLab state. By default, this is false.

enterprise.description: Optionally check to install Enterprise Edition. (For use if you have a license file from GitLab Inc)

enterprise-edition.description: Whether to deploy the EE edition of the software. Defaults to false.

packages.name: grafana
packages.description:
Grafana is a leading open source application for visualizing large-scale measurement data. It provides a powerful and elegant way to create, share, and explore data and dashboards from your disparate metric databases, either with your team or the world. Grafana is most commonly used for Internet infrastructure and application analytics, but many use it in other domains including industrial sensors, home automation, weather, and process control. Grafana features pluggable panels and data sources allowing easy extensibility. There is currently rich support for Graphite, InfluxDB and OpenTSDB. There is also experimental support for KairosDB, and SQL is on the roadmap. Grafana has a variety of panels, including a fully featured graph panel with rich visualization options.

This package can be used alongside the DC/OS 'cadvisor' and 'influxdb' packages for a cluster-wide monitoring solution.

Installation Documentation: https://github.com/dcos/examples/tree/master/1.8/cadvisor-influxdb-grafana
packages.postInstallNotes:
Service installed.

It is recommended to access this service through the endpoint created in Marathon-LB.

Default login: `admin`/`admin`.
packages.preInstallNotes:
This DC/OS Service is currently EXPERIMENTAL. There may be bugs, incomplete features, incorrect documentation, or other discrepancies.

```Advanced Installation options notes```

networking / *external_access*: create an entry in Marathon-LB for accessing the service from outside of the cluster

networking / *external_access_port*: port to be used in Marathon-LB for accessing the service.

name.description: Name of this service instance.

cpus.description: CPU shares to allocate to each service instance.

mem.description: Memory to allocate to each service instance.

external_access.description:
Enable access from outside the cluster through Marathon-LB.
NOTE: this connection is unencrypted.

enable.description: Enable or disable creating a VIP for external access through a public node running Marathon-LB.

external_access_port.description: For external access, port number to be used for clear communication in the external Marathon-LB load balancer

virtual_host.description: For external access, Virtual Host URL to be used in the external load balancer.

In order for HDFS to start successfully, it requires a minimum of five nodes; each with at least 2 CPU shares and 8GB of RAM available for use by the HDFS Service.
