plan-strategy.description: Broker placement strategy. See documentation. [INSTALL, STAGE]

cpus.description: Broker cpu requirements

mem.description: Broker mem requirements

disk.description: Broker disk requirements (only respected with persistent volumes)

kafka_advertise_host_ip.description: Override advertised.host.name with the IP address detected in /opt/mesosphere/detect_ip

kafka_override_auto_create_topics_enable.description: Override auto.create.topics.enable: Enable auto creation of topic on the server

kafka_override_auto_leader_rebalance_ena.description: Override auto.leader.rebalance.enable: Enables auto leader balancing. A background thread checks and triggers leader balance if required at regular intervals

kafka_override_background_threads.description: Override background.threads: The number of threads to use for various background processing tasks

kafka_override_compression_type.description: Override compression.type: Specify the final compression type for a given topic. This configuration accepts the standard compression codecs ('gzip', 'snappy', lz4). It additionally accepts 'uncompressed' which is equivalent to no compression; and 'producer' which means retain the original compression codec set by the producer.

kafka_override_delete_topic_enable.description: Override delete.topic.enable: Enables delete topic. Delete topic through the admin tool will have no effect if this config is turned off

kafka_override_leader_imbalance_check_in.description: Override leader.imbalance.check.interval.seconds: The frequency with which the partition rebalance check is triggered by the controller

kafka_override_leader_imbalance_per_brok.description: Override leader.imbalance.per.broker.percentage: The ratio of leader imbalance allowed per broker. The controller would trigger a leader balance if it goes above this value per broker. The value is specified in percentage.

kafka_override_log_flush_interval_messag.description: Override log.flush.interval.messages: The number of messages accumulated on a log partition before messages are flushed to disk

kafka_override_log_flush_offset_checkpoi.description: Override log.flush.offset.checkpoint.interval.ms: The frequency with which we update the persistent record of the last flush which acts as the log recovery point

kafka_override_log_flush_scheduler_inter.description: Override log.flush.scheduler.interval.ms: The frequency in ms that the log flusher checks whether any log needs to be flushed to disk

kafka_override_log_retention_bytes.description: Override log.retention.bytes: The maximum size of the log before deleting it

kafka_override_log_retention_hours.description: Override log.retention.hours: The number of hours to keep a log file before deleting it (in hours), tertiary to log.retention.ms property

kafka_override_log_roll_hours.description: Override log.roll.hours: The maximum time before a new log segment is rolled out (in hours), secondary to log.roll.ms property

kafka_override_log_roll_jitter_hours.description: Override log.roll.jitter.hours: The maximum jitter to subtract from logRollTimeMillis (in hours), secondary to log.roll.jitter.ms property

kafka_override_log_segment_bytes.description: Override log.segment.bytes: The maximum size of a single log file

kafka_override_log_segment_delete_delay_.description: Override log.segment.delete.delay.ms: The amount of time to wait before deleting a file from the filesystem

kafka_override_message_max_bytes.description: Override message.max.bytes: The maximum size of message that the server can receive

kafka_override_min_insync_replicas.description: Override min.insync.replicas: define the minimum number of replicas in ISR needed to satisfy a produce request with required.acks=-1 (or all)

kafka_override_num_io_threads.description: Override num.io.thread: The number of io threads that the server uses for carrying out network requests

kafka_override_num_network_threads.description: Override num.network.threads: The number of network threads that the server uses for handling network requests

kafka_override_num_recovery_threads_per_.description: Override num.recovery.threads.per.data.dir: The number of threads per data directory to be used for log recovery at startup and flushing at shutdown

kafka_override_num_replica_fetchers.description: Override num.replica.fetchers: Number of fetcher threads used to replicate messages from a source broker. Increasing this value can increase the degree of I/O parallelism in the follower broker.

kafka_override_offset_metadata_max_bytes.description: Override offset.metadata.max.bytes: The maximum size for a metadata entry associated with an offset commit

kafka_override_offsets_commit_required_a.description: Override offsets.commit.required.acks: The required acks before the commit can be accepted. In general, the default (-1) should not be overridden

kafka_override_offsets_commit_timeout_ms.description: Override offsets.commit.timeout.ms: Offset commit will be delayed until all replicas for the offsets topic receive the commit or this timeout is reached. This is similar to the producer request timeout.

kafka_override_offsets_load_buffer_size.description: Override offsets.load.buffer.size: Batch size for reading from the offsets segments when loading offsets into the cache.

kafka_override_offsets_retention_check_i.description: Override offsets.retention.check.interval.ms: Frequency at which to check for stale offsets

kafka_override_offsets_retention_minutes.description: Override offsets.retention.minutes: Log retention window in minutes for offsets topic

kafka_override_offsets_topic_compression.description: Override offsets.topic.compression.codec: Compression codec for the offsets topic - compression may be used to achieve 'atomic' commits

kafka_override_offsets_topic_num_partiti.description: Override offsets.topic.num.partitions: The number of partitions for the offset commit topic (should not change after deployment).

kafka_override_offsets_topic_replication.description: Override offsets.topic.replication.factor: The replication factor for the offsets topic (set higher to ensure availability). To ensure that the effective replication factor of the offsets topic is the configured value, the number of alive brokers has to be at least the replication factor at the time of the first request for the offsets topic. If not, either the offsets topic creation will fail or it will get a replication factor of min(alive brokers, configured replication factor)

kafka_override_offsets_topic_segment_byt.description: Override offsets.topic.segment.bytes: The offsets topic segment bytes should be kept relatively small in order to facilitate faster log compaction and cache loads

kafka_override_queued_max_requests.description: Override queued.max.requests: The number of queued requests allowed before blocking the network threads

kafka_override_quota_consumer_default.description: Override quota.consumer.default: Any consumer distinguished by clientId/consumer group will get throttled if it fetches more bytes than this value per-second

kafka_override_quota_producer_default.description: Override quota.producer.default: Any producer distinguished by clientId will get throttled if it produces more bytes than this value per-second

kafka_override_replica_fetch_max_bytes.description: Override replica.fetch.max.bytes: The number of byes of messages to attempt to fetch

kafka_override_replica_fetch_min_bytes.description: Override replica.fetch.min.bytes: Minimum bytes expected for each fetch response. If not enough bytes, wait up to replicaMaxWaitTimeMs

kafka_override_replica_fetch_wait_max_ms.description: Override replica.fetch.wait.max.ms: Max wait time for each fetcher request issued by follower replicas. This value should always be less than the replica.lag.time.max.ms at all times to prevent frequent shrinking of ISR for low throughput topics

kafka_override_replica_high_watermark_ch.description: Override replica.high.watermark.checkpoint.interval.ms: The frequency with which the high watermark is saved out to disk

kafka_override_replica_lag_time_max_ms.description: Override replica.lag.time.max.ms: If a follower hasn't sent any fetch requests or hasn't consumed up to the leaders log end offset for at least this time, the leader will remove the follower from isr

kafka_override_replica_socket_receive_bu.description: Override replica.socket.receive.buffer.bytes: The socket receive buffer for network requests

kafka_override_replica_socket_timeout_ms.description: Override replica.socket.timeout.ms: The socket timeout for network requests. Its value should be at least replica.fetch.wait.max.ms

kafka_override_request_timeout_ms.description: Override request.timeout.ms: The configuration controls the maximum amount of time the client will wait for the response of a request. If the response is not received before the timeout elapses the client will resend the request if necessary or fail the request if retries are exhausted.

kafka_override_socket_receive_buffer_byt.description: Override socket.receive.buffer.bytes: The SO_RCVBUF buffer of the socket sever sockets

kafka_override_socket_request_max_bytes.description: Override socket.request.max.bytes: The maximum number of bytes in a socket request

kafka_override_socket_send_buffer_bytes.description: Override socket.send.buffer.bytes: The SO_SNDBUF buffer of the socket sever sockets

kafka_override_unclean_leader_election_e.description: Override unclean.leader.election.enable: Indicates whether to enable replicas not in the ISR set to be elected as leader as a last resort, even though doing so may result in data loss

kafka_override_connections_max_idle_ms.description: Override connections.max.idle.ms: Idle connections timeout: the server socket processor threads close the connections that idle more than this

kafka_override_controlled_shutdown_enabl.description: Override controlled.shutdown.enable: Enable controlled shutdown of the server

kafka_override_controlled_shutdown_max_r.description: Override controlled.shutdown.max.retries: Controlled shutdown can fail for multiple reasons. This determines the number of retries when such failure happens

kafka_override_controlled_shutdown_retry.description: Override controlled.shutdown.retry.backoff.ms: Before each retry, the system needs time to recover from the state that caused the previous failure (Controller fail over, replica lag etc). This config determines the amount of time to wait before retrying.

kafka_override_controller_socket_timeout.description: Override controller.socket.timeout.ms: The socket timeout for controller-to-broker channels

kafka_override_default_replication_facto.description: Override default.replication.factor: Default replication factors for automatically created topics

kafka_override_fetch_purgatory_purge_int.description: Override fetch.purgatory.purge.interval.requests: The purge interval (in number of requests) of the fetch request purgatory

kafka_override_group_max_session_timeout.description: Override group.max.session.timeout.ms: The maximum allowed session timeout for registered consumers

kafka_override_group_min_session_timeout.description: Override group.min.session.timeout.ms: The minimum allowed session timeout for registered consumers

kafka_override_inter_broker_protocol_ver.description: Override inter.broker.protocol.version: Specify which version of the inter-broker protocol will be used. This is typically bumped after all brokers were upgraded to a new version. Example of some valid values are: 0.8.0, 0.8.1, 0.8.1.1, 0.8.2, 0.8.2.0, 0.8.2.1, 0.9.0.0, 0.9.0.1 Check ApiVersion for the full list.

kafka_override_log_cleaner_backoff_ms.description: Override log.cleaner.backoff.ms: The amount of time to sleep when there are no logs to clean

kafka_override_log_cleaner_dedupe_buffer.description: Override log.cleaner.dedupe.buffer.size: The total memory used for log deduplication across all cleaner threads

kafka_override_log_cleaner_delete_retent.description: Override log.cleaner.delete.retention.ms: How long are delete records retained?

kafka_override_log_cleaner_enable.description: Override log.cleaner.enable: Enable the log cleaner process to run on the server? Should be enabled if using any topics with a cleanup.policy=compact including the internal offsets topic. If disabled those topics will not be compacted and continually grow in size.

kafka_override_log_cleaner_io_buffer_loa.description: Override log.cleaner.io.buffer.load.factor: Log cleaner dedupe buffer load factor. The percentage full the dedupe buffer can become. A higher value will allow more log to be cleaned at once but will lead to more hash collisions

kafka_override_log_cleaner_io_buffer_siz.description: Override log.cleaner.io.buffer.size: The total memory used for log cleaner I/O buffers across all cleaner threads

kafka_override_log_cleaner_io_max_bytes_.description: Override log.cleaner.io.max.bytes.per.second: The log cleaner will be throttled so that the sum of its read and write i/o will be less than this value on average

kafka_override_log_cleaner_min_cleanable.description: Override log.cleaner.min.cleanable.ratio: The minimum ratio of dirty log to total log for a log to eligible for cleaning

kafka_override_log_cleaner_threads.description: Override log.cleaner.threads: The number of background threads to use for log cleaning

kafka_override_log_cleanup_policy.description: Override log.cleanup.policy: The default cleanup policy for segments beyond the retention window, must be either 'delete' or 'compact'

kafka_override_log_index_interval_bytes.description: Override log.index.interval.bytes: The interval with which we add an entry to the offset index

kafka_override_log_index_size_max_bytes.description: Override log.index.size.max.bytes: The maximum size in bytes of the offset index

kafka_override_log_preallocate.description: Override log.preallocate: Should pre allocate file when create new segment? If you are using Kafka on Windows, you probably need to set it to true.

kafka_override_log_retention_check_inter.description: Override log.retention.check.interval.ms: The frequency in milliseconds that the log cleaner checks whether any log is eligible for deletion

kafka_override_max_connections_per_ip.description: Override max.connections.per.ip: mum number of connections we allow from each ip address

kafka_override_max_connections_per_ip_ov.description: Override max.connections.per.ip.overrides: Per-ip or hostname overrides to the default maximum number of connections

kafka_override_num_partitions.description: Override num.partitions: The default number of log partitions per topic

kafka_override_producer_purgatory_purge_.description: Override producer.purgatory.purge.interval.requests: The purge interval (in number of requests) of the producer request purgatory

kafka_override_replica_fetch_backoff_ms.description: Override replica.fetch.backoff.ms: The amount of time to sleep when fetch partition error occurs.

kafka_override_reserved_broker_max_id.description: Override reserved.broker.max.id: Max number that can be used for a broker.id

kafka_override_metrics_num_samples.description: Override metrics.num.samples: The number of samples maintained to compute metrics.

kafka_override_metrics_sample_window_ms.description: Override metrics.sample.window.ms: The number of samples maintained to compute metrics.

kafka_override_quota_window_num.description: Override quota.window.num: The number of samples to retain in memory

kafka_override_quota_window_size_seconds.description: Override quota.window.size.seconds: The time span of each sample

kafka_override_zookeeper_sync_time_ms.description: Override zookeeper.sync.time.ms: How far a ZK follower can be behind a ZK leader

packages.postUninstallNotes:
DC/OS Kafka Service has been uninstalled.
Please follow the instructions at https://docs.mesosphere.com/usage/services/kafka/#uninstall to remove any persistent state if required.

	Issues: https://docs.mesosphere.com/support/

log_index_interval_bytes.description: The interval with which we add an entry to the offset index

log_index_size_max_bytes.title: log.index.size.max.bytes
log_index_size_max_bytes.description: The maximum size in bytes of the offset index

log_preallocate.title: log.preallocate
log_preallocate.description: Should pre allocate file when create new segment? If you are using Kafka on Windows, you probably need to set it to true.

log_retention_check_interval_ms.title: log.retention.check.interval.ms
log_retention_check_interval_ms.description: The frequency in milliseconds that the log cleaner checks whether any log is eligible for deletion

max_connections_per_ip.title: max.connections.per.ip
max_connections_per_ip.description: mum number of connections we allow from each ip address

max_connections_per_ip_overrides.title: max.connections.per.ip.overrides
max_connections_per_ip_overrides.description: Per-ip or hostname overrides to the default maximum number of connections

num_partitions.title: num.partitions
num_partitions.description: The default number of log partitions per topic

producer_purgatory_purge_interval_reques.title: producer.purgatory.purge.interval.requests
producer_purgatory_purge_interval_reques.description: The purge interval (in number of requests) of the producer request purgatory

replica_fetch_backoff_ms.title: replica.fetch.backoff.ms
replica_fetch_backoff_ms.description: The amount of time to sleep when fetch partition error occurs.

reserved_broker_max_id.title: reserved.broker.max.id
reserved_broker_max_id.description: Max number that can be used for a broker.id

metrics_num_samples.title: metrics.num.samples
metrics_num_samples.description: The number of samples maintained to compute metrics.

metrics_sample_window_ms.title: metrics.sample.window.ms
metrics_sample_window_ms.description: The number of samples maintained to compute metrics.

quota_window_num.title: quota.window.num
quota_window_num.description: The number of samples to retain in memory

quota_window_size_seconds.title: quota.window.size.seconds
quota_window_size_seconds.description: The time span of each sample

zookeeper_sync_time_ms.title: zookeeper.sync.time.ms
zookeeper_sync_time_ms.description: How far a ZK follower can be behind a ZK leader

DC/OS Kafka Service has been uninstalled.

packages.name: kafka
packages.description: Apache Kafka running on DC/OS
packages.postInstallNotes:
DC/OS Kafka Service is being installed.

	Documentation: https://docs.mesosphere.com/usage/services/kafka/
	Issues: https://docs.mesosphere.com/support/

name.description: The name of the Kafka service instance

placement_strategy.description: Broker placement strategy. See documentation. [ANY, NODE]

phase_strategy.description: Broker rollout strategy. See documentation. [INSTALL, STAGE]

cpus.description: Broker cpu requirements

mem.description: Broker mem requirements

disk.description: Broker disk requirements (only respected with persistent volumes)

kafka_advertise_host_ip.description: Automatically configure advertised.host.name with the IP address detected by /opt/mesosphere/detect_ip

auto_create_topics_enable.title: auto.create.topics.enable
auto_create_topics_enable.description: Enables auto creation of topic on the server

auto_leader_rebalance_enable.title: auto.leader.rebalance.enable
auto_leader_rebalance_enable.description: Enables auto leader balancing. A background thread checks and triggers leader balance if required at regular intervals

background_threads.title: background.threads
background_threads.description: The number of threads to use for various background processing tasks

compression_type.title: compression.type
compression_type.description: Specify the final compression type for a given topic. This configuration accepts the standard compression codecs ('gzip', 'snappy', lz4). It additionally accepts 'uncompressed' which is equivalent to no compression; and 'producer' which means retain the original compression codec set by the producer.

delete_topic_enable.title: delete.topic.enable
delete_topic_enable.description: Enables delete topic. Delete topic through the admin tool will have no effect if this config is turned off

leader_imbalance_check_interval_seconds.title: leader.imbalance.check.interval.seconds
leader_imbalance_check_interval_seconds.description: The frequency with which the partition rebalance check is triggered by the controller

leader_imbalance_per_broker_percentage.title: leader.imbalance.per.broker.percentage
leader_imbalance_per_broker_percentage.description: The ratio of leader imbalance allowed per broker. The controller would trigger a leader balance if it goes above this value per broker. The value is specified in percentage.

log_flush_interval_messages.title: log.flush.interval.messages
log_flush_interval_messages.description: The number of messages accumulated on a log partition before messages are flushed to disk

log_flush_offset_checkpoint_interval_ms.title: log.flush.offset.checkpoint.interval.ms
log_flush_offset_checkpoint_interval_ms.description: The frequency with which we update the persistent record of the last flush which acts as the log recovery point

log_flush_scheduler_interval_ms.title: log.flush.scheduler.interval.ms
log_flush_scheduler_interval_ms.description: The frequency in ms that the log flusher checks whether any log needs to be flushed to disk

log_retention_bytes.title: log.retention.bytes
log_retention_bytes.description: The maximum size of the log before deleting it

log_retention_hours.title: log.retention.hours
log_retention_hours.description: The number of hours to keep a log file before deleting it (in hours), tertiary to log.retention.ms property

log_roll_hours.title: log.roll.hours
log_roll_hours.description: The maximum time before a new log segment is rolled out (in hours), secondary to log.roll.ms property

log_roll_jitter_hours.title: log.roll.jitter.hours
log_roll_jitter_hours.description: The maximum jitter to subtract from logRollTimeMillis (in hours), secondary to log.roll.jitter.ms property

log_segment_bytes.title: log.segment.bytes
log_segment_bytes.description: The maximum size of a single log file

log_segment_delete_delay_ms.title: log.segment.delete.delay.ms
log_segment_delete_delay_ms.description: The amount of time to wait before deleting a file from the filesystem

message_max_bytes.title: message.max.bytes
message_max_bytes.description: The maximum size of message that the server can receive

min_insync_replicas.title: min.insync.replicas
min_insync_replicas.description: define the minimum number of replicas in ISR needed to satisfy a produce request with required.acks=-1 (or all)

num_io_threads.title: num.io.thread
num_io_threads.description: The number of io threads that the server uses for carrying out network requests

num_network_threads.title: num.network.threads
num_network_threads.description: The number of network threads that the server uses for handling network requests

num_recovery_threads_per_data_dir.title: num.recovery.threads.per.data.dir
num_recovery_threads_per_data_dir.description: The number of threads per data directory to be used for log recovery at startup and flushing at shutdown

num_replica_fetchers.title: num.replica.fetchers
num_replica_fetchers.description: Number of fetcher threads used to replicate messages from a source broker. Increasing this value can increase the degree of I/O parallelism in the follower broker.

offset_metadata_max_bytes.title: offset.metadata.max.bytes
offset_metadata_max_bytes.description: The maximum size for a metadata entry associated with an offset commit

offsets_commit_required_acks.title: offsets.commit.required.acks
offsets_commit_required_acks.description: The required acks before the commit can be accepted. In general, the default (-1) should not be overridden

offsets_commit_timeout_ms.title: offsets.commit.timeout.ms
offsets_commit_timeout_ms.description: Offset commit will be delayed until all replicas for the offsets topic receive the commit or this timeout is reached. This is similar to the producer request timeout.

offsets_load_buffer_size.title: offsets.load.buffer.size
offsets_load_buffer_size.description: Batch size for reading from the offsets segments when loading offsets into the cache.

offsets_retention_check_interval_ms.title: offsets.retention.check.interval.ms
offsets_retention_check_interval_ms.description: Frequency at which to check for stale offsets

offsets_retention_minutes.title: offsets.retention.minutes
offsets_retention_minutes.description: Log retention window in minutes for offsets topic

offsets_topic_compression_codec.title: offsets.topic.compression.codec
offsets_topic_compression_codec.description: Compression codec for the offsets topic - compression may be used to achieve 'atomic' commits

offsets_topic_num_partitions.title: offsets.topic.num.partitions
offsets_topic_num_partitions.description: The number of partitions for the offset commit topic (should not change after deployment).

offsets_topic_replication_factor.title: offsets.topic.replication.factor
offsets_topic_replication_factor.description: The replication factor for the offsets topic (set higher to ensure availability). To ensure that the effective replication factor of the offsets topic is the configured value, the number of alive brokers has to be at least the replication factor at the time of the first request for the offsets topic. If not, either the offsets topic creation will fail or it will get a replication factor of min(alive brokers, configured replication factor)

offsets_topic_segment_bytes.title: offsets.topic.segment.bytes
offsets_topic_segment_bytes.description: The offsets topic segment bytes should be kept relatively small in order to facilitate faster log compaction and cache loads

queued_max_requests.title: queued.max.requests
queued_max_requests.description: The number of queued requests allowed before blocking the network threads

quota_consumer_default.title: quota.consumer.default
quota_consumer_default.description: Any consumer distinguished by clientId/consumer group will get throttled if it fetches more bytes than this value per-second

quota_producer_default.title: quota.producer.default
quota_producer_default.description: Any producer distinguished by clientId will get throttled if it produces more bytes than this value per-second

replica_fetch_max_bytes.title: replica.fetch.max.bytes
replica_fetch_max_bytes.description: The number of byes of messages to attempt to fetch

replica_fetch_min_bytes.title: replica.fetch.min.bytes
replica_fetch_min_bytes.description: Minimum bytes expected for each fetch response. If not enough bytes, wait up to replicaMaxWaitTimeMs

replica_fetch_wait_max_ms.title: replica.fetch.wait.max.ms
replica_fetch_wait_max_ms.description: Max wait time for each fetcher request issued by follower replicas. This value should always be less than the replica.lag.time.max.ms at all times to prevent frequent shrinking of ISR for low throughput topics

replica_high_watermark_checkpoint_interv.title: replica.high.watermark.checkpoint.interval.ms
replica_high_watermark_checkpoint_interv.description: The frequency with which the high watermark is saved out to disk

replica_lag_time_max_ms.title: replica.lag.time.max.ms
replica_lag_time_max_ms.description: If a follower hasn't sent any fetch requests or hasn't consumed up to the leaders log end offset for at least this time, the leader will remove the follower from isr

replica_socket_receive_buffer_bytes.title: replica.socket.receive.buffer.bytes
replica_socket_receive_buffer_bytes.description: The socket receive buffer for network requests

replica_socket_timeout_ms.title: replica.socket.timeout.ms
replica_socket_timeout_ms.description: The socket timeout for network requests. Its value should be at least replica.fetch.wait.max.ms

request_timeout_ms.title: request.timeout.ms
request_timeout_ms.description: The configuration controls the maximum amount of time the client will wait for the response of a request. If the response is not received before the timeout elapses the client will resend the request if necessary or fail the request if retries are exhausted.

socket_receive_buffer_bytes.title: socket.receive.buffer.bytes
socket_receive_buffer_bytes.description: The SO_RCVBUF buffer of the socket sever sockets

socket_request_max_bytes.title: socket.request.max.bytes
socket_request_max_bytes.description: The maximum number of bytes in a socket request

socket_send_buffer_bytes.title: socket.send.buffer.bytes
socket_send_buffer_bytes.description: The SO_SNDBUF buffer of the socket sever sockets

unclean_leader_election_enable.title: unclean.leader.election.enable
unclean_leader_election_enable.description: Indicates whether to enable replicas not in the ISR set to be elected as leader as a last resort, even though doing so may result in data loss

connections_max_idle_ms.title: connections.max.idle.ms
connections_max_idle_ms.description: Idle connections timeout: the server socket processor threads close the connections that idle more than this

controlled_shutdown_enable.title: controlled.shutdown.enable
controlled_shutdown_enable.description: Enable controlled shutdown of the server

controlled_shutdown_max_retries.title: controlled.shutdown.max.retries
controlled_shutdown_max_retries.description: Controlled shutdown can fail for multiple reasons. This determines the number of retries when such failure happens

controlled_shutdown_retry_backoff_ms.title: controlled.shutdown.retry.backoff.ms
controlled_shutdown_retry_backoff_ms.description: Before each retry, the system needs time to recover from the state that caused the previous failure (Controller fail over, replica lag etc). This config determines the amount of time to wait before retrying.

controller_socket_timeout_ms.title: controller.socket.timeout.ms
controller_socket_timeout_ms.description: The socket timeout for controller-to-broker channels

default_replication_factor.title: default.replication.factor
default_replication_factor.description: Default replication factors for automatically created topics

fetch_purgatory_purge_interval_requests.title: fetch.purgatory.purge.interval.requests
fetch_purgatory_purge_interval_requests.description: The purge interval (in number of requests) of the fetch request purgatory

group_max_session_timeout_ms.title: group.max.session.timeout.ms
group_max_session_timeout_ms.description: The maximum allowed session timeout for registered consumers

group_min_session_timeout_ms.title: group.min.session.timeout.ms
group_min_session_timeout_ms.description: The minimum allowed session timeout for registered consumers

inter_broker_protocol_version.title: inter.broker.protocol.version
inter_broker_protocol_version.description: Specify which version of the inter-broker protocol will be used. This is typically bumped after all brokers were upgraded to a new version. Example of some valid values are: 0.8.0, 0.8.1, 0.8.1.1, 0.8.2, 0.8.2.0, 0.8.2.1, 0.9.0.0, 0.9.0.1 Check ApiVersion for the full list.

log_cleaner_backoff_ms.title: log.cleaner.backoff.ms
log_cleaner_backoff_ms.description: The amount of time to sleep when there are no logs to clean

log_cleaner_dedupe_buffer_size.title: log.cleaner.dedupe.buffer.size
log_cleaner_dedupe_buffer_size.description: The total memory used for log deduplication across all cleaner threads

log_cleaner_delete_retention_ms.title: log.cleaner.delete.retention.ms
log_cleaner_delete_retention_ms.description: How long are delete records retained?

log_cleaner_enable.title: log.cleaner.enable
log_cleaner_enable.description: Enable the log cleaner process to run on the server? Should be enabled if using any topics with a cleanup.policy=compact including the internal offsets topic. If disabled those topics will not be compacted and continually grow in size.

log_cleaner_io_buffer_load_factor.title: log.cleaner.io.buffer.load.factor
log_cleaner_io_buffer_load_factor.description: Log cleaner dedupe buffer load factor. The percentage full the dedupe buffer can become. A higher value will allow more log to be cleaned at once but will lead to more hash collisions

log_cleaner_io_buffer_size.title: log.cleaner.io.buffer.size
log_cleaner_io_buffer_size.description: The total memory used for log cleaner I/O buffers across all cleaner threads

log_cleaner_io_max_bytes_per_second.title: log.cleaner.io.max.bytes.per.second
log_cleaner_io_max_bytes_per_second.description: The log cleaner will be throttled so that the sum of its read and write i/o will be less than this value on average

log_cleaner_min_cleanable_ratio.title: log.cleaner.min.cleanable.ratio
log_cleaner_min_cleanable_ratio.description: The minimum ratio of dirty log to total log for a log to eligible for cleaning

log_cleaner_threads.title: log.cleaner.threads
log_cleaner_threads.description: The number of background threads to use for log cleaning

log_cleanup_policy.title: log.cleanup.policy
log_cleanup_policy.description: The default cleanup policy for segments beyond the retention window, must be either 'delete' or 'compact'

log_index_interval_bytes.title: log.index.interval.bytes
log_index_interval_bytes.description: The interval with which we add an entry to the offset index

log_index_size_max_bytes.title: log.index.size.max.bytes
log_index_size_max_bytes.description: The maximum size in bytes of the offset index

log_preallocate.title: log.preallocate
log_preallocate.description: Should pre allocate file when create new segment? If you are using Kafka on Windows, you probably need to set it to true.

log_retention_check_interval_ms.title: log.retention.check.interval.ms
log_retention_check_interval_ms.description: The frequency in milliseconds that the log cleaner checks whether any log is eligible for deletion

max_connections_per_ip.title: max.connections.per.ip
max_connections_per_ip.description: mum number of connections we allow from each ip address

max_connections_per_ip_overrides.title: max.connections.per.ip.overrides
max_connections_per_ip_overrides.description: Per-ip or hostname overrides to the default maximum number of connections

num_partitions.title: num.partitions
num_partitions.description: The default number of log partitions per topic

producer_purgatory_purge_interval_reques.title: producer.purgatory.purge.interval.requests
producer_purgatory_purge_interval_reques.description: The purge interval (in number of requests) of the producer request purgatory

replica_fetch_backoff_ms.title: replica.fetch.backoff.ms
replica_fetch_backoff_ms.description: The amount of time to sleep when fetch partition error occurs.

reserved_broker_max_id.title: reserved.broker.max.id
reserved_broker_max_id.description: Max number that can be used for a broker.id

metrics_num_samples.title: metrics.num.samples
metrics_num_samples.description: The number of samples maintained to compute metrics.

metrics_sample_window_ms.title: metrics.sample.window.ms
metrics_sample_window_ms.description: The number of samples maintained to compute metrics.

quota_window_num.title: quota.window.num
quota_window_num.description: The number of samples to retain in memory

quota_window_size_seconds.title: quota.window.size.seconds
quota_window_size_seconds.description: The time span of each sample

zookeeper_sync_time_ms.title: zookeeper.sync.time.ms
zookeeper_sync_time_ms.description: How far a ZK follower can be behind a ZK leader

packages.postInstallNotes: kafka-manager has been installed. Persistent data are stored in the zookeeper cluster you defined under /${service.name} znode.
packages.preInstallNotes: You need a live kafka cluster (Kafka or Confluent).

name.description: The name of the kafka-manager service instance.

cpus.description: CPU shares to allocate

mem.description: Memory to allocate

zk.description: Zookeeper URL for Kafka-manager

application_secret.description: The application secret key is used to secure cryptographics functions

packages.name: kibana
packages.description: DCOS implementation of the Kibana, running on the Elasticsearch framework.
packages.postInstallNotes: Kibana is staging. Check the DC/OS UI for status.
packages.preInstallNotes: Kibana on DC/OS is in alpha and there may be bugs, incomplete features, incorrect documentation or other discrepancies.

cpu.description: The amount of CPU resources to allocate to each Kibana instance.

mem.description: The amount of CPU resources to allocate to each Kibana instance.

force-pull-image.description: Forces docker to re-pull the image.

port.description: Port to listen on.

packages.postUninstallNotes: Thank you for using Koding. In order to persist data between restarts, Koding kept data locally on the node in which it was installed. If you reinstall Koding on this node, you will still see this data. To delete this data, remove the /tmp/koding directory on the node.
packages.name: koding
packages.description: Koding is a web based collaborative software development tool. We bring code development off of localhost and into the cloud. Installation documentation: https://github.com/dcos/examples/tree/master/1.8/koding
packages.postInstallNotes: Happy Koding!
packages.preInstallNotes: This DC/OS Service is currently EXPERIMENTAL. There may be bugs, incomplete features, incorrect documentation, or other discrepancies. Koding is a web based collaborative software development tool. We bring code development off of localhost and into your cloud environment. This package will install a single instance of Koding into your Mesosphere DCOS environment. Please note that Koding runs best with 8GB of RAM. Marathon-lb is also required for Koding to function properly. Please install Marathon-lb before installing Koding.

name.description: Name of this service instance.

cpus.description: CPU shares to allocate to the Koding instance.

mem.description: Memory to allocate to the Koding instance.

node.description: Which node to install Koding on

hostname.description: The DNS name you intend to host your Koding instance at

virtual-host.description: The virtual host address to configure for integration with Marathon-lb.

https-redirect.description: Whether Marathon-lb should redirect HTTP traffic to HTTPS. This requires 'virtual-host' to be set. By default, this is false.

packages.name: marathon
packages.description: A cluster-wide init and control system for services in cgroups or Docker containers.
packages.postInstallNotes:
Marathon DCOS Service has been successfully installed!

	Documentation: https://mesosphere.github.io/marathon
	Issues: https://github.com/mesosphere/marathon/issues
packages.preInstallNotes: We recommend a minimum of one node with at least 2 CPU's and 1GB of RAM available for the Marathon Service.

access-control-allow-origin.description: The origin(s) to allow in Marathon. Not set by default. Example values are "'*'", or "http://localhost:8888,http://domain.com"

artifact-store.description: URL to the artifact store. Examples: "hdfs://localhost:54310/path/to/store", "file:///var/log/store". For details, see the artifact store docs: https://mesosphere.github.io/marathon/docs/artifact-store.html.

checkpoint.description: Enable checkpointing of tasks. Requires checkpointing enabled on slaves. Allows tasks to continue running during mesos-slave restarts and Marathon scheduler failover.

decline-offer-duration.description: The duration (milliseconds) for which to decline offers by default

cpus.description: CPU shares to allocate to each Marathon instance.

default-accepted-resource-roles.description: Default for the defaultAcceptedResourceRoles attribute of all app definitions as a comma-separated list of strings. This defaults to all roles for which this Marathon instance is configured to receive offers.

disable-http.description: Disable listening for HTTP requests completely. HTTPS is unaffected.

disable_metrics.description: Disable metric measurement of service method calls

enable-https.description: Enables the HTTPS protocol. Use in conjunction with ssl-keystore-path and ssl-keystore-password.

enable-tracing.description: Enable trace logging of service method calls

env-vars-prefix.description: Prefix to use for environment variables

event-stream-max-outstanding-messages.description: The event stream buffers events, that are not already consumed by clients. This number defines the number of events that get buffered on the server side, before messages are dropped.

event-subscriber.description: Event subscriber module to enable. Currently the only valid value is "http_callback".

executor.description: Executor to use when none is specified.

failover-timeout.description: The failover_timeout for Mesos in seconds. If a new Marathon instance has not re-registered with Mesos this long after a failover, Mesos will shut down all running tasks started by Marathon. Requires checkpointing to be enabled.

framework-name.description: The framework name to register with Mesos.

ha.description: Runs Marathon in high-availability mode with leader election. Allows starting an arbitrary number of other Marathons but all need to be started in HA mode. This mode requires a running ZooKeeper.

http-credentials.description: Credentials for accessing the HTTP service in the format of username:password. The username may not contain a colon (:).

http-endpoints.description: Pre-configured http callback URLs. Valid only in conjunction with --event_subscriber http_callback. Additional callback URLs may also be set dynamically via the REST API.

http-max-concurrent-requests.description: The number of concurrent http requests, that are allowed before rejecting.

http-port.description: The port on which to listen for HTTP requests.

https-port.description: The port on which to listen for HTTPS requests.

instances.description: Number of Marathon instances to run.

jvm-heap-min.description: Memory (MB) start size for the JVM heap. This number should be be less or equals than the jvm-heap-max.

jvm-heap-max.description: Memory (MB) max size for the JVM heap. This number should be be less than the absolute memory.

leader-proxy-connection-timeout.description: Maximum time, in milliseconds, to wait for connecting to the current Marathon leader from another Marathon instance.

leader-proxy-read-timeout.description: Maximum time, in milliseconds, for reading from the current Marathon leader.

local-port-max.description: Maximum port number to use when assigning service ports to apps.

local-port-min.description: Minimum port number to use when assigning service ports to apps.

marathon-store-timeout.description: Maximum time in milliseconds, to wait for persistent storage operations to complete.

max-apps.description: The maximum number of applications that may be created.

max-tasks-per-offer.description: Maximally launch this number of tasks per offer.

max-tasks-per-offer-cycle.description: Maximally launch this number of tasks per offer cycle.

mem.description: Memory (MB) to allocate to each Marathon task.

mesos-authentication-principal.description: The Mesos principal used for authentication.

mesos-authentication-secret-file.description: The path to the Mesos secret file containing the authentication secret.

mesos-leader-ui-url.description: The host and port (e.g. http://mesos_host:5050) of the Mesos master.

min-revive-offers-interval.description: Do not ask for all offers (also already seen ones) more often than this interval (ms).

reconciliation-initial-delay.description: The delay, in milliseconds, before Marathon begins to periodically perform task reconciliation operations.

reconciliation-interval.description: The period, in milliseconds, between task reconciliation operations.

revive-offers-for-new-apps.description: Whether to call reviveOffers for new or changed apps.

scale-apps-initial-delay.description: This is the length of time, in milliseconds, before Marathon begins to periodically attempt to scale apps

scale-apps-interval.description: This is the length of time, in milliseconds, between task scale apps.

ssl-keystore-password.description: Password for the keystore supplied with the marathon/ssl-keystore-path option.

ssl-keystore-path.description: Path to the SSL keystore. SSL will be enabled if this option is supplied. The keystore can be downloaded into Marathon's working directory by using the uris property.

uris.description: List of URIs that will be download and made available in the current working directory of Marathon. For example this can be used to download a Java keystore file for SSL configuration.

zk.description: Parent ZooKeeper URL for storing state. The framework name is joined to the path of this value. Format: zk://host1:port1,host2:port2,.../path

zk-compression.description: Enable compression of zk nodes, if the size of the node is bigger than the configured threshold.

zk-compression-threshold.description: Threshold in bytes, when compression is applied to the zk node (Default: 64 KB).

zk-max-versions.description: Limit the number of versions stored for one entity.

zk-session-timeout.description: The timeout for zookeeper sessions in milliseconds.

master.description: The URL of the Mesos master. The format is a comma-delimited list of hosts like zk://host1:port,host2:port/mesos. If using ZooKeeper, pay particular attention to the leading zk:// and trailing /mesos! If not using ZooKeeper, standard host:port patterns, like localhost:5050 or 10.0.0.5:5050,10.0.0.6:5050, are also acceptable.

packages.postUninstallNotes:
The Marathon DCOS Service has been uninstalled and will no longer run.
Please follow the instructions at http://docs.mesosphere.com/services/marathon/#uninstall to clean up any persisted state
packages.name: marathon
packages.description: A container orchestration platform for Mesos and DCOS.
packages.postInstallNotes:
Marathon DCOS Service has been successfully installed!

	Documentation: https://mesosphere.github.io/marathon
	Issues: https://github.com/mesosphere/marathon/issues
packages.preInstallNotes: We recommend a minimum of one node with at least 2 CPU shares and 1GB of RAM available for the Marathon DCOS Service.

name.description: The ID of this Marathon service inside DCOS base Marathon.

cpus.description: CPU shares to allocate to each Marathon instance.

mem.description: Memory (MB) to allocate to each Marathon instance.

instances.description: Number of Marathon instances to run.

uris.description: List of URIs that will be downloaded and made available in the current working directory of Marathon. For example this can be used to download a Java keystore file for SSL configuration.

heap-min.description: Memory (MB) start size for the JVM heap. This number should be be less or equals than the heap-max.

heap-max.description: Memory (MB) max size for the JVM heap. This number should be less than the memory allocated to the Marathon instance (General rule: 50%).

marathon.description: Marathon command line flags. These are the same flags that are passed through to Marathon when launching manually from the command line. See details here: https://mesosphere.github.io/marathon/docs/command-line-flags.html

access-control-allow-origin.description: The origin(s) to allow in Marathon. Not set by default. Example values are "*", or "http://localhost:8888, http://domain.com"

artifact-store.description: URL to the artifact store. Supported store types hdfs, file. Example: hdfs://localhost:54310/path/to/store, file:///var/log/store

assets-path.description: Set a local file system path to load assets from, instead of loading them from the packaged jar.

checkpoint.description: Enabled: (Default) Enable checkpointing of tasks. Requires checkpointing enabled on slaves. Allows tasks to continue running during mesos-slave restarts and upgrades Disabled: Disable checkpointing of tasks.

decline-offer-duration.description: (Default: 120 seconds) The duration (milliseconds) for which to decline offers by default

default-accepted-resource-roles.description: Default for the defaultAcceptedResourceRoles attribute of all app definitions as a comma-separated list of strings. This defaults to all roles for which this Marathon instance is configured to receive offers.

disable-http.description: Disable listening for HTTP requests completely. HTTPS is unaffected.

env-vars-prefix.description: Prefix to use for environment variables injected automatically into all started tasks.

event-stream-max-outstanding-messages.description: The event stream buffers events, that are not already consumed by clients. This number defines the number of events that get buffered on the server side, before messages are dropped.

event-subscriber.description: The event subscription module to use. E.g. http_callback.

executor.description: Executor to use when none is specified. If not defined the Mesos command executor is used by default.

failover-timeout.description: (Default: 1 week) The failover_timeout for mesos in seconds.

framework-name.description: (Default: service.name) Framework name to register with Mesos.

ha.description: Enabled: (Default) Run Marathon in HA mode with leader election. Allows starting an arbitrary number of other Marathons but all need to be started in HA mode. This mode requires a running ZooKeeper Disabled: Run Marathon in single node mode.

hostname.description: The advertised hostname that is used for the communication with the Mesos master. The value is also stored in the persistent store so another standby host can redirect to the elected leader.

http-address.description: The address to listen on for HTTP requests

http-credentials.description: Credentials for accessing the http service. If empty, anyone can access the HTTP endpoint. A username:password pair is expected where the username must not contain ':'. May also be specified with the `MESOSPHERE_HTTP_CREDENTIALS` environment variable.

http-endpoints.description: The URLs of the event endpoints added to the current list of subscribers on startup. You can manage this list during runtime by using the /v2/eventSubscriptions API endpoint.

http-event-callback-slow-consumer-timeou.description: A http event callback consumer is considered slow, if the delivery takes longer than this timeout (ms)

http-max-concurrent-requests.description: The number of concurrent HTTP requests that are allowed before rejecting.

http-port.description: The port to listen on for HTTP requests

http-realm.description: The security realm (aka 'area') associated with the credentials

https-address.description: The address to listen on for HTTPS requests.

https-port.description: The port to listen on for HTTPS requests

launch-token-refresh-interval.description: The interval (ms) in which to refresh the launch tokens to --launch_token_count

leader-proxy-connection-timeout.description: Maximum time, in milliseconds, to wait for connecting to the current Marathon leader from another Marathon instance.

leader-proxy-read-timeout.description: Maximum time, in milliseconds, for reading from the current Marathon leader.

local-port-max.description: Max port number to use when assigning globally unique service ports to apps.

local-port-min.description: Min port number to use when assigning globally unique service ports to apps.

logging-level.description: Set logging level to one of: off, error, warn, info, debug, trace, all

marathon-store-timeout.description: (deprecated) Maximum time, in milliseconds, to wait for persistent storage operations to complete. This option is no longer used and will be removed in a later release.

master.description: The URL of the Mesos master

max-apps.description: The maximum number of applications that may be created.

max-tasks-per-offer.description: Maximum tasks per offer. Do not start more than this number of tasks on a single offer.

mesos-leader-ui-url.description: The host and port (e.g. "http://mesos_host:5050") of the Mesos master.

mesos-role.description: (Default: service.name) Mesos role for this framework. If set, Marathon receives resource offers for the specified role in addition to resources with the role designation '*'.

metrics.description: Enabled: (Default) Enable metric measurement of service method calls. Disabled: Disable metric measurement of service method calls.

min-revive-offers-interval.description: Do not ask for all offers (also already seen ones) more often than this interval (ms).

offer-matching-timeout.description: Offer matching timeout (ms). Stop trying to match additional tasks for this offer after this time.

on-elected-prepare-timeout.description: The timeout for preparing the Marathon instance when elected as leader.

plugin-dir.description: Path to a local directory containing plugin jars.

reconciliation-initial-delay.description: This is the length of time, in milliseconds, before Marathon begins to periodically perform task reconciliation operations

reconciliation-interval.description: This is the length of time, in milliseconds, between task reconciliation operations.

revive-offers-repetitions.description: Repeat every reviveOffer request this many times, delayed by the --min_revive_offers_interval.

save-tasks-to-launch-timeout.description: Timeout (ms) after matching an offer for saving all matched tasks that we are about to launch. When reaching the timeout, only the tasks that we could save within the timeout are also launched. All other task launches are temporarily rejected and retried later.

scale-apps-initial-delay.description: This is the length of time, in milliseconds, before Marathon begins to periodically attempt to scale apps.

scale-apps-interval.description: This is the length of time, in milliseconds, between task scale apps.

ssl-keystore-password.description: Password for the keystore supplied with the `ssl_keystore_path` option. Required if `ssl_keystore_path` is supplied. May also be specified with the `MESOSPHERE_KEYSTORE_PASS` environment variable.

ssl-keystore-path.description: Path to the SSL keystore. HTTPS (SSL) will be enabled if this option is supplied. Requires `--ssl_keystore_password`. May also be specified with the `MESOSPHERE_KEYSTORE_PATH` environment variable.

store-cache.description: Enabled: (Default) Enable an in-memory cache for the storage layer. Disabled: Disable the in-memory cache for the storage layer.

task-launch-confirm-timeout.description: Time, in milliseconds, to wait for a task to enter the TASK_STAGING state before killing it.

task-launch-timeout.description: Time, in milliseconds, to wait for a task to enter the TASK_RUNNING state before killing it.

task-lost-expunge-gc.description: This is the length of time in milliseconds, until a lost task is garbage collected and expunged from the task tracker and task repository.

task-lost-expunge-initial-delay.description: This is the length of time, in milliseconds, before Marathon begins to periodically perform task expunge gc operations

task-lost-expunge-interval.description: This is the length of time in milliseconds, for lost task gc operations.

tracing.description: Enabled: Enable trace logging of service method calls. Disabled: (Default) Disable trace logging of service method calls.

webui-url.description: The HTTP(S) url of the web ui, defaulting to the advertised hostname.

zk.description: ZooKeeper URL for storing state. Format: zk://host1:port1,host2:port2,.../path

zk-compression.description: Enabled: (Default) Enable compression of zk nodes, if the size of the node is bigger than the configured threshold. Disabled: Disable compression of zk nodes

zk-compression-threshold.description: (Default: 64 KB) Threshold in bytes, when compression is applied to the ZooKeeper node.

zk-max-versions.description: Limit the number of versions, stored for one entity.

zk-session-timeout.description: The timeout for ZooKeeper sessions in milliseconds

zk-timeout.description: The timeout for ZooKeeper in milliseconds.

packages.preInstallNotes: We recommend a minimum of one node with at least 2 CPU shares and 1GB of RAM available for the Marathon DCOS Service.

name.description: The ID of this Marathon service inside DCOS base Marathon.

cpus.description: CPU shares to allocate to each Marathon instance.

mem.description: Memory (MB) to allocate to each Marathon instance.

instances.description: Number of Marathon instances to run.

uris.description: List of URIs that will be downloaded and made available in the current working directory of Marathon. For example this can be used to download a Java keystore file for SSL configuration.

heap-min.description: Memory (MB) start size for the JVM heap. This number should be be less or equals than the heap-max.

heap-max.description: Memory (MB) max size for the JVM heap. This number should be less than the memory allocated to the Marathon instance (General rule: 50%).

marathon.description: Marathon command line flags. These are the same flags that are passed through to Marathon when launching manually from the command line. See details here: https://mesosphere.github.io/marathon/docs/command-line-flags.html

access-control-allow-origin.description: The origin(s) to allow in Marathon. Not set by default. Example values are "*", or "http://localhost:8888, http://domain.com"

artifact-store.description: URL to the artifact store. Supported store types hdfs, file. Example: hdfs://localhost:54310/path/to/store, file:///var/log/store

assets-path.description: Set a local file system path to load assets from, instead of loading them from the packaged jar.

checkpoint.description: Enabled: (Default) Enable checkpointing of tasks. Requires checkpointing enabled on slaves. Allows tasks to continue running during mesos-slave restarts and upgrades Disabled: Disable checkpointing of tasks.

decline-offer-duration.description: (Default: 120 seconds) The duration (milliseconds) for which to decline offers by default

default-accepted-resource-roles.description: Default for the defaultAcceptedResourceRoles attribute of all app definitions as a comma-separated list of strings. This defaults to all roles for which this Marathon instance is configured to receive offers.

disable-http.description: Disable listening for HTTP requests completely. HTTPS is unaffected.

enable-features.description: A comma-separated list of features. Available features are: vips - Enable networking VIPs UI, task_killing - Enable the optional TASK_KILLING state, available in Mesos 0.28 and later, external_volumes - Enable external volumes support in Marathon

env-vars-prefix.description: Prefix to use for environment variables injected automatically into all started tasks.

event-stream-max-outstanding-messages.description: The event stream buffers events, that are not already consumed by clients. This number defines the number of events that get buffered on the server side, before messages are dropped.

event-subscriber.description: The event subscription module to use. E.g. http_callback.

executor.description: Executor to use when none is specified. If not defined the Mesos command executor is used by default.

failover-timeout.description: (Default: 1 week) The failover_timeout for mesos in seconds.

framework-name.description: (Default: service.name) Framework name to register with Mesos.

ha.description: Enabled: (Default) Run Marathon in HA mode with leader election. Allows starting an arbitrary number of other Marathons but all need to be started in HA mode. This mode requires a running ZooKeeper Disabled: Run Marathon in single node mode.

hostname.description: The advertised hostname that is used for the communication with the Mesos master. The value is also stored in the persistent store so another standby host can redirect to the elected leader.

http-address.description: The address to listen on for HTTP requests

http-credentials.description: Credentials for accessing the http service. If empty, anyone can access the HTTP endpoint. A username:password pair is expected where the username must not contain ':'. May also be specified with the `MESOSPHERE_HTTP_CREDENTIALS` environment variable.

http-endpoints.description: The URLs of the event endpoints added to the current list of subscribers on startup. You can manage this list during runtime by using the /v2/eventSubscriptions API endpoint.

http-event-callback-slow-consumer-timeou.description: A http event callback consumer is considered slow, if the delivery takes longer than this timeout (ms)

http-max-concurrent-requests.description: The number of concurrent HTTP requests that are allowed before rejecting.

http-port.description: The port to listen on for HTTP requests

http-realm.description: The security realm (aka 'area') associated with the credentials

https-address.description: The address to listen on for HTTPS requests.

https-port.description: The port to listen on for HTTPS requests

launch-token-refresh-interval.description: The interval (ms) in which to refresh the launch tokens to --launch_token_count

leader-proxy-connection-timeout.description: Maximum time, in milliseconds, to wait for connecting to the current Marathon leader from another Marathon instance.

leader-proxy-read-timeout.description: Maximum time, in milliseconds, for reading from the current Marathon leader.

local-port-max.description: Max port number to use when assigning globally unique service ports to apps.

local-port-min.description: Min port number to use when assigning globally unique service ports to apps.

logging-level.description: Set logging level to one of: off, error, warn, info, debug, trace, all

marathon-store-timeout.description: (deprecated) Maximum time, in milliseconds, to wait for persistent storage operations to complete. This option is no longer used and will be removed in a later release.

master.description: The URL of the Mesos master

max-apps.description: The maximum number of applications that may be created.

max-tasks-per-offer.description: Maximum tasks per offer. Do not start more than this number of tasks on a single offer.

mesos-leader-ui-url.description: The host and port (e.g. "http://mesos_host:5050") of the Mesos master.

mesos-role.description: (Default: service.name) Mesos role for this framework. If set, Marathon receives resource offers for the specified role in addition to resources with the role designation '*'.

metrics.description: Enabled: (Default) Expose the execution time of service method calls using code instrumentation via the metrics endpoint (/metrics). This might noticeably degrade performance but can help finding performance problems. Disabled: Disable exposing execution time of service method calls using code instrumentation via the metrics endpoing (/metrics). This does not turn off reporting of other metrics.

min-revive-offers-interval.description: Do not ask for all offers (also already seen ones) more often than this interval (ms).

offer-matching-timeout.description: Offer matching timeout (ms). Stop trying to match additional tasks for this offer after this time.

on-elected-prepare-timeout.description: The timeout for preparing the Marathon instance when elected as leader.

plugin-dir.description: Path to a local directory containing plugin jars.

reconciliation-initial-delay.description: This is the length of time, in milliseconds, before Marathon begins to periodically perform task reconciliation operations

reconciliation-interval.description: This is the length of time, in milliseconds, between task reconciliation operations.

revive-offers-repetitions.description: Repeat every reviveOffer request this many times, delayed by the --min_revive_offers_interval.

save-tasks-to-launch-timeout.description: Timeout (ms) after matching an offer for saving all matched tasks that we are about to launch. When reaching the timeout, only the tasks that we could save within the timeout are also launched. All other task launches are temporarily rejected and retried later.

scale-apps-initial-delay.description: This is the length of time, in milliseconds, before Marathon begins to periodically attempt to scale apps.

scale-apps-interval.description: This is the length of time, in milliseconds, between task scale apps.

ssl-keystore-password.description: Password for the keystore supplied with the `ssl_keystore_path` option. Required if `ssl_keystore_path` is supplied. May also be specified with the `MESOSPHERE_KEYSTORE_PASS` environment variable.

ssl-keystore-path.description: Path to the SSL keystore. HTTPS (SSL) will be enabled if this option is supplied. Requires `--ssl_keystore_password`. May also be specified with the `MESOSPHERE_KEYSTORE_PATH` environment variable.

store-cache.description: Enabled: (Default) Enable an in-memory cache for the storage layer. Disabled: Disable the in-memory cache for the storage layer.

task-launch-confirm-timeout.description: Time, in milliseconds, to wait for a task to enter the TASK_STAGING state before killing it.

task-launch-timeout.description: Time, in milliseconds, to wait for a task to enter the TASK_RUNNING state before killing it.

task-reservation-timeout.description: Time, in milliseconds, to wait for a new reservation to be acknowledged via a received offer before deleting it.

tracing.description: Enabled: Enable trace logging of service method calls. Disabled: (Default) Disable trace logging of service method calls.

webui-url.description: The HTTP(S) url of the web ui, defaulting to the advertised hostname.

zk.description: ZooKeeper URL for storing state. Format: zk://host1:port1,host2:port2,.../path

zk-compression.description: Enabled: (Default) Enable compression of zk nodes, if the size of the node is bigger than the configured threshold. Disabled: Disable compression of zk nodes

zk-compression-threshold.description: (Default: 64 KB) Threshold in bytes, when compression is applied to the ZooKeeper node.

zk-max-versions.description: Limit the number of versions, stored for one entity.

zk-session-timeout.description: The timeout for ZooKeeper sessions in milliseconds

zk-timeout.description: The timeout for ZooKeeper in milliseconds.

Please follow the instructions at http://docs.mesosphere.com/services/marathon/#uninstall to clean up any persisted state

leader-proxy-read-timeout.description: Maximum time, in milliseconds, for reading from the current Marathon leader.

leader-proxy-ssl-ignore-hostname.description: Do not verify that the hostname of the Marathon leader matches the one in the SSL certificate when proxying API requests to the current leader.

local-port-max.description: Max port number to use when assigning globally unique service ports to apps.

max-tasks-per-offer.description: Maximum tasks per offer. Do not start more than this number of tasks on a single offer.

mesos-authentication-secret-file.description: Path to a file containing the Mesos Authentication Secret.

reconciliation-interval.description: This is the length of time, in milliseconds, between task reconciliation operations.

task-launch-confirm-timeout.description: Time, in milliseconds, to wait for a task to enter the TASK_STAGING state before killing it.

task-launch-timeout.description: Time, in milliseconds, to wait for a task to enter the TASK_RUNNING state before killing it.

task-lost-expunge-gc.description: This is the length of time in milliseconds, until a lost task is garbage collected and expunged from the task tracker and task repository.

task-lost-expunge-initial-delay.description: This is the length of time, in milliseconds, before Marathon begins to periodically perform task expunge gc operations

task-lost-expunge-interval.description: This is the length of time in milliseconds, for lost task gc operations.

task-reservation-timeout.description: Time, in milliseconds, to wait for a new reservation to be acknowledged via a received offer before deleting it.

tracing.description: Enabled: Enable trace logging of service method calls. Disabled: (Default) Disable trace logging of service method calls.

zk-max-node-size.description: (Default: 1 MiB) Maximum allowed ZooKeeper node size (in bytes).

zk-max-versions.description: Limit the number of versions, stored for one entity.

zk-session-timeout.description: The timeout for ZooKeeper sessions in milliseconds
